text: Awesome food. Dessert was best cannoli I've tasted in the States. Service rocks, super laid back and friendly.

My second time coming here. The food is a must in Vegas!  Last time I came here the wait was a little long and service was so so, but the food by far made up for it. This time device has been great, also!!

Me and my husband saw this restaurant and dinner drive and dives in the foot network channel. And i said to myself next time we go to Vegas were going to check this place out so we did the pizza was awesome the suicide fries were too die for the service was awesome the people were so friendly I recommend this restaurant to everyone if your ever in Vegas you need to go to this place it's the bomb......

My time these days doesn't really allow for writing many Yelp reviews anymore, but I had to chime in with a four star review for a solid Las Vegas spot.  Unfortunately it seems that anytime Fieri stops by, the idiot reviewers come out of the woodwork. That's really the case here on Yelp, so let's clarify some things:  1) Yes, the restaurant is in Moondoggies, a bit of a dive bar.  That's mentioned ahead of time in all the press, so you're lame if you're going to ding them a star because you had to get a babysitter or you didn't like the vibe. The rest of us enjoy the booze, the Bills (not really, but you get the point) and the surroundings.  2) Yes, the suicide sauce (and fries, I assume) are spicy! I'm not really sure how one would think otherwise. Go to Tex Wasabis if you wan't faux tasting food.   3) Yes, this place is serving up a Buffalo-style pie. It boggles the mind how people just come in and say "not very good pizza" without more because they have no respect for the different types of pizzas one can get.  Alright, now that's all out of the way, so what'd we get that made me rant and rave so happily?  Stinger pizza - Absolutely delicious. One problem with Vegas eateries is that places often try to be trendy by throwing gut-busting ingredients into a dish without any conception for how they go together or how they leave you feeling. The buffalo chicken, steak, peppers and cheese on this dish seem like they'd have that problem (and might, if you eat the whole pie) but a slice on its own has an awesome flavor profile.  Royal sandwich - Simple, tasty and done right. Makes me miss their sandwich shop back when it was downtown.   If you like great food and know you're okay with a certain vibe, go...you won't regret it. If you don't, that's fine too...but don't write an unfair review of a place as a result.
I ate here with a friend and tried the suicide fries. They were hot, but delish!! We loved the atmosphere of the bar, and the bartender was hilarious.

Good food, crappy service.  Been here before,  but the service tonight was unacceptable.  We ordered a pizza,  fries and waters.  Had to wait long after our glasses were Empy for refils, and after we finished eating,  we waited over 30 minutes for our server to check in and see if everything was okay. At that point we simply wanted to leave and asked for a box and our check,  but we ended up waiting an extra 15 minutes for that. the place was not packed by any means.  The only positive was green olives on the pizza.....

This is where you go for pizza in Vegas. Only go somewhere else if you want to punish yourself for being bad. If for some reason you don't feel like pizza you will find the other food there to be top notch and sometimes a little scary because you would not expect the kind of quality and taste you get from here in a kitchen attached to a bar. Look out for the cute bartender, she'll steal your heart!

Best pizza I've ever had. Although initially put off by the look of it on the outside, the atmosphere is cool and laid back and the staff is friendly.   It's out of the way if you want to get away from the strip and it's totally worth it.
The Best. I order frequently and the quality and service is consistently excellent

Great atmosphere, great service, great pizza, for a dive bar.  I mean that in a good way.  This is the kind of place I wish we had in Stafford(We have dive bars with shitty food).  The bar and the restaurant are two separate entities and we received two separate bills, but who cares because everything was great.  A nice escape from the pretentious crap on the strip.  The pizza was the opposite of normal cookie cutter pizza with routine ingredients, and that is a wonderful thing.

I like this place a lot.  Great place for drinks and great food.  They make some very good specialty pizzas.  I will say I am a little disappointed they stopped making their Italian sausage (as featured on dine in , drive ins, and dives for the Guinie Pie)  and now use a cheaper substitute that is certainly not made in house.  My last Guinie Pie also had a lot less spinach and feta cheese then it had in the past.  :(

Birthday dinner!  Poutine Fries and Suicide Fries, "Fricken Huge" is a lot of food and a great price.  Pizza was pretty awesome too, the cheese was real and the sauce was very tasty.  Because my son was 18 we couldn't eat in the bar but we had excellent service next door at Desnudo Tacos.

My co-worker wanted to try this place after seeing it on some Food Network show; she came back with this huge pizza that had lots of cheese, huge slices of sausage, spinach and ricotta cheese. I have to say it was a pretty good pizza, it would have been AMAZING if it had some garlic added to the sauce. And the corners seem a little neglected from the sausage. But overall I am very happy & satisfied and would definitely try their food again! My mom used to go to Moon Doggies all the time for the drinks/gaming, I'll continue the tradition but instead of gaming it will be to eat!! Can't wait to try the fries, sandwiches, etc... And if they have Italian desserts then they'll never be rid of me!

Now this is a sandwich! They roast all of their meats in house, they also make all of the sides and their own pickles, which are incredible. Everything on the menu is great, but my favorite is the tri-tip sandwich. The tri-tip is perfectly seasoned, roasted to perfection and is best piled high on a kimmelwick bun. The tomato bisque soup is liquid crack. They have all of the usual toppings as well as a great garlic mayo and a killer green chili mustard.  The food is fantastic as is the staff.

If you don't mind the smell of smoke, you won't regret this place.  The service is slow  and not the friendliest but the food is very good.   We had the"back home" (?) Pizza with traditional wings. Both were very good.    Next time I'm in Vegas, I will definitely come here again.

We went to Naked City Pizza after seeing it on Diners Drive Inns and Dives. This location of Naked City Pizza is in a DIVE bar called Moondoggies. We had the stuffed mushrooms made with home made sausage and the Guinea pie! Both were absolutely delicious! What made the experience even better was our server Katie! She was so sweet and helpful even as she was serving, cooking, AND doing dishes! Katie was the bomb diggity and so was the food!

Overrated pizza. Just bc its on ddd doesn't mean it's the best thing on earth. Honestly had a cheese pizza and the cheese straight fell of the whole slice. How on earth can u mess up a cheese pizza. I could only imagine what would happen if u you got a pie with topping it would probably be a complete disaster. Look u want good pizza go to joes ny pizza, secret pizza. Or especially grimaldis if haven't been to the one in Brooklyn it's close to it but not the same. Look anyways if the owners are reading this get it together and make true pizza that falls apart.

Following the advice of Guy Fieri on Diners, Drive-In's and Dives, during  my recent travels to Las Vegas this past weekend we decided to try out Naked City Pizza Shop in Las Vegas, NV.     To my astonishment the customer service was subpar, and both the staff and environment seemed a bit culturally bias.  The Guinea's Pie was amazing!!! Though I prayed and hoped that my food wasn't tampered with during my visit.  However, I've never been in a restaurant establishment in this millennium, where I was treated like a "colored" person in the south during the Civil Right era in the 1960's, not only was I treated like an outcast due to my skin color/orientation, but racist paraphernalia befouling our nation's president laced the walls of the establishment.    At this point I'm unsure as a consumer if I should trust the Food Networks, Diners, Drive-In's and Dives television show or suggest that other foodies partake in visiting establishments featured on the show if the quality of service and environment is such as Naked City Pizza Shop.    Dine at your own risks!!

Went there twice in the past week, and ordered chicken wings. The wings were so small that I thought they were pigeon wings. C'mon... This guy is from buffalo, he knows that if he were to serve tiny chicken wing in Buffalo, we would have thrown it back at him (not literally). The flavor was there, its just that the size was a serious disappoinment. I think if he would have added extra wings to make up for the size I wouldn't be writing this..... PLEASE GET SOME NORMAL SIZE WINGS! or change your prices to reflect! We had 50 wings between 2 adults and 2 children. We ate the all and wanted more! When we go to your competitor, we usually have leftovers! Please make a change, because I dont want to go anywhere else. I like you r restaurant.

Pizza is my favorite food and I could eat it everyday. That being said, naked city is the best pizza I have found in Vegas. I have lived here almost a year, tried 15 different places and naked city it the best. The Guinea pie is perfection and I have had the stinger and the naked city as well. All of them were delicious but the Guinea pie was the best.  For appetizers, the suicide fries are only for the brave of heart. I love them but my boyfriend would not even try them. They are hot! The garlic buns are like cinnamon rolls but with no cinnamon and add garlic and cheese...aka awesome.  Finally the location, I personally love that this place in in a dive bar! It a not that scary like other reviews have said. I thought it was awesome. The service is ok. I have had great service and ok service but the food is worth any experience.   So if you have kids, don't come to this location but if you do not have children naked city pizza is the best pizza vegas has to offer.

My husband is in the military so we move around a lot. I'm originally from Buffalo, NY (home of awesome hockey and football and amazing wings!) and it's so hard to find pizza and wings that are actually good outside of the Buffalo area! There's NY style pizza, Chicago style pizza, real Italian pizza and then somewhere in the middle is Buffalo style pizza. Bubbly doughy crust, sauce that's not to acidic and not too sweet, the perfect ammount of nice molten cheese and little pepperonis that curl up and get nice and crispy. You can't get it outside of Buffalo unless you are from the 716, move and then open a shop. And that's exactly what happened! Saw this place on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives after just moving to Vegas and I hightailed it to this dive bar with the best pizza and wings west of Buffalo. It's really the ONLY place to get good wings. And probably the only place outside of Buffalo you can get a chicken finger sub (which is the best of both worlds!)! They have Loganberry (a HUGE hit with me!) and make inhouse blue cheese sauce. As long as we are stationed here, I will be going there for my pizza! ONLY complaint is that they don't have Costanzo's rolls :(
Food was really good!  Pizza was delicious.  Suicide Fries were great, not for the soft pallet for sure. Bar feel with good range of drinks.  Mostly a whiskey bar and not with cocktails.

My husband and I ate here last week.  Everything was great.  We ordered traditional,  Sicilian and Suicide wings.  All were great but suicide are my favorite.  Love that they are served with blue cheese not ranch. The suicide wings are super hot, just the way I like my wings.  The traditional are great and the Sicilian were a great non-traditional wing ( parmesan cheese and garlic).  We also ordered a pizza with pepperoni,  and hot peppers.   This pizza had a great assortment of peppers and great flavors.   I love hot and spicy food and Naked City doesn't disappoint.  Please note separate checks for food and the beer we ordered.   No issue for me, just a note so no one is surprised.

******DO NOT GO EAT TO THIS PLACE **** First of all I want to say  their customer service just sucks they are completely rude their wings are disgusting do not order that ever anyways I got my pizza and as I'm taking a bite on my slice of pizza I'm biting until this long piece of long black hair it was so disgusting I wouldn't recommend this place to nobody the place look like a dump it does not look sanitize is just very disgusting I really thought it was going to be like a little hole in the wall where there  where their food is going to be amazing but no it was disgusting I would never go there in my whole entire life I don't recommend it to no one.
dont be afraid of the location of dive bar , bartenders were very freindly , clean bathroom and the pizza was very good.

I have been to this location twice now. It is tucked away in a bar called Moondoggies on the corner of Desert Inn and Arville. Once you enter, there is a small window where you place your order. I ordered the first pizza on the specialty pies list, called The Stinger. Each bite was a different combination of delicious flavors, from the crispy chicken tenders, spicy peppers, melted cheese, and fresh, piping-hot steak. Needless to say, I dream about this pizza when we're not together. The sides are great and perfect for both a pizza restaurant and a bar. Had the poutine fries, and if you've never had them, they are as weirdly delicious as you think they'd be.  Service is standard. I've never had a bad experience, and though its never been exceptional either, I don't mind it. You really don't get attentive service here, but remember, you just ordered this pizza from a small window inside a bar on Arville. The product is the star here, and they have something beautiful.  Final thoughts: Not many restaurants take the risks this place does. I mean, who puts steak AND chicken tenders on a pizza? But that's exactly what makes this place one of a kind. It is a must try.

Boo not kid friendly. Saw this on food network and on diner dives...wanted to try it. I guess My family and I won't be trying their lovely pizza. Also that place looks ratched anyways. They need to build a place so we can come here geez there are tons of places for adults y deprive us of the awesome pizza so disappointed.

We made an order for a pizza with suicide fries. We ordered it online. We waited 20 minutes before driving so when we got there we would expect to only wait about 10 more minutes or so. When we got there they said they just were starting the order. I asked how long it would take. The lady said she did not know since they just ran out of cheese... We told them to cancel it and left

Great pizza. We tried The Back Home with the garlic crust so soft and delicious. Suicide fries lived up to their name. Hot wings meaty and crisp. Cold draft beer. Relaxed atmosphere, great music. I'd recommend for some late night quality drunk food.

I placed a 60 dollar order and left 10 bucks for the delivery driver via the online ordering system. I received a call about 15 minutes later saying that they don't deliver to the strip. This place is literally a mile and a half away from my hotel.   It's sad that a "Buffalo" bar would turn down a big order from a former buffalonian (which they could tell from my 716 area code). What a shame.

Best East Coast pizza this side of the Mississippi! Even though our order is a tad complicated, they always get it right. We appreciate that they have Raspberry Cider and the garlic knots are an excellent excuse for warding off unwanted male suitors.
Standard bar pizza - not much more.  Not sure why Guy Fieri made such a big deal about this place. Smoking is permitted in the bar.

The pizza is so good and so cheap. It is greasy but in the best possible way. If you eat it after a night out, you will not have a hangover. I got a sandwich of some kind instead one time and that was a mistake. Just get the pizza.
Great food....but, just hope for at least one male working in the kitchen. If it's two girls, your order could take up to at least an hour before it ready. 2 girls=run. 1guy 1girl=order up

So bummed, went again and though my order was identical it was disappointing. Why does everything in Vegas that's so good always change so abruptly? Sandwich was 4 or 5" shorter and served to go in Styrofoam so sogginess was going to be an issue. I may try again but not in a hurry to like last visit. Kinda sad.

Big fan of the food, especially their Suicide Fries! Those bad boys are hot hot hot. I enjoy that it's located inside of one of my favorite dive bars in town. Their bartenders Artie and James are by far their standouts. Both are very friendly, attentive and make you feel right at home.

After hearing about naked city pizza from some friends and reading the reviews I thought I'd try it for the first time. I had great expectations. I was disappointed. I ordered a cheese pizza. The crust was cooked well. That's really all I can say that's good about it. The pizza had no taste. While eating it it reminded me of a frozen pizza and that's not saying much. There are many other pizza places in the area and I'm going to try those. This will be my last time at Naked City Pizza
We came starving and the service is REALLY slow even though our friend was known by the server because she's somewhat of a regular. Super divey bar, no need to dress up...or wear clean clothes.

This is about the new location on Paradise.  I ordered on the phone for takeout, the half pizza with peperoni on half and garlic buns.  She read my order back, told her it would be 20 mins.  When we got there, the cook did a 1/4 size pizza not the 1/2, the girl looked on the order and it did say 1/2.  So, they asked if we wanted the other 1/2.  Yes, we had to wait 10 mins , they did not say they were sorry, they did not comp us for their mistake.  Then when we got the pizza home, it was wrong.  The peperoni was on all the pizza and the pizza was burnt.  Very disappointed!  Not sure when we will be back to eat here again soon.   Also, the cook in the kitchen was slamming things down and looked very unhappy!

This is one of those dive bars that is a must, slots at the bar and a hole in the wall to order some of the best pizza I have ever had and the salad was top notch as well. All of the food that I saw come out of that hole in the wall looked good. Hope James is working when you go, he was the man!!!

This pizza is AMAZING and the chicken wings are crunchy and juicy!!!  Heard about NCP on Diners, Drive-Ins, Dives and had to go.  Its' in a bar called Moon Doggies well off the strip.  A funky little bar with a little pizza order window.  Absolutely delicious - can't say enough about it.  The bar/pizza staff were very friendly and we had a great time there.  Well worth the trip - don't be put off by the parking lot - its really not a used car lot :)  A place to make time for ... for sure.
Went on a Sunday night the wings were dry and the pizza was nothing special. They forgot to make my pizza and had to ask the bartender twice for my drink he was to busy doing shots.

I love this place. Im from so cal so when we get to vegas we have to get naked city fix. The pizza here is amazing. Im a fan of dive bars so the fact that its located inside moon doggies is awesome. We ordered the steak and cheese and it was great. It was cover with steak, cheese, and peppers. One of best pizzas I have ever eaten. If you want great pizza in the vegas area you have to eat here.

Ordered a massive pizza, sheet pan size. It was a deluxe type with all the typical toppings on it.  it was very good.  The group loved it.  If you need pizza for a group, this is the place for you.  Nice and spicy. About $30.  The cook was very friendly and conscious of his work, which is always good.

Look! It's a pawn shop.. it's a tattoo parlor.. Nope, nope- it's a Dive Bar- that happens to serve delicious pizza. So, if you have seen Diners, Drive- Ins and Dives then you've heard of this Dives mythical existence.  If you blink you will miss this pizza bar as it is disguised as a plethora of places that have nothing to do with pizza. There is a 2nd hurdle being the point of entrance hidden as something of a speakeasy. Being the adamant foodie extraordinaire that I am, I defeated the resistance & entered the dark, smokey cave.   Rapid fire 1st impression: - A dozen compressed bar stool cushions beneath the cheeks of replicated "Norm's" & "Woody's". - Bartender smoking a cig. (no extra charge) - Red solo cups for anything N/A. - Food orders are placed thru a small window reminiscent of a roach coach. - Nobody other than fellow treasure hunters acknowledge your existence.  - Sanitation? Questionable.  With all that said, the pizza was worthy of reoccurring business & the garlic fries were average. Spoken camaraderie with fellow dining patrons made this experience all the better. Put this place on the list of "must eats". Not for the thin skinned.

The pizza here is always good nice and hot. It's a little small inside but it's cool because it gives you that new York pizzeria feeling. I always recommend this place when someone is looking for good pizza. It can be hard to spot when your heading down Paradise because it's a small location but just keep a look out for it when you past Harmon street and the hard Rock Cafe if your driving south on paradise.

I cannot express how awesome this food is! The owner Chris is extremally friendly and attentive to details and you can tell there is a lot of pride in their food! DO NOT MISS the Buffalo Chicken Dip on the app menu. I wanted to lick the bowl! Also- if the special that week/day is the homemade pretzels.... order 2 or 3 orders. He makes Auntie Anne's pretzels look foolish :) Yes- its in a dive bar....but thats part of the appeal. Just go with it and enjoy the experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I heard they had poutine here, and I had to check it out for myself. Moon Doggies has a great atmosphere and good energy. I ordered the poutine to go, and they were clever, keeping the gravy separate from the fries and cheese, so the fries wouldn't get soggy as I drove home.  Now, the only downside I can give is that they used shredded mozzarella cheese, instead of cheese curds, so when I dumped the gravy, the cheese became one big layer of melted cheese, instead of mixing with the fries as it's meant to happen.  So, be sure to mix the cheese with the fries before you dump the gravy on, or just eat there and let them do it for you...either way, the fries are good, and the gravy is salty, which is how I generally like it. But, mixed with the mozz (which is salty, as well) it can be a little over-powering. So, be prepared for that possibility.  Would I go back? Definitely. It's too good to let a few small issues keep me away.
Anyone who likes this pizza truly knows nothing about pizza. Awful still in a dingy dive bar. Triple D is usually on the mark but not in this instance.

The food is great.  At least the Guinea Pie and the fries.    Unfortunately, we didn't knew the kitchen is also a Pub and minors are not allowed.  To solve that, the restaurant has a place next to the main restaurant but there are no connecting door between the two real states.  This makes the one attendant to be running back and forward from the main Pub to the family restaurant making the service slow and some times you feel as abandoned.   So adults, if want enjoy a beer with your pizza and/or are with your family better think in order to go.

If I could give less than one star I would. This place deserves like -5 stars. Customer service is TERRIBLE. Took an hour for a single pizza that we were taking out. Didn't tip the cook because frankly why should I tip him to do his job. He doesn't have to wait on me or go out of his way in any form. I order a pizza for take out, from the little window inside a dive bar, all he has to do is make it. You know, his job. So, the whole time we were there waiting, and waiting some more, he's bringing out other customers food that were dining in EVEN THOUGH I ordered my pizza before they even walked into the establishment. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. Never again will I step foot into this place. It is a shame. The whole experience was a blatant disregard of customer service. I don't mind taking my business elsewhere.
the best pizza i've ever had...ever. atmosphere might not be for everyone but if you want the best pizza crust you've ever had this is the place.

This place is a true dive, but if you can get decent service its worth the effort! We arrived and stood in the doorway for several minutes, the place was busy, but mostly at the bar! We were finally seated, our waitress, was abviously busy, acted as tho we were more of a hindrance than customers, but we had a TV with a good college basketball game on so we didn't let the sloooow service keep us from bailing out! The food was very tasty, greasy pizza, a large pan of garlic fries and soda pop! The portions are very large, the prices not exorbitant and the place was loud! Having seen episodes on the travel channel and food network we wanted to give it a try! Overall, we would come back but only if we we not pressed for time and wanted some good greasy grub!

Naked city pizza by far has the best pizza I've ever had! Their garlic knots are amazing because the more you keep eating them, the more cheesier it gets. At first it was little bit hard to find just because it's inside Moon Doggies bar; but just go inside and there will a place to order in the back corner. It's pretty dope because you get to eat some delicious pizza and drink some beer. Can't go wrong. BUT!..make sure that if you're going to this location you are 21 yrs or older because they do card you.

You love dive bars? You love cheap beer? You love TOP QUALITY NOSH?  You will LOVE this place.  Great bar to bring out-of-towners to; no strip-priced drinks, casual atmosphere and mind-blowing foodgasms.  It's got a super comfortable feel, as there's no dress code or VIP list to worry about, friendly bar-staff and anything you order is going to create some major-mouth-happiness.  I dig it.

Yes- It's in a Dive Bar (Moon Doggies), but it was Clean, Yes- Don't bring the kids (Not Allowed Under 18), Yes - they play Loud Grunge Rock type music, Yes - It's not in the Best part of town. But if any of your Yuppie tendencies keeps you from coming here it's your loss. One of The Best Pizza Joints anywhere with Fresh High Quality Ingredients at a moderate price. Think more of the village in NY than fake facade tourist trap Las Vegas.

We had the Back Home pizza. Good meats and lots of cheese but the crust was a little too soft for my liking (slice would sag when you picked it up).  Hot wings were juicy.  The suicide Fries are so tasty but can set your mouth of fire if you're not careful.  Music was good (Johnny Cash).   Service was ok for bar standards.   Overall it was good but far from great.

I had the poutine. I was a little worried about this place when saw it because it looked like a run down bar. I ordered from the side. The poutine was good and fresh. curds with gravy and fries great. 3 for the small and 5 for the large. Unless you are eating with a couple of people get the small as I eat a lot but could not finish the food.

I am not a fan of bars but I would have eaten here every day of our trip had my husband been agreeable. The staff was excellent and the food even better. We had medium wings and a Naked City Pizza. The food was delicious. I was super pleased. The prices ... oh my gosh - so inexpensive. I loved the place, despite the location, tho - it adds to the experience, so all in all, I wouldn't change a thing!

My husband and I were at the outlets downtown and wanted some quick yummy food on the way home. We'd driven by Naked City more than a few times and decided to stop in. The place smelled awesome. I had the tri-tip on kimmelweck with garlic mayo and cheddar. I've eaten a lot of sandwiches (in some great sandwich shops) in my life and this one ranks right up there. The meat is incredible, but the kimmelweck is what really won me over. We will definitely be back soon.
The pizza is amazing!!!!! We looove the Naked City and Guinea Pie. Also the Philly Cheesesteak Rolls are fabulous! It's a must stop while in Vegas!!!

I saw this place on DDD and decided i had to try it the next time I was in Vegas. I sure am glad. Alright here is the breakdown...  It's a dive bar. One door in and a back door. When you walk in, the bar is on the right and there is seating on the left. It's not very big. There are only about 9 tables. I can only imaging what this place is like on the weekend or for dinner. (They do offer take out) We went at 12:15 on a Wednesday afternoon. There were only 2 tables available. Phew. The service was slow, but there was only one guy working his ass off. We weren't in a hurry, so that wasn't a problem for us. Now, on to the food/drinks....  So it's a full bar. Any drink you want, they can make it. I had a Bloody Mary and wow! They make their own mix and its great. Perfectly spicy and didn't include the usual accompanying "salad"... Only a lime wedge. : )  Food... I wanted pizza. I ordered two 1/4 sheet pizzas (6 square slices each). I'm only going to mention the one off the menu because it was AMAZING! The steak and cheese pizza. First off they use a white garlic sauce instead of red sauce for this pizza. (I HIGHLY recommend having this sauce over the red sauce if you make your own pizza combo. It is so tasty.) Then steak, cheese and jalapeño peppers top the pizza. Hands down the best tasting pizza I've ever had.   I'm so looking forward to going back the next time I'm in vegas. : )

Wow i am shocked!!! I've been the HUGE fan of naked city inside moon doggies bar and hubby took me today for a Mother's day favorite!  Wow the server and her bus girl are absolutely horrible!! Since naked city opened a new restraunt I will be traveling there. The server stands at the bar chatting with guys and ignores all her customers.  We were never checked on. And we waved down the bus girl Cuz we had to go we needed our check. and she saw us 3 times and pretended not to see us. Hubby finally said "hi" and she rolled her eyes and say "ya" naked city in moon doggies u not only were rude you got our entire order wrong u really ruined the experience for me. I will not return .  Service was the worst I e ever had anywhere!!
Awesome pizza. Awesome suicide fries. Awesome stuffed mushrooms. Awesome fried dough. Simply awesome!!

I've been to naked city multiple times and it always hot and delicious. Music is great and the beer is ice cold. If you're looking for a thick crust pizza this place is the best! I suggest the GUINEA PIE!

Some of the worst customer service I have experienced! Was told pizza would take 20 minutes waited 39 minutes! First time their first time ordering, person taking the order very impatient and had an attitude. Place is kinda dirty. Pizza was good but they're stingy with the ingredients mostly bread. Would not recommend or go back. There is better pizza places in Las Vegas. Owner need to redeem his name and work on customer service and be more generous with the ingredients

Hands down, the best pizza in Vegas. The kitchen is located inside a dive bar "Moon Doggies" which in itself is a really popular spot to wet your whistle and play some video poker along with the great eats.  Bring an appetite.

A heads up here - the Las Vegas Boulevard location is now closed, and the entire Naked City product line, sandwiches, pizza, pasta, chicken wings and all sorts of good stuff, is now found at the Naked City Pizza location, at Moon Doggies (3249 South Arville, just off of Desert Inn). The same quality ingredients, and the same quality control, is coming from the kitchen.

This was a fun place.  The service was excellence.  I'm glad triple d put this place on tv - it was worth it.  We give it a 4 out 5 just because the seating was tight.  We went to UNO pizza in Chicago and sat on the other side of at two seat table that was big enough for a goldfish, kind of reminded us of that....
Customer service was sub par @ the DI/Arville location. The employees seemed annoyed with being there. The pizza and wings were pretty tasty, although a bit pricey.

Definitely pick this over the Paradise location if you can make it over here. Way better food, way better atmosphere- it's in a punk rock bar. Like another reviewer said, if you don't like that then don't go there.

This place has a great vegetarian sandwich. Its not the standard subway cold sub or the regular 'roasted vegetable/portobello' sandwich.   I like to get it on the kimmelweck roll (coarse salt and seeds on top) with muenster cheese. The veggie filling is a mash glob of seasoned veggies. I kind of like how the veggies are sloppy style. Very flavorful!  The tomato bisque, cold dill fingerling potatoes (when they make it with sour cream, NOT mayo), giardinaire (pickled veggies done well!) and the habanero giganto pickle are all so very good!  Looks like they opened a pizza shop as well that I have yet to try... wondering if its just as unique and good?  On a side note, just a few bar stools in the tiny front room and 2 outdoor tables... I usually do take-out.

This place is good, but it's really not THAT good when it comes to the food. I would say the food here is 100% overpriced. Plus, they already makes tons of money on alcohol sales, so they really should lower their food prices. Appearances on tv dont make the food taste better.   They finally opened up a family dinning section but it is closed a lot, so expect to leave when you arrive if you brought kids.

This is by far the best pizza in Vegas. the staff is great and the atmosphere is awesome. Jesse the chef has sat with me many times to make sure the food is good and just to talk. the juke box is killer.
Mailer flier I got said operations 11am to 11pm, yelp says 9pm. Called at 8:03pm, told me they stop delivery at 8pm. Figure it out.

Called in a pizza order at 8:40 and they said to pick it up in 25 to 30 minutes. We drove over to the restaurant and we were there by 9 and they were closed! Totally dark and locked up. We called them back and no one would answer. The lady that took our order did not inform us that they were not going to be making our pizza and that they would be closed. I couldn't even believe what was happening. Horrible experience and too bad because I have heard their pizza was good.

This place was amazing! Possibly the best pizza I've had in vegas...possibly.  The pizza that I purchased (I believe it was something like the back home pizza) was just okay. One of my friends got the chicken finger pizza and it was AMAZING! Loved it! Worth a second, third, and fourth visit!   Also, the loaded potato fries were good!

This dive bar was super quiet when we were there, but it was a Wednesday night at 10pm. The booths are great to enjoy a meal, although that late you have to go up and order food at the kitchen and drinks at the bar. The portions are HUGE and filling. We got the smallest size pizza and it would have been enough between two, but we wanted to try the suicide fries. Those bad boys are HOT. Super hot. Be warned.

I got a quarter sheet of cheese pizza... it's pretty good! The crust is thicker than average, and surrounds the edge of the rectangular sheet. The pizza is good, and the beer is cold and relatively cheap. The reason they're not getting 5 stars is because it's a bit too smokey in there, plus the edge of the crust on the pizza goes a little too far into the pizza. Give them a try if you are nearby!

Came here for some late night pizza. The pizza was, as always, delicious, but the service was absolutely horrible. The bar tenders took 45 min to take our order and made us wait while they "changed shifts" which included them changing out the drawer and then goofing off and taking shots together. The male bartender was exceptionally rude and never even bothered to ask us if we needed a drink refill. Total of an hour and a half and we were served one beer. Waited anther 20 minutes for a to go box and to pay. They only helpful person there was the cook. I failed to mention that my friend and I were the only 2 people in the entire place. Both bar tenders should be fired.

I so wanted this to be a great pizza place because it is the closest pp to our house. Read all reviews and realized quickly everyone has different tastes so I should stop depending on FOOD reviews. My husband got the Naked City & I got the Guinnea(reviews & menu say it has meatballs but it was a flat piece of meat that I thought was sausage). Have to say these were different than any other pizza I have eaten. I cannot understand how an Italian named Guy Fieri could call this good. The place is a dive, but I wouldn't care if the food was good. I will go back to try a sandwich but it better be a whole lot better than the pizza. On the Food Network website someone says this place was featured on the local news segment of Dirty Dining...if you ever saw some of these places that are closed down by the Clark County Board of Heath it would literally make you sick. The poster said it was reinspected and reopened (I read this review after eating the pizza). It has become VERY popular because of the segment on Diners, Driveins & Dives, very disappointing but another restaurant featured on "Chopped" called Rosemary's diner isn't a dissapointment and we go there again, it is a breakfast & lunch place only. Another recommended foodie recommended place is right next door to Moondoggies(Naked City Pizza) it is called Desuno tacos,if you order food from both NCP and Desuno they will let you eat your food at Desuno, good to know if you have kids, but you must have ordered from both places. The crust was like bread, not pizza dough...granted you got a lot of food for the money, but I wasn't impressed to go back for pizza, I will try the sandwiches and review that at a later time. All in all the people that gave this pizza 5 stars must have gotten drunk before they ate, just sayin' 3 stars is being generous.

Excellent. Location is tricky for non-locals and the non-adventurous. It is well worth the walk or drive. The turkey and the tri-tip scream quality. I've had the royal (Italian sausage) and it was good but stick with the turkey and beef. Definitely go for the Weck.

We returned for that deliciously sinful buffalo chicken dip. We also ordered a half sheet of the Pizza Bianco. Three of us filled up and we still had a few slices leftover. We reheated them the next day and I'd say those slices were even better than fresh. Nice flavor, thick crust. I wouldn't hestitate to order it again. I'm told the Bacon & Eggs is really special. I might just have to give that a whirl.

I found this place while watching diners drive-ins and dives. Guy said their meatball ricotta was awesome so I had to check it out. The pizza was out of this world. Coming from the east cost I found most pizza out here sucks. This place is now one of my favorites. Looks like they have a large menu of bar food to choose from. If your looking at pizza and wings for a park your ass Saturday or Sunday in football season check this place out.

Definitely a dive, but in all the right ways.  The waitress was nice, helpful, and quick (and really cute too).  The suicide fries definitely bring the heat, but it doesn't linger too long, so you're not wishing for death later in the night. Nice and hot while you're eating, but gone when you're out in the casinos later that night.  The Guinea's Pie pizza was excellent. Probably one of the better pizza's I've had, if we're being honest. The meatballs on the pizza are awesome by themselves, but combined with the ricotta, garlic sauce, spinach, and mozzarella it really turns into something super-powered.  Stop by if you're in Vegas, you'll be glad you did.

Arrived in LV Wed. afternoon and decided to stop in Naked City Pizza as I always try to check out eateries that I've never been before. Well, here's the official word from the White Hat, "Just do it"  I don't know why people complain about being neglected? I talked to two servers and Mike the owner. Had a great conversation. Mike even brought over a couple of tacos from his taco shop next door to check out. Great too!  Pizza on a scale of 1-10 rates a 10. Then Mike told me of the other place his brother runs across and down the street from Hard Rock Cafe where they do fresh pasta everyday! I will make it there, next stop for sure. You gotta try at least two small pizzas cause taking the rest to hotel was a treat to eat by the pool! Enjoy!

Great place to eat, drink and watch football. Guinea pie and suicide fries are a MUST. Although I preferred this place when they had full table service, I will still continue to bring my friends. Wish it was not so close to the bar (smoke) and I wish I could bring my kids..

how this place made some show with guy fieri, i dont know, must be a favor of a friend who owns the place or something.  the pizza doesnt have enough toppings on it.  the taste wasnt any good.  i ordered a not so wee (which is equivalent to their medium) with pepperoni and mushroom.  wouldnt go back if it were free.
We'll my review is only based on the fact that nobody came to our table to wait on us. After 10 minutes of sitting there with nobody  paying attention to us, we got up and left.
Love the loaded fries, the medium wings are bomb. Not to mention the pizza is amazing with the fluffy crust, delicious sauce and REAL cheese. Soooooo good!

Best pizza in the city! Suicide fries are BOMB! The bar gets busy at completely random times so you never know how long of a wait for beer or food, but the staff run their butt of making sure efveryone is taken care of. If you only go to one place in Vegas, make this your stop!
Great pizza place.  Super dive though.  Hard to find because it's inside a bar. 21 and up only.  Great food!
Came in twice, wasn't impressed both times, poutine is not authentic had some pizza chimichanga things I came in once at 4pm and at 10:00pm same results. I tried!

good food, but shitty service..waited over an hour for a little.pizza on a slow night, finally went up to ask what was wrong and our order wasnt even in the system! Whats worse is my girlfriend is pregnant and you can tell, so needless to say she was very hungry, and no one offered to apologize by comping us a salad or anything. Then when our pizza finally made it to the table our server had an attitude and just "here" dropped it and left :/ sorry dont think pizza is worth the attitude, dont think we'll be back :(

I don't really understand the great ratings for this place, I'm hoping I caught them on a bad night.  I'll be brief.  The pizza was nothing special and the service was God awful.    The people watching was great, if watching a couple dry hump is your thing.  Most of the bar patrons were DEEEEEEEE runk.  Note that I had been drinking and was pretty far from sober myself.  I'll be back in the area to eat next door at Desnudo Tacos, but doubt I'll eat here again.  That is all.
Without a doubt one of the best meals I've ever had. Fantastic pizza. Hot, crispy, plump wings. And epic donuts. So, so good. Don't be fooled by the crappy strip mall/liquor store vibe. Excellent.

So I first tried this pizza at a catered attorney party and let's just say it has left an impression! Oh My So So Good!!!! To think this is coming from a girl born and raised in Chicago so I know a thing about pizza.  I literally got home that night and had to google where it was located.   Definitely will stop in the near future! Give it a try I think you will be pleased you did.

My family ate there three years ago. It was the most amazing pizza ever. We took pics posted everywhere. We met up in Vegas and all we heard was everyone wanted naked pizza. We had to order pick up because one of us was 7. We ordered but this time after bragging about them not only was awful. The order wrong. When I called letting them know, they flipped it around on me. We ordered pizza poutine wings. The only thing that came out right  were the wings. That's why there's 1 star. The pizza was burnt top and bottom. We asked for sausage & mushrooms on half and pepperoni & pineapple on other. We got pepperoni only. We ordered poutine and only got fries. I called and told them what we got once back at hotel and I was to I should have checked it. I sent my two nephews and husband who like most trust they get what I ordered. Really?!? How rude and wrong. I tried to get it corrected and was blown off. If you want talk about this again reach out.
The Guinea pie was delicious as always!  I've never had a bad experience at Naked City.  Just go there!

I love this place and I love the owners but I am literally devastated that my pizza logs are NOT your normal pizza logs. They are half the size and lame. I was charged what your normal logs cost- someone should have said you're out of the regular ones. I hope to god they're not these ones from now on!!!

Some of the best pizza I've had outside of NYC metro area.  Service was non existant.  You have to order under a sign that says "orders" and then get your own paper plates and napkins.  Kinda weird but in a good way?  A welcomed change to the  nonsense of the strip.
Don't be scared off by the look of this place. Amazing pizza and super hot suicide fries! Staff is great!

Not sure what the hype is here. Have tried pizza on Paradise Rd and did not like it at all. Crust style too thick for me & it was supposed to have fresh mozzarella & basil which neither were on it. Had grandmas meatballs, suicide fries, and a Ceasar salad here. The meatballs were a joke! Sliced not even round..like hard mini meatloaf & salty as hell! My Sicilian grandma would roll over in her grave. Although I must say the suicide fries were wonderful!! Why 2 stars. Haven't got to the salad yet. No desire to try anything else except for fries.....too bad for a pizza place

Since we didn't get a chance to even try the food tonight, this review is based solely on the customer service.  We had some friends that posted pictures on Facebook and it looked delicious so we decided to check it out.  We went in a little before 6pm on Monday evening.  There wasn't a sole around - no customers and no employees. We figured they would be doing something in the back and would be around shortly. We sat down,found some menus and picked out our food, and waited.  We started yelling towards the back. No answer.  We walked into the back area and even around by the register.  Not safe at all but never saw anyone. When we eventually gave up, we saw Moondoggies next door and went in there to see if they knew what had happened and they have a window to Naked City.  We went to the window where we could see three workers chatting away.  The two girls looked at us and pointed to each other.  The blonde girl drew the short straw and had to deal with the customers.  I explained that we were waiting next door for quite a while but that there wasn't anybody there.  In a very accusatory manner, she told me that she was the only one working on that side and she had to step out for a minute to get some boxes.  The word choice wasn't the best but could be overlooked.  Her obvious inability to tell time might even be overlooked but imagine a 5 year old princess right after you take away her ice cream.  This was the attitude that we encountered.  It was obviously insulting to her that we had the audacity to want to eat in a semi-timely manner and we immediately walked out.  There was no way we were getting spit-free food.    The food may in fact be very good but I'll never know.

Only thing wrong with bar that I could find is it is a bit of a dive, if you really consider that a problem, which I don't! While I can't rate all the food the guineas pie was off the hook!!!!!!! The pricing was great 4 of us ate and had drinks and we're less than $50 bucks with tip

When you first arrive to this restaurant, you seem a bit hesitant. A pizza joint near China town seems a bit curious, but the pizza is delicious! Don't let the run down pub turn you away; their rectangular pizzas glisten with oil but man, is it delicious. Our table ordered a Frickin Huge (which is actually very huge, about a 13" x 9" pie) Naked City pizza. The pepperoni and sausage they use are very flavorful on their own and enhance the overall flavor of the pizza. The peppers and onions also adds a nice crunchy texture to the pie.   Did not think I would like this pizza shop much, but left definitely wanting to come back.

Dive bar. In a shady area, but WAY worth it. Some of the best pizza in Vegas and by far the BEST Caesar salad (bc of the dressing) I've had. I order the guinea pie every time. And they have beer towers. Always a plus. But the pizza is just the best.

Stopped in for the pizza since it had been featured on Dives, Diners and Drive-Ins.  This place is unabashedly a dive.   It was pretty busy, so service was slow. It looked like there was one waitress (Possibly two) for everywhere that wasn't a bar.  She was friendly, but if you are going somewhere after dinner, plan accordingly.  When we arrived there was a hockey game on, so the sound from the game wasn't too much of a distraction, but when they turned off the game and put on the music, WOW IT WAS LOUD. I mentioned how absurdly loud it was, but the waitress was either deaf from always listening to loud music or didn't hear me. Bring your ear plugs if you are averse to loud noises.  Seriously, Airplane takeoff's are not this loud. The volume was up so loud that one of the speakers would occasionally cut out.  The Pizza we ordered was very good, and even at the "Wee" size is enough for two.  We saw a table of three order the "Frickin' Huge" size and I doubt they were able to finish it.  It wasn't the best Pizza I've ever had, but it is certainly deserving of its reputation of a good pie.  Overall, if we were to return in future visits to Vegas we would get our Pizza to go. The loud noise, in addition to the bar smoke (Its a bar, so I expect people to smoke, especially in Vegas, the worlds largest smoking area) make the ambiance a little more dive than I'd like to spend time in.

Thank you, Trey for helping us deliver food to those in need and to people helping them! Although we are not local, we send love to Las Vegas through you. We will definitely need to come try your food on our next trip. Lots of love xx
Suicide fries are to die for! :) Spicy, but if you can tolerate it, they're totally worth it! Also had the Guinea pizza. Delicious! I would also recommend the chicken wings!

I went not even a week ago I had won $1500 on sports parlays and offered to treat 2 of my friends to pizza and beer .One of my friends recommended this spot I ordered 2 quarter pizzas and a half Double sausage and pepperoni with extra cheese there was like no sausage very little the extra cheese was there and it was not worth it .I'll stick to Rossetti pizza or Metro in Ellis island

Decided to try after watching DDD on foodtv. The food was AMAZING! We had the chicken finger dip (spicy Buffalo goodness!) Hot wings, the guinea pizza, and steak and cheese pizza. Everything was phenomenal! They had a delicious homemade ranch with the wings that I almost spooned out of the cup!  The only issues we had was with the service. She was very nice just slow. Our appetizers came out the same time as our pizza which made a lot to eat at once. Our drinks sat empty a few times as well.  Other than slow service we would recommend this place to friends. With a service warning label. Wish we would have found this place before we were about to have a baby!

everyone who claims this pizza is super bomb,must be on crack!  b.s. toppings!! no flavor meatball!!  pound for pound one of the weakest pies i ever had ever.. & yes i know thats a bold statement to say,but i had better pizza in north texas then here,what a damn shame!! i tried this place 2 times. the other was the diners,dumpsters and dives special pizza ,and i had issues with my stomach afterwards. thought lets try another pie i said. when it got home we all were disgusted by the weak toppings & made my other family members to vow never to return to this b.s. place ever,not even for wings. if i could i would give this b.s place a negative star. not worth your time and especially $$$!! i would say little ceasers is just a bit better topping and valve priced & superior. should rename this garbage clark county jail pizza,this experience killed my night!!!
There are some items that are not pizza that are amazing. They can make anything really.

I'm guessing we went at non peak hours so the place was empty. We ordered the Rebel pizza and chicken wings. The pizza was off the hook but the wings were a bit disappointing. Dry and not very tasty. The food was brought in from somewhere outside.... Weird.

Loved the pizza! Had the Guinea with meatballs, spinach and a white sauce. Loved the crust! My husband and I were a little skeptical as it is a dive bar, but is perhaps the best pizza that I have ever had!

This review is for their new location on Paradise. We had been in town a couple of years ago and stopped at the Arville location and we couldn't wait to go back.  We decided to go to her new location (Wed, November 19th) on Paradise since it was closer- and we were excited.  BIG mistake.  The menu offered just a few of what they offer at the Arville location.  NO Philly steak or pizza rolls here.  We ordered the back home pizza and stuffed peppers.  The pepper was split with a little melted cheese and was totally raw and crunchy.  The pizza came out and looked like something I could have got from the frozen section at the store.  The cheese and toppings were minimal.  the outer two inches had no cheese or sauce at all.  while the middle was a soggy mess.  I asked for a side of marinara so I could  at least eat some sauce with my crust and it was brought to our table ice cold.  I was so disappointed.  It should be noted on their website that the new location does not have the same offerings as the Arville place.  If this location continues to send out food like we received, it will close, and soon.  Would not recommend this to anyone.
I've lived in vegas my entire life.  Awesome sandwiches and vegetarian options.  This kind of sandwich shop is refreshing to see in vegas.

Checked out this place after seeing the latest Diner's Drive-in's and Dives. Had the suicide fries, they were Really spicy (in a good way), needed to down a gallon of milk on this one. The pizza was OK.

I've been coming here for a few years now - before they were on DD&D's.  The food has always been great (the wings are Buffalo-style and so is the pizza), although sometimes the quality can be inconsistent (especially the Paradise location).  Last night, though, our service was pretty bad.  My wife and I decided to eat in the "family" section, mainly because we hate smoke and it seemed like the best option.  We ordered the Rebel pizza, a single order of wings, and pizza logs.  The girl working was nice, but to be honest, was not very helpful.  Here is where my problem is: I tipped her 18% and she did nothing but taker our order.  Some other girl from the other side walked our food to us.  We had to get our own plates, napkins, forks, etc.  Besides the smoke, another reason why we went to the "family" side is because there was no table service.  I'm not sure, but it seems as if they got rid of the waiters/waitresses.  This would be a 5-star review if the service was better (this goes for both locations).
Good but really really greasy. When we got garlic knots, the pastry was still doughy.

I came to Las Vegas for my honeymoon and went to get pizza from here and no one was in the building we waited for 10 minutes and still no one so I decided to call the lady was very short with me said she'd be there waited a couple more minutes and still no one so we left.
Will I be back? Hell yea.   Will I order Pizza Egg Rolls? Hell No.   Yes, yes, to the suicide fries and the poutines and the pizza.   Everyone we met and spoke was super nice. Atmosphere was cool.

What an absolute DIVE! But if you want great pie and cold burruh here you go Suzi Quatro! Even the slices by themself are great...no need to order a whole pie. If you wanna get'cher pig on, get a whole pie...it is splendidicity.

This little gem may be Vegas' best kept secret (even after Triple D). Great "western NY" style pizza and probably the best wings in town. All of this and it can be found in the bast dive bar in town, Moon Doggies. Cheap cold beer, friendly staff and regulars

As others have said, this isn't a classic pizza place. It's a bar, that serves pizza and sandwiches and such.  I should preface this by saying I judge all Italian food by the very high bar set growing up in NY. We don't often eat Italian food out because not much measures up...   We had sandwiches, not pizza. They were good. Good enough that yes, we are willing to try the pizza when we're back in town but not so good we'd rush there 1st thing.  This review shouldn't imply there is anything wrong with giving it a go - just be aware of your unavoidable childhood prejudices ;-)
Interesting ambiance, thought the pizza is excellent... definitely and experience.... just make sure you were jeans and a black tee shirt

Yummy food! Whenever I'm out of town, I always make it a mission to check out local pizza and wing joints. This place did not disappoint. It was good to get away from the Strip to dine out. Pizza and wings were great. The atmosphere may be a turn off because it's in a dive bar. If you get pass that, this place is worth the trip.
Probably the best variety of pizzas that I have had while in Vegas.  It is worth the 30 minute drive just to have their chicken finger pizza.

Visited this place last night.the pizza was very good but the service was okay.a guy ordered in front of me ,he received his food in about 20 minutes,i got my order a hour after he received his and the cashier excuse was he had alot of orders come in.when i did receive my order the pizza was luke warm and it was for dine in.they either need help or a better system

I decided to give them another try. First the bartender was super friendly and quick. I ordered a pie to go and ordered the Garlic Fried for there. The fries were really good.I was sitting on the kitchen end of the bar and they came out and gave me a sample of the pickles that they brine in house. Also very good. And this time the pizza was good, not the best ever but a good solid pizza. So I dont know, maybe its different cooks in the Kitchen who knows
Via postmates delivers to Bally's hotel rooms.  I'm a CT/NY pizza snob 10/10 really good pizza!

Naked City is inside Moondoogies bar. If you order food and drinks, you will get separate bills for each. 4 beers @ $3.50 each - OMG, really - how awesome.   The huge, huge pizza is $32, we ate about an eighth of it, and my son will eat the rest of it for a week or so. We saw two large gentlemen attempt to the pizza eating contest (apparently if you can eat a large in 30 minutes, I assume it's free). Yeah, they ate about 1/4 of it. It is really good. And I thought very reasonably priced. The suicide fries, I like hot and spicy, but there was an ingredient in there that seemed to distract from the other great flavors. but that might just be me.   The waitress, a buxom young woman with tatts was just awesome. She carded my son (who had forgotten his id, so a trip home and back) just added to the experience. This would be my neighborhood "dive", and I mean that in a positive way, if I lived in Las Vegas. A ton of food at very good prices

just as good as it looked when watching triple d on food network. poutine fries and pizza were off the hook and the placeis a great dive to drink and eat all the goods while playing a few hands on video poker or watching the games. staff was on par and a great break from the strip!
Holy Mother of all Pizzas! That was the best pizza I've had in EVER!! And the wings...I'm a happy woman! And I'm hard to please!
Best Pizza in Vegas hands down! I had the Guinea Pie! If it is your time this is a must have!

All you people that give this place a low rating need to go eat the crap down the strip... This place is great... I love the chicken buffalo chicken dip thing lol and the meatball pizza. this place is way better then the shit they have down the strip.

Mom and I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak Rolls for a starter. They were the bomb! Sweet and hot peppers, steak, cheese, and onions all deep fried in egg roll wraps. What's not to like? Pizza with pepperoni, meatballs, and hot peppers was also really good. The restaurant itself is 8 or 9 tables tucked into Moon Doggie's dive bar. The bar itself has a funky stale smell, which does interfere somewhat with the taste of the meal. Those rolls though! Couple orders to go, and you'd be set.

Haven't tried the pizza s of yet but their chicken fingers are delicious and there is an atomic sauce for those who like a lot of heat. They are always big and taste amazing the only reason I did not give them a four star rating was due to the difficulty of getting a delivery from them. They only deliver through GrubHub and there have been times I have wanted to order and StubHub was not offering delivery from them.

I was *highly* skeptical when my girlfriend brought me here.  First off, she found it on a show on the Food Network, a channel whose hosts and content I have found generally worthless.  Secondly, they serve Sicilian-style (square) pizzas, a type which I don't care for.  Thirdly, the owner's trademark pizza ("The Guinea") doesn't even use tomatoes or tomato sauce, which seemed bizarre and wrong-headed.  How wrong I was.  We ordered two of the small pizzas (or "Wee" in Naked Pizza parlance): the Guinea, and the Meat Lovers.  I figured the Guinea was going to be a throwaway, since it is a white pizza, but since it was what caused our visit, I figured what the heck?    It is superb.  Outstanding.  Delicious.  And I am saying this as someone who normally hates hates HATES both Sicilian AND white pizzas.  Evidently I had never had them done right before this.  Now I will be confused and unsure of my pizza-ordering for the rest of my life.  Oh well.  The meatballs are hand-made and fabulous, and the white sauce is creamy and flavorful.  The crust isnt oily or heavy -- complaints I've had about other Sicilian pizzas.  The meat-lover's was also good.  Not the same "I-once-was-blind-but-now-I-see" type good as the Guinea, but decent.  It took a while for them to come out, but it was worth it.  The portions were large enough that we took more than half of them home (and just had them again for lunch.  They were still good, both cold and reheated in the oven.)  The bar itself is a pleasant, dumpy, dive bar.  Not too smoky while we were there.  Service at the bar was friendly, and we didn't have to wait much.    Definitely a thumbs-up.

I ordered the Naked Pie for pick up- told 40 minutes to pick up.  I don't understand all the raves about this pizza or place.  I don't mind divey, but this place was just sad.  The pizza was fine, but the pepperoni and sausage both tasted very cheap and unmeatlike.  Just a preference thing, I don't like "square" pizza.

This place has become a must stop for me when visiting or going through Las Vegas.  Last time I was here I went to the Paradise location, this time this location better met our needs.  It was around 10 PM and we needed some quick food on our drive back to St. George, Utah, so we did a pickup order through the Yelp app.  20 minutes later we arrived to pick up the food and found that it appeared to be closed.  Luckily some locals pointed us to the attached bar where you can pick up the food late at night.  I'm really not sure we would have figured this out on our own.  Inside the bar there is a small window that you can talk to the pizza people through.  They told us it was still being prepared and would be done soon.  We sat at the bar and waited.  We got the food and got in the car...my girlfriend did the ordering and I don't remember the pizza that she got.  It was the smallest, which is still a decent size, philly eggrolls, and of course my main reason for being there, the suicide fries!  These fries are amazing.    We started our drive as I entered spicy nirvana.  The flavors are amazing, the pain is real, the heat is fantastic.  I sweat in two new places that I had never experienced, inside my ears and on my eyelids.  It was painful, but so tasty.  I just kept going, fry after fry, until I had to stop.  Everything was so good and I had finished about 3/4 of it, with a few peppers left over.   I don't really know how to describe the flavor, but it is just amazing.  Don't eat these if you can't handle seriously spicy food.  They are so good.  I had some of the pizza to calm me down and take away the heat.  I like their crust, not thin, but also not too thick.  The cheese was delicious.  The philly rolls were pretty good as well, but I only had a bite or two of them.  Overall it was another great visit, 2/2 so far.  I look forward to next time I have an excuse to eat here!  Prices are good as well, only $5-6 for the rolls and fries and the pizzas are big!

I'm a fan of dive bars and good pizza. Put them together and you have a winner winner drunk pizza dinner! Naked Pizza is open until 3am. My friend and I got there around 1:30am, sat up at the bar and played video poker while our pizza was being made.   Pizza dough is thick but light, not too doughy and did a good job absorbing some of the alcohol so we could keep drinking. There was a good amount of cheese and toppings on it. As other Yelpers have mentioned this place is a dive so bring your expectations down a notch and you'll be fine. Bonus: our bartender, Leo, was super cool and made us a drink to go (we cabbed it).

this is the best place to get wings to go  i came to their location in the moon bar with friends and my friends were incredibly put off by the smoky atmosphere and the lack of draft beers..   too bad so sad as i warned them about that. we got a variety of wings and pizza and everyone left a happy camper ..  i see that they are now in the blue diamond saloon.. i'll be there soon to see if it's comparable

A coworker of mine suggested this pizza joint to me, and shortly thereafter, I saw it on an episode of Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.  I figured the pizza here must be amazing if it's featured on DDD.  Boy, was I wrong.  The service and pizza were alright.  Nothing worth writing home about.  Personally, I think Metro Pizza off of Maryland and Tropicana is far superior, both in quality and service.

Went with one other person, ordered 2 slices, fries and a sandwich. Guy at the window said it'd be a 30-40 minute wait which seems fair because it looked like he was the only person in the kitchen and we were going to get some drinks at the bar anyways.  10-15 minutes later our food was out and everything tasted great.  Overall it's a good dive bar with good music, good food, good drinks and fine prices; only $2.50 per slice.

Incredible pizza, incredible pricing.  In from Santa Barbara for the weekend and hit this place on a Sunday afternoon.  Super divey 30 some dollars for 2 small pizza and a suicide fry.  Screw the pizza on the strip I'll get a cab here, it's better hands down.

We got the Guinea's pie and loaded fries. Both were exceptional. The fries were probably the best fries I've ever had. Which is saying a lot because I've had many fries in my day! The pizza was very different but so good. The sauce was amazing. Will definitely be coming back again.

Being from Syracuse which is close to Buffalo we had to try Naked City Pizza and we found a Great NY Pizza like back home. We are Italian and I have to drive 14 miles one way to get one but I would do it in a NY Minute. Everything about the pie is Super from the dough and sauce to all the Topping that you could want. Do yourself a favor and order one as I am going to do right now. You will Love it, Trust Me I am a New Yorker to the core.

First they closed down the actual pizza place roughly an hour before closing and directed us to the next door establishment a bar where they also operate and serve pizza.  We waited over and hour after ordering the 6 slice box. Additionally, orders that arrived after ours, larger than ours came out sooner. Customer service and updates to our order was poor.   I've yet to actually eat a slice of pizza as I'm driving back to the hotel now. I'll think to update on that.

Bookmarked this placed based on their claim-to-fame of having the best sandwich in town- as rated by LV Weekly in 2012. Returned a few times for various pizzas, and my verdict is that while the crust is consistently good, items are generally hit or miss.  The ROYAL HOT SUB sandwich was my BF's favorite: Italian sausage, capicola, and mozzarella chopped in two equally enormous halves. Bread didn't seem particularly fresh, both meats were fairly dry to me, and there was no moisture on the sandwich, lending an overall dryness to the whole affair. It worked for my guy, and apparently for the staff at LV Weekly, but it wasn't the best to me.   SICILIAN WINGS were underwhelming: 50 cent surcharge for this flavor, for reasons unknown. Wings were perfectly cooked to tender and juicy, but lacked flavor. Minimal sprinkle of garlic and parm outside, mostly smaller wings, again they just didn't really do anything for me.  BEEF ON WECK Pizza of the day was not my style but I really appreciated the creativity that went into taking a NY sandwich and creating a pizza version of it; beef on top, horseradish sauce, creamy mozzarella, and a salted/seasoned crust. Flavors are strong and bold, tasty, but not something I'd eat more than a slice of.  FATBOY PIZZA is the bomb though: Cappicola, pepperoni, ham, Italian sausage, crushed tomato, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil and red sauce. It smells amazing and tastes even better, the tomato and basil really add a lot of flavor. I like that though it as several meats, they're distributed in such a way that it's an overwhelming grease bomb like other meaty pizzas.    I think I need to leave this place on my list to visit again and try the Guinea pizza when I have a bigger appetite (or perhaps after hitting the gym). I've been mostly underwhelmed by non-pizza options here.
This is the best pizza I've ever had in my life. It's doughy, cheesy, greasy goodness that still is not overly heavy. Thank you for making Las Vegas a better place Naked City!

When you don't want the party to end but REALLY want some good bar food...  Inside MoonDoggies. Where else can you get a hearth style pizza at 1 AM while at the bar?  All I've ever had here is the margarita pizza and it is awesome. 2 thumbs up

I ordered some French fries and it was so greasy you could fill a shot glass full of grease. I threw up as soon as I got home. I also asked for thin crust for my pizza and they only had one size dough. This was the worst $40 I ever spent in my life

Om nom nom nom. The pizza is delicious. I usually like NY style pizza more than thick or deep dish, but this crust is all fluffy and delicious like a supersoft unsalted pretzel. I tried the pepperoni and the chicken finger pizza, and they were both awesome with gooey, bubbling cheese. I don't normally like pepperoni, but it was seasoned and really well cooked. Pair it with a beer, and it is junk food heaven.  As for the atmosphere, I suppose it could be called a dive bar, but it isn't a very divey one. It seemed fairly clean for such a designation, aside from the glimpses of an unpleasant looking men's room I got each time the door opened (complete with dudes at the urinal) ;)  I didn't find it smokey, and I am not a fan of cigarette smoke. Perhaps this was a result of being there in the middle of the afternoon. The decor is an intriguingly tacky mix of surfing paraphernalia and 60s kitsch with glittery ceiling, and the staff is very friendly and easy going. The clientele was a mix of middle aged folks, casual business men, and chill 20 or 30 somethings.

Its a good sandwich. Wish they could heat them up to melt the cheese. The meal with the sides is a lot of food.   I wanted the fingerling potatoes but he gave me the potato salad instead which turned out pretty good.   I would give it another try.
Best pizza ever.  Kind of weir llocation inside adifferent establishment.. bar, but it.works.  Will absolutely eat there the next time I am in Las Vegas...Hope they are open on Thanksgiving.

I wouldn't go through the enormous hassle of going to this place when I have young children, but I do.  The drive from Summerlin (or anywhere else in the Valley) has been worth it every time.    I am recommending it tour our visiting CA guests, and I guess I must love this place if I am able to take the time to write a review while my toddler smashes tomatoes in my lap for fun.  I am not supposed to be eating food like this, but the Royal on weck tempts me every time.  I am aspiring to try out the soups instead of a sandwich, but just take the time to try this place out and you'll see why I keep going back.  In the last 10 years I have seen so many great places go in this town, and I hope that this place stays around for a long time to come...ever think of opening up a Summerlin location?

Well this place did not live up to all of the hype! I'm from Buffalo but live here in Vegas now and was excited to check this place out. They claim to be a Bills and Sabres bar but sadly that's not the case. I had friends in from Canada who wanted to watch the Sabres game and I called twice on Monday to make sure they could show the game. The first time I called the girl asked me if the Sabres were a football team! She proceeded to tell me I had to call back the next day and ask the bartender. I had my husband call later that night in hopes of speaking to someone else and getting a definitive answer, after all our friends from out of town were driving all the way from the strip so I wanted to be sure. My husband was told that they would for sure have the game on TV, not on sound (which was fine) but definitely on TV. Fast forward to the next day (Tuesday) we get there along with our friends and guess what?! They didn't have the game! They said they had the package but they couldn't get the game! If you have the package you would've had the game! I was furious! Then we decide okay well we'll eat at least since we're already here. We go to order Loganberry and you guys were out. So then we order a Labatt's you were out of that too! We walked up to the window and ordered our food, and there was a girl there that had the biggest attitude I've ever seen. Everything was annoying to her. At one point I got up and asked her (as she was standing at the bar talking) where the to-go boxes were and with a huge attitude she says "UGH go to window and ask them". I've worked in restaurants before for almost 10 years and I've never seen such AWFUL customer service!!! I don't know how you can claim to be a Buffalo bar and "Home of the Sabres" when your staff didn't even know who they were and you didn't show the game! What an embarrassment it was for us in front of our friends from out of town! You claim to carry all these wonderful things from Buffalo except you didn't have half of it! I was greatly disappointed with our first and only experience!
Oh man so much good food. Couldn't even make a dent in it. Big portions, great prices. Will definitely be back when we visit LV again.
Best pizza in Las Vegas ! The wings omg everything is amazing.. I go at least ones a month.

I had some serious high hopes coming into my "dining" experience at Naked City Pizza Shop in Moon Doggies. I'd heard a lot of good things about the wings, and being a massive wing fan, I was anxious to try them out.  The Good: - The hot sauce was actually hot. (All too often, the hot level is barely medium.) - The hot sauce had a different and interesting flavor. Not your average tavern wing sauce. - The suicide sauce, of which I got a side of, was one of the best super-hot sauces I've experienced. - On the day I went, Naked City had partnered up with Fukuburger (food truck). - Moon Doogies itself is an ok dive bar.  The Bad: - The wings themselves - the chicken - was not of good quality. - The wing sauces are very thin and liquidity. While the flavors are good, there is a lack of substance. - Everything comes "take out"-style. You can sit at the bar or a high-top table and eat, but you're doing so out of styrofoam containers and little plastic cups. - The wait for the food can be quite long.  The Ugly: - The dipping sauces, ranch and blue cheese, were awful - among the worst I've experienced. (Good dipping sauces are a requirement for achieving good wing status.)  Now, admittedly, I've only tried the wings here. The menu was intriguing enough that I anticipate a return visit, where I'll try the pizza and maybe some other items. However, given the quality of the wings (or lack thereof), I don't have particularly high hopes.
Garlic buns, salad, chicken strips and pizza are all excellent.

Probably the only thing keeping me from giving five stars is all the phone numbers I could find to order delivery didn't work. We ended up ordering through ÜberEats which is a cool service. The special meatball pizza (can't remember the name) is awesome! We also had the steak and cheese pizza which was good, if you like jalapeños. The seasoned fries were not bad but didn't survive the delivery well.   Next time I'm in Vegas I'll go to the restaurant and eat in, and no doubt will give a five star rating.

One of the best pizzas I've ever had.  I read a lot of the reviews so I was worried about the service, but I had no problems.  I was the only one in the "eating area" so maybe it's hit and miss depending on how busy they are, but the waitress came fast, the food came fast, and she came back often.  I ordered a Wee pepperoni/sausage and it was exactly the type of pizza I like.  The cheese stretches out, the crust has a crispy outer texture but is softer inside, and the sausage is the crumbled kind, not the Domino's type nuggets.  I'm not a huge red sauce fan but I didn't even notice it.  I got the wings (naked) with the suicide sauce on the side.  People are right when they say it's spicy but it doesn't stay with you.  I'm guessing it's habenero.     The total for the pizza, 10 wings, and a soda was $22.  I managed to get through about half of it and I'm a pretty big eater.  I'm definitely going to go back when I return to Vegas in the future.  Everyone has different tastes in pizza, and if this is the style you like, you're going to love it.

Love me some Naked City! The Bianco is really good. My hubby always leaves whatever bar we are at(that doesn't serve food) and picks up a few pies to pass around. The Naked City is a great pie for next day pizza eating. All the ingredients are fresh the crust has a nice chew and when it is cold the next day all the flavors are married like a good Quiche.
