Without a doubt one of the best places I've ever ate at. Amazing atmosphere where children can go to play games, there's plenty of sitting area if you are looking to throw a party, a range of video games that are free roam to play, its great. I ordered the guinea pie and it was TO DIE FOR. It was so good and our waiter was very kind and funny, the perfect place to take your kid for a birthday dinner with friends, or just a hangout for you.

Please take "delivery" off Yelp status, or put the hours that delivery is actually available!  I have called at least 4 times for delivery and they never have a delivery driver available. I asked When is a good time to call for delivery, and they said 'try the weekend'.  I ate there once with a large group of friends, and loved the food, especially the Guinea.

Great food. Horrible service. My friend asked for a recommendation from the  person taking the order. The guy replied.." I'm to bizy for this, look at the menu". The food came out with no forks, Plates or napkins. We asked the server for some help. He told us we were getting a favor by him bringing the food. We needed to ask someone else for more help. He was off the clock.
Two words ... Guinea Pie.   Delicious pies. Don't let the low brow bar put you off.  Either get the pie to go or slum it.  The Guinea Pie is great but their others are delicious too.

Food here was pretty good.  I would have given it a higher rating if the service hadn't sucked so bad.  Hot fries were good but not overly spicy.  The wings had good flavor but not too crispy.  The wife ordered pizza and it was awesome.  The cheese sticks were also good.  It took us over 30 minutes just to pay after we finished our meal and our drinks ran empty a few times.  I would come back but just for the food.
This place is mine & my husbands favorite place for pizza in Vegas! Pizza & wings taste amazing! But keep in mind, their large is HUGE!

Quarter sheet, half sheet, full sheet, whatever sheet you get, it'll be delish pizza.  Ordered the following (of course, I was with a bunch of friends): Suicide fries: WARNING: VERY SPICY. But it was still amazing! Fries with jalapenos and their house made house sauce.  Guinea's Pie: meatballs, spinach and ricotta. All amazing.  Veggies Pizza: Yes, the name says it all. Onions, tomatoes, mushroom, spinach. Yeah, veggies.  Margehrita Pizza but they spelled it as "Margarita:" tomato, basil and mozarella. The basics.  Bacon and Eggs Pizza: This was the most intense pizza I've ever had. They bring out the pizza and crack an egg on top of it and starts stirring it ON THE PIZZA! But it was still good!  Defo come back here and order one of those very tall beers. When eating anything spicy like the suicide fries or chicken fingers, chase it with beer NOT milk.

I've had a few things here and they have all been good. I tried this place after seeing it on DDD and it really is a dive. I tried the Royal first which is a sausage sandwich and then the Guinea's Pie. Both were really good. I would recommend take out though. The atmosphere is a little rank.
This place has super super yummy poutine and delicious pizza. Pizza is a greasy and super yummy. New waitress is rude AF but whatever! Still worth it

I'm really disappointed in Naked City Pizza Shop. How dare they be 20 minutes away? I can only imagine how delicious this pizza must be when it's hot and fresh, and I'll never know unless I eat it there.  Which is never going to happen. Any place with a big banner that says "Smoker Friendly" isn't going to be seating my sensitive nose. That's not a criticism: NCPS is inside Moondoggie's bar, so the smoking is reasonable; I get it. But I can't mix the smell of cigarettes with food, so it's my loss.   NCPS was suggested to my husband here on Yelp when we asked about where to get a pizza that wasn't NY-style or Chicago-style. I love Grimaldi's, and I don't hate Chicago-style, but where ARE all of the "normal" takeout/delivery pizzas with a thick crust, evenly spread toppings, and cooked all the way through? (I thought it was Metro. It wasn't. Northside Nathan's is a fave, but it's also a bit far for take-out.)  I'm glad a Groupon came up or we never would've bothered to make the trek to this dive, and I mean "dive" in the "fun, casual, non-derogatory" sense. Mostly. Even so, we waited until the day the coupon expired. The lure of a potentially good pizza almost didn't beat out location and atmosphere.  I got the "not-so-wee" (half-sheet) with mushrooms, ricotta, and garlic. This is a new combination for me and now one I look forward to trying elsewhere. (If I ever find an elsewhere.) I've been eating this pizza for three days now, so believe me that they're honest about the sizes. The "frickin' huge" is the next step up and more for dining in with six friends. The step down is the "wee," which I imagine has the benefit of more edge pieces.  Ah, the rectangular pizza and the problem of the edge-less middle pieces. It's one issue that keeps me from getting take-out at Northside Nathan's any more, but NCPS's middle slices were so good that I didn't mind the lack of edge, and a fine edge it is. Chewy, thick, but not hard and kind of fluffy. I could've done with an air bubble or three, but this is good.  My husband got the Stinger without bleu cheese and with "red sauce" as opposed to no sauce, I think. (The red sauce has a tiny kick to it - nice.) Let's just say that his didn't last three days.  I was really intrigued by the cherry-chocolate malts, and in just the past few days they've added online ordering, but it's really not a place I want to hang out - not inside, and not in the parking lot, either. For that I have to dock a star. But this is just the kind of pizza I'm looking for... now someone please tell me where to find this in the southwest?

Alert - this business does not have the same menu as Naked City Sandwich Shop!!!  So there is no tri tip sandwich on the menu.  There is no kimmelweck.  Yelp transferred the reviews from Naked City Sandwich Shop here but it is a completely different menu!  The current Review Highlights are not accurate.  That being said, pretty darn good food!  The pizza was awesome!  I'm usually weary of square pizzas as they tend to be too thin for me and lack flavor in my experience.  But this was good stuff! Thin crust, a little crunchy, and so flavorful.  I highly recommend the Fatboy.  The subs don't really hold a candle to the Naked City Sandwich Shop offerings.  But the sub I got was pretty good.  The Stinger, which has steak and boneless buffalo wings, was inventive.  Note - the pizzas and subs share some of the same names so make sure you clarify what you want when you order.  The poutine was pretty good (fries covered in gravy and cheese curds for the uninitiated).  I've never had poutine before so I have no frame of reference.  But the fries were excellent!  My favorite kind.  Skin on, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.  So yummy!  Chris, the guy running the entire operation, took my groupon without a problem.  There were some unique specials on the board, such as pork ragu, so make sure to check the board beside the window before ordering.  The restaurant will only deliver within one mile and I can't get the online ordering system to work, ever.  Even when it was Naked City Sandwich Shop.  It's inside a smoky Moondoggies.  Just look for the sign that says pizza by the slice.  I dig the food but it's not in my hood and video poker bars are not my thing.  Unless I can get a food runner service to deliver from here, sadly I think this will be an infrequent trip for me.

Originally from Buffalo, NY but lived in Vegas nearly 21 years now. With pizzerias in our family and worked as a kid in one being known throughout the country (located in buffalo) I will tell you 100% naked City has the best Pizza & Wings  in Vegas!  Margherita, crispy & greasy, only way to eat Pizza and Bleu cheese with your wings (NO RANCH SERVED IN THE B-LO).  You need to try this place!!!!!

Found this place on the Triple D site and had to go. We were staying on the strip so took a cab. There is a little sign above a black door with a door bell button on the right. Don't need to buzz just walk in. We weren't sure we were at the right place when we walked in but the staff was friendly and assured us we were. Pretty typical dive bar atmosphere, the owner is from Buffalo so there was a ton of Buffalo stuff on the walls which was nice as that is the area we are from. We ordered two wee's to split between four of us:   The Ginuea: This was featured on the show so we tried it. Fantastic!! The sauce was what put it over the top for me.  The Margarita: I was a little disappointed in the lack of sauce and basil(I was just expecting/wanted more) but every one thought it was good.  We finished with the fried dough: powdered sugar, chocolate sauce and fried=mmmmm.  We inquired about getting a cab to get back to the strip and the waitress called one up for us. I told her I would include her name and I forgot it (I'm very sorry!) but she was great. If I go back to Vegas I'll definitely go back. Even with the bar bill and tip it was cheaper than anywhere else we ate and as good or better.

Love the flavor and texture of the light buttery crust. Good quality pizza with fresh ingredients. It's a hole in the wall place with a laid back atmosphere. The crowd can get rowdy during later hours as the pizza shop is inside of a bar.

I am a native of Buffalo, NY and heard about this place when I first moved here, but live in Henderson so I've been a Santora's Sunset bar and Grille faithful for the most part.  Since Santora's closed (reopened under a new name, shut down and reopened under Santora's w/o Buffalo food ), I've been feening for some good "back home" food.  We saw the DDD episode and my BF's friend wanted to check the place out so we went this past weekend. Waitstaff is friendly, but service is a bit slow. I'm not sure if they were shorthanded, but the owner of the place does step in to help clear tables and such.  The menu made me hear Angels singing from the heavens.  They have pizza logs which are cheese and pepp w/ a touch of sauce wrapped in an egg roll wrapper and deep fried. They also do Philly cheesesteak logs...same theory. Chicken wing dip is something I make frequently for my friends out here for parties, so we skipped that.  Was delighted to see chicken finger subs and the Stinger!   Was disappointed however to get the chicken finger sub and it didn't have lettuce, tomato, or cheese /onion on it as I was expecting :(    The stinger is cheesesteak, chicken fingers on a sub roll with traditional toppings. The wings were just like home, crispy on the outside, juicy in the middle...however some people think they're overcooked because they're used to the wings being soft all the way around out here, and honestly, that's not the way Buffalo does them people.  Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. Hot sauce is actually hot!  It's just like home. Normally, I'd order hot out here and get something along the lines of medium but this place does it right!   Now, the pizza. I've been struggling to find good pizza out here and the best I've had thus far is Mama Mia's on Buffalo near Flamingo, or Northside Nathans.  This place does a good crust.  The crust actually rises and is airy and soft.  The toppings are fresh, and the sauce is not overly acidic or sweet with tons of tomato paste.  I tasted home.  :)    Next time, I'm going to get the poutine fries which are french fries topped with brown gravy, and cheese curds on top of that. It's more of a Canadian dish, but Buffalo NY being so close to the border of Canada, we know what it is and it's great!   Will definitely be back to watch our football team lose yet again this season, and drink cheap beer $2.00 bud/bud light drafts or bottles during games. Same story for the Sabres.
True hole in the wall, but great pizza and wings. The environment might scare you as this awesome eatery is inside a bar, but well worth it!!

Start here: Naked city is a dive. It's inside Moon Doggy's bar, which is a divey sports bar. But! If that doesn't detour you, then the pizza is awesome and drinks are cheap. We sat at the bar, which I recommend, and our bartender was friendly and  cool. Our food came out quick, and the pizza was excellent. If you're a fan of thick crust, bubbly pizza with a brown crust, this is the pizza for you. And, it's huge. The wee is HUGE. The other size I'm sure is bigger. Bring your friends to help you finish, and have a few cheap drinks!

I admit we went here because of DDD (Guy Fieri).  The dive atmosphere did not disappoint.  Good bartender, even though the bar was wet/sticky.  We ordered wings and pizza.  The wings were very good, as was the pizza, although it took a very long time before the food came out.    The food was good, but they don't have the ability to handle the popularity of this place.  It's a tiny kitchen with one person cooking.

After seeing this place of DDD I knew I had to visit here on my trip to Vegas from New York. I am so glad I did! Food was amazing and had a great beer selection! Of course the I loved the pizza but I was surprised how good the wings and fries were! Everything is made from scratch and very fresh. This place and any of the naked city pizza locations are worth a visit while in Vegas!

I had the opportunity to check out another Triple D Joint and once again it lived up to the hype.  After a long day of football and a night on Fremont street the wifey and I opted to just grab a quick slice and call it a night. We remember an episode of Triple D that raved about a dive known for their pie and so we decided to see if Guy was just giving us lip service. And so we found our way to Naked City Pizza. I must warn you this is a total local dive right next to Moon Doggies (Watering Hole). Not much on atmosphere just righteous Kick Ass Pie. All elements were choice, Great Crust, Fresh Toppings, The Sausage was old school killer good,  The sauce not too heavy but with Huge favor, layered, not soggy or mushy. Fresh, Hot, Crisp , Cheesy, Everything just pops! Definitely a takeout joint. Locals are Huge  Buffalo Bills Fans transplanted to Vegas. If you find yourself in need of pie while in Las Vegas Give them your hard earned dollar. You won't be disappointed.

I was very comfortable in this joint. It is on the dive bar side, but it is a place you can hangout and have a good pie. The dough is good, the topping even better. It has Buffalo, New York all over the walls and it is reflected in the good pizza. I loved the sizes: Wee, Not-So Wee, and F_ _ k'in Huge. Most of the people around us had eyes bigger than their stomach's so take-home was the norm. They also have Buffalo wings, which are great. I will be back!
This place has some of the best pizza ever. It's a hole in the wall but its amazing. Flavorful crust and the meatballs are amazing. Second time here, still impressed!

When in this part of the valley and looking for a 'nice-a slice-a of the pizza pie' this is a good choice, and suicide fries are HOT HOT HOT (and not in the Buster Poindexter kind of way).  Three alarm my friends...

Ordered the garlic knots and guinea pie and both were bomb diggity.  The pizza is HUGE- I think we ordered the equivalent of a "medium" and there were plenty of leftovers...  The slices are square cut and they use high quality ingredients.  Unfortunately we were a little confused when we entered on the non-bar side because there was a private event taking place.  When we entered the bar, we awkwardly stood at the door wondering whether we should wait to be seated and then just took a seat wondering if we were going to be waited on since there were a few staff members serving food.  Eventually, a staff member came over and told us to order at a window and then take a seat.  Had we looked a little harder, we would have noticed the big "ORDER HERE" sign next to the window, haha.  Only negative is that it was hotter than hell in there!

A hidden pizza spot, I think more secret than Secret Pizza inside Cosmo...  No doubt one of the best pizza shops in Vegas, but the consistency is all over the place here.  We normally order from this location so maybe the other 2 are different, even though this is the original.   I don't even know if they deliver LoL I think they do, so you should get it... so why 3/5??  Once, we ordered a pie and I waited the 20-30 mins before going in and went to the window for my pickup.  The girl at the window proceeds to tell me there isn't an order by the names I've given. Hmmm. I verified we called the correct location and she asked the other employees if they knew of my order... Low & behold, they knew we ordered and said all the orders weren't coming in at all. I'm thinking, if you know this, why not handwrite the orders until the problem is solved by management/owner? I waited for the pizza and wasn't even offered a discount, free drink or anything...  I work a lot of conventions in Las Vegas and encourage the booth owners to order pizza for setup days... we order the largest pizza. I'll tell you, the first time, it was so amazing, I actually ate 4 slices!! I couldn't move for 10 minutes, but every bite was worth it, but it's been 2 years now and the last times, I can barely get through 2 slices before calling it quits. Even if I'm "starving". Sometimes the crust is so thin and cardboard tasting, other times it's burnt and disappointing. I honestly don't remember the last time having a perfect Naked City pizza.   I'll keep trying them because there's always those days when the pizza maker is on effing point, and those days make you understand why people love pizza and this place.   Just wish the consistency of quality was where it should be.
Ordered Fatboy pizza and hot wings.  Both were nothing short of awesome.   My wife even asked for a side of the suicide sauce and that is her new favorite.   BOOM!

Stumbled in here one night for drinks with a few friends, it just looked like your average hole in the wall bar. With that being said the drinks were amazing and i had a great time. I later saw this place on the food network and was shocked, i had no idea that they served FOOD!!!!! Lol, BEST PIZZA IN VEGAS!!!! They have my vote :) PS: The wings and suicide fries are also equally amazing...

The pizza shop that's located inside of Moon Doggies bar. Currently, my favorite pizza style...Buffalo rectangular sheet style pizza. I generally have stomach discomfort after eating pizza...but I feel great after consuming their pizza. I don't know why...I'm sure I'm a bit lactose intolerant as almost everyone is as they get older, but no stomach bombs after eating this pizza and I have eaten it a few times.  I started frequenting this bar for football this year. Cool bartenders, cheap drinks and good pizza!  Dream scenario? And it has happened, but not enough! When Fukuburger visits the parking lot...drinks and pizza on the inside, great burgers on the outside!
Best best best pizza in town! Omg the Guinea! Those meatballs! I dream of them! Chris I want the recipe! Oh wait! It was on DDD with Guy Fiery! Lol. So glad you made a success of journey! Congrats!

I came here with some friends who have been here a few times. You walk inside a dive bar and order from a window stand. I wanted to try the Guinea Pig pizza because it was featured on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives plus they had my favorite pizza toppings. However, my friend didn't say it wasn't good or bland without the tomato sauce so I told him to just order and I'll just eat. We went with an order of wings, Back Home pizza, and the Fat Boy pizza.   The woman at the counter wasn't friendly. I had never been here so didn't know whether to leave tip when I order or at the table. I added my tip to the order which I hate doing. I prefer to tip after not before I get my order. No thanks from the employee, just abrupt service from a worker who clearly didn't want to be there. I was irked at myself that I left a tip for her.  We sat down and the pizza took a while, maybe 25 minutes? We ordered a pitcher from the bar. My friend had to clean and clear one of the tables. The wings came out first and they were decent. I was divided when it came to the two different pizzas. I didn't like the Back Home pizza. It reminded me of my high school cafeteria pizza but more doughy. My slice had random splotches of cheese and it was runny. The Fat Boy was the complete opposite which was loaded with cheese and toppings. It was a good pizza but nothing extraordinary. Did two different people make the pizza?   I don't think I'll be itching to come back here anytime soon. It's not a pizza I would go out of my way for and the service just doesn't motivate me to go back. Plus there were some scary looking people at the dive bar so I probably won't return.

Went in search of a good carry-out pizza: mission accomplished.  Ordered their "friction' huge" pepperoni pizza, and asked for it to be "extra crispy" or cooked a little longer than normal.  They were happy to oblige.  Couple of notes:    1. Extremely tasty. 2. Medium crust height: definitely not thin or deep dish 3. Square pizza (hence the missing 5th star--I don't understand square) 4.  Frickin' huge means--could comfortably feed 4-6 people who are not starving; I would estimate this would the equivalent of one-and-half large round pizzas (17-inch) 5.  Yep, it's a dive bar.  Bar on the right side, pizza order window on the left.  Nice crowd.

Yey I'm a huge fan! The hubbi and I decided to go here because he seen it on tv! He told me we both did however I cant recall if I saw it or not...nevertheless...I'm glad he saw it...We saw it...lol The food is divine the pizza was so very good (Please see my pictures.) We also had wangs yes not wings but wangs because they so good u have to give them a slang name. (KMSL)  If you high sadity or booshie this is not the place for you. (Stay home.) But yea the husband and I fit right in because we get along with everybody! Its cool people with a fun time & just great food. The cheese cake was very good. Its a fact that the husband and I have found a new spot to chill and have fun.

This place is a low-key fun place to go for a quick and yummy slice and beer. The slices are really big with lots of cheese and you can pretty much get whatever toppings you want. Great location, too - around a couple fun bars!

Elias my roommate is crazy! he ordered a half a sheet for 2 people! we gave it our best! took out one slice over a quarter! the blend of cheese, herbs and sauce is delicious! but wait there's more!  jumbo I repeat jumbo chicken wings! with the basics! mild medium hot etc.  chill atmosphere with bar and slots!  well worth the wait! they have a #suicide chicken wing sauce available with hints of habanero!

Very non-descript building. Attached to Moon Doggies Bar. Low key dining area. Paper plates plastic forks, dirty floors and wobbly tables. This place is about the pizza! The pizza is some of the best I've ever had and makes up for all the lack of amenities. Medium hand tossed crust. Perfect. Great red sauce on the "Back Home" pizza. Tasty pepperoni and spicy Italian sausage!  Interesting how they mix the sauce and cheese on this specialty pie.  Food is ordered at the counter and the poor gal working there runs back and forth to the bar where the kitchen is. So if you show up and it seems no one works there, be patient, she's running her tail off next door.  No beer or wine served in the dining side. But I was told you can carryover from the bar in a plastic cup. Get your drinks first before heading next door to eat.  Pizza gets a solid 5 stars, the restaurant a 2, the help gets a 5 for hustle.

I tried the suicide fries after I saw them on diners, drive-in and dives.  They looked so spicy and delicious!  I was happy with the fries when I got them even though they were in a Styrofoam container but I thought they were going to be spicier.  They still had a good flavor and i enjoyed them i just expwcted to be crying from the heat.  We also had some pizza rolls and pizza.  Overall I would get back but prob to their original location.
Spendy at $9+ per sandwich and I cannot support a sandwich establishment that doesn't have fries on the menu. FAIL.
The fries at this place are off the hook. We tried both the suicide fries and the garlic fries. Both were dynamite. Would definitely return.

I have been here a couple times before and its been so/so - HOWEVER this time around they were a bit busy and the waitress was VERY rude. She kept putting her hands in the air saying how busy she was and ignored us on multiple occassions.  I will rate next time I go to give them one more shot

It's located in a bar that plays loud country music.  At least when we were there.   Had a pizza and a salad.  Both were excellent.  Pizza crust was chewy, sauce smooth and well seasoned and plenty of stretchy cheese.  Salad was equally well prepared and big enough for 2 or more people.  Price was reasonable as well.  Will definately go back.

Love the food! I haven't had anything I dint like. I always go when I'm in Vegas. The only thing that's weird is that they have separate billing for the bar & the food. They had to charge my card twice.  The service was average, the waitress wasn't very attentive. The bartender has to bring it to her attention when someone came in.

Came on a Sunday and then Monday. Both days was closed. Came because of triple D tv show. The door says open 7 days a week. Not so for those of us who watch the show. I think these are all Guy's buddies and he tries to pimp yh out as a favor on his show. There were two other couples with kids that were very disappointed.

At first we came or the Taco Tuesday, but the flavors just weren't there.  So we switched to the pizza, we ordered the steak and cheese and it was SLAMMIN'!  I'm craving more of it today. Next time I'm gonna try the covered fries and a different pie.  I found my new pizza spot!!!!!
I love this pizza..... Took my mom and dad when they were here on vacation. They went crazy for it. Yummy

Would have given 5 start but my pizza logs were super greasy, yes i know they are fried. I was looking for a bar that reminded me of home so i googled pizza logs and it gave me this place. If you want a little piece of Buffalo, ny this is the place to go. Brought a couple of coworkers with and gad an amazing pizza along with some pizza logs. Definitely will be back. Also, your caesars dressing need to cut back on the garlic

Pizza was super yummy. Had the Guinea pie. Inside of Moon Doggies bar so 21 and over only. Salad was huge and 1/4 sheet was too much for hubby and I. Pizza was even good cold next day. Wish I'd saved room for the zeppolis. Next time!

Pizza was fair, cheese was tasty toppings a bit sparse. Menu on Yelp is not up to date. Pizza was more expensive than what was listed by about $3.  Delivery guy not available so used post mates for delivery. Didn't expect a 9% service fee either.  Post mates did a good job in getting it here while fresh. May visit them at their place but won't get delivery again.  Pizza logs were tasty too but very greasy.

TIP: The pizza joint is open until 3am, so it's perfect for late night pick up!!  On the corner of Arville and DI, Naked City Pizza is located inside Moon Doggies Bar.  Such a chill establishment.  The pizza's great and fairly priced--$16 for a medium.  The medium is huge and fed 5 famished girls at 2am in the morning--with leftovers.  Unfortunately, they don't deliver at that time, but I came in for pick-up.  We were staying at the Artisan so it wasn't too far away.  The guy that took my order over the phone was cool, and he was finished with the pizza right when I got there.  The bartender was super sweet; gave me a free shot since it was just my birthday.  Definitely gonna hit this place up again!

After realizing there is a buzz about this place being on the Food Network, I had a chance to stop by here for lunch!  A friend and I shared a Guinea's Pie.  This pie comes with meatballs, spinach, ricotta, white garlic sauce and mozzarella cheese, and was the one featured on Diners, Drive Ins & Dives.  The show made it look really good, so we had to try it!  The pizza, cut up into squares, was quite tasty.  The dough was well crafted, and the cheese was high quality.  The ricotta comes in a thin layer I think, and blended really well with the mozzarella giving it a slight creaminess.  The spinach was light and went really well with the pizza. Probably the most impressive thing about this pie was the sausage.  According to the show they make the sausage from scratch, starting with grinding the meat.  It was superb!    The bar that Naked City is in is nothing special unless you long for Buffalo, NY.  Bills posters line the walls, the dark dive bar atmosphere lit lightly with blue lights.  The service was top notch and fast.  The water was served from flip top bottles and tasted filtered and fresh.  The beer selection was a little weak, but they did have a local Tenaya Creek beer on draft that made up for it.    Is this the best pizza in town?  It is damn good, and probably the best "Buffalo" style pizza I have had, however there is at least one pizza place that goes above and beyond this one (however it is more of a NY style pizza).  Your tastes may vary.  In any case, this spot is worth a try for sure!

Located inside of the diviest of dive bars, but that's not the issue to us - we enjoy a good dingy dive bar.  We came here for 2 reasons: 1. I had an emergency late night pizza craving.  2. This was the only place open past 12am that had decent reviews (namely because Guy Fieri recommended them on Triple D.)  I'm just going to put this boldly out there - the pizza was a lie.   I can't necessarily state that Guy is lie on this one, because I bet this place used to be good, then triple D aires, then the word gets out, then the hype man takes the stage, then they cut massive ingredients and quality to make a profit. Right. It's a sad tune we're all too familiar with.   The pizza itself was very dry and I can honestly state it was pretty much all thick, dense dough. The dough wasn't even special or memorable - not even slightly sweet or anything that would make it stand out. The tomato sauce was barely noticeable and it wasn't robust, or striking in flavor. The cheese was also extremely limited as well. Everything fell seriously flat on our taste buds.  The toppings were all few and very far between. The meats were sparse and standard, nothing to holler home about. There were tiny specs here and there with spinach. Seriously!? How expensive is spinach, that you can't even hook an honest paying customer up with it? It was truly nonexistent.  Let me ask you this, why did we get the pizza with no love? I think my theory is concrete and valid.   Here's what we regretted ordering: Fatboy "not so wee" Pizza: $21 - subbed sausage for spinach  - subbed salami for ricotta  - this pizza advertised basil yet they some how forgot the basil? (forgot? or, on purpose... my paranoia is beginning to wonder...)  Pit BBQ Wings: $8 (single = 10pcs?) - hahahahaha they either, a.) Skimped us, or, b.) Don't know how to count - either way, that's totally annoying and frustrating when you pay for 10 wings and expect 10 wings, but get 9.  (To be fair- the bbq sauce was robust & the wings were well sauced)  Ranch: free  - very runny and watery   It's pathetic that I had a better pizza slice at Sbarro in the mall the other day - the red pizza sauce they had there was full of life and flavor, plus they probably put 1 handful of spinach on that 1 slice of pizza. Sadly, that's the opposite of Naked Pizza.  The only thing they got going for them is this: open until 3am.   $31 bill for a disappointing pizza dinner is not cool, not cool at all. We wasted our time and our dime.
Overrated reviews.  Have 12th sliced pizza and was not impressed at all.  I live in NY and need to say that every pizza I have was better than that.  As well price is to hight.

Since my initial time here, which was great, I have gone  to Naked City 2 times since then.  The last 2 times have just been a solid OK. The food is still  slightly above average but no longer amazing and I tried the Tomato Basil soup the last time and it was slightly below average  to me.  You brought my expectations up and then right back down Naked City.  The service  has been very good all 3 times I have visited but I felt the need to update my review as to not steer fellow Yelpers in the wrong  direction. The sandwiches are  OK to slightly better than OK.   It is better than Subway? Yes. Is it worth going out of your way to find? Not really anymore.  The name  and old school pictures on the wall still get points from me. The inconsistency the last 2 times I have gone  and the above average prices deserves and update in stars.   I am hoping this is a hiccup that Naked City can fix because I would love to see it do well. As of right now I don't feel its worth going out of your way to seek it out. If you happen to be in the area and want to make a trip downtown or to Luv-it then its worth trying out.   The kimmelweck roll is damn good as is the Habenero pickle.  Now either the quality has to improve or the prices need to come down.  Get it together Naked City.

So getting here is a little strange. It's inside a bar. So when you walk in, you walk towards the back and there's a little ordering station on the left hand side. You order, pay, then go sit down anywhere in the bar until your food's done and they bring it to you. We had a just a standard pepperoni pizza and it was amazing! The sauce has so much flavor, perfect amount of cheese, and it's just great. The mild wings are my favorite thing! The wings are actually good sized, they make it crispy, and they put a lot of sauce on it. It's not too hot either which I like. Normally I can't even handle mild but I could with these. They do close so I recommend coming before 10.

Real food...made by Real Punk Rockers.  Had the loaded fries tonight and they were crazy good.  It was at least 3 lbs of fries loaded with 1/2 lb melted cheddar cheese, tons of real chunks of bacon and sour cream.  I took these fries for the road (to-go) and what a terrible idea that was.  Needless to say I need a new shirt because I ended up wearing some of it.  Shoulda brought a BIB I suppose. The fry portion was so HUGE I will be snacking on this for at least another day.  The small portion feeds about 3-4 people.  Don't say I didn't warn you the portion is HUGE. I will be back to try the suicide fries, but I will have to have a beer or two first before tackling that dish.    I will keep updating this review as I work my way thru the menu.
Best pizza I've had in Las Vegas! The crust, cheese, and fresh thick cut toppings, just awesome. Wish they would bring back their Chili Cheese fries!

When I came here, it was a Tues or Wed afternoon.  We pulled in, and i didn't think this could possibly be the place.  I verified three different ways, and thought...this is so sketchy.  Then I had the food.  I can not think about buffalo anything without salivating over their buffalo chicken dip.  It really was amazing food.  The atmosphere...very dive bar (very very dive bar), but OMG the food.
Cheese pizza is delicious and my favorite is the philly egg rolls. It's a must half when I order from there

Let me preface this review by saying that I am not the biggest pizza fan, I do not have a "thing" for pizza, I think the majority of the pizza places in the valley are waaaay over priced and overrated, and there is a surplus of pizza/italian restaurants in town to create an internal "demand" for me. And after working in a pizzeria for a summer when I was 19, I was pretty much over pizza for the rest of my life. However, this teeny-tiny kitchen with a window inside a dive bar (Moon Doggies) that has blacked out windows, and still requires you to ring the door bell at 11am, is by far the best pizza I've ever had in my life.   Normally, I don't even crave for pizza, but after the last two times I've visited this place within the past 2 weeks, I still can't get enough of it. But these Naked City guys and their tiny spaces with their big food ventures are hitting it out of the park with their sandwiches and pizza.   The pizzas themselves are "Buffalo, NY" style, which I guess means having rectangular pizzas, like Sicilian style, but with a much less thick and dense crust. That doesn't mean that their slices aren't dense, because they most definitely are and filled me up with 2 slices. But when they're hot, the crust is crispy on the outside, and moist and chewy on the inside, and the cheese is bubbling hot. The first time I went, I got the Guinea's Pie that had meatballs, spinach, ricotta, white garlic sauce, and mozzarella on it, and I asked that he add some basil too. It was out of this world. Plus the guy that was working there was super nice and humble, and was really, really glad that we liked his pizza.   The second time I went there was to pick up a pizza to go, and this time I got the Veggie Pizza--with sweet and hot peppers, onions, tomato, broccoli, olives, spinach, mushrooms, mozzarella, and red sauce--and added some meatball to it to satisfy some meat-loving co-workers. What they don't mention in the menu is how spicy the crust is from the hot peppers. I love spicy food, and this was just in between "I can handle it" and "Whew, I need some water!" spicy. While the crust didn't maintain it's crusty/chewiness on the drive over to North LV, it was still pretty damn good. I also got the Naked City Bread Basket, which was not as good as it sounded in the menu, but may have also been due to the travel time it endured. It was a little hard and dry, but the toppings made it okay.  As a fan of Naked City Sandwich Shop, I was happy to learn that they also use that awesome garlic mayo in their subs at their pizza shop. I have yet to try their sandwiches, pasta, or wings, but I wouldn't mind giving it a try if I could tear myself away from their pizza for a minute.   One more thing about their pizzas: they're HUGE and CHEAP! Aziz B. and I each got our own "Wee" pizza, which I think translates to medium, and they were like a large anywhere else. At 11 bucks a pop, they came with 8 slices where I could only finish 2, and Aziz--an actual pizza lover--could only finish 3 of his own. Now that was something of an eye-opener to me. Well, so was the slightly inebriated and possibly stoned bartender we were chatting with as she drooled over our pizzas, but that was to be expected.

From 5/24/15 After hearing so much about Naked City Pizza, we wanted to see what all the hype was about! We came in here hungover from the night before hoping to get a bit of grease to soak up what booze was left in our systems, and this seemed like the kind of place that could help us out with that  kind of problem.   Naked City Pizza is basically a kitchen with some designated seating that is inside of a dive bar called Moon Doggies- hahahahaha. I'm sorry that name "Moon Doggies" is just hysterical to me lol!!   This place is  Buffalo NY inspired, as the owner is from B-Lo! Being from New York myself, I can honestly say this place looks like an Upstate NY dive/greasy spoon spot with it's décor, and age stains coating the bar. However, I have always noticed places like this seem to have the best food.  Anyway, we ordered mild wings and a pizza with spinach, onions, and meatballs. Are wings were the first thing to come out, they were cooked perfectly, not soggy, and had a slight bite for being mild wings-delicious! The pizza was next, it had a thick crust, and the meatballs on it were the size of New Jersey!! I was expecting the typical crumbles of meatballs you get on a pizza, but not this one it was huge- but that was okay with us! The pizza was delish as well, they use a good quality dough, cheese, and sauce.   Whelp with all that being said- Naked City Pizza is our new favorite spot, and thank you for curing our hangovers!!

Awesome pizza. and I used to live in NJ and swear nobody can beat their pizza. Well this one came pretty damn close to an old Sicilian I've been longing for... and it was so big we ate it for days. So worth it, the location on Arville is in a bar, but there is seating in a storefront right next to the bar so if you have a kid with you no worries. we didn't go to the bar and we sat in the empty store watching tv and stuffing our faces like you wouldn't believe. Will definitely return whenever I make it back to Vegas

So I was told this place was good, it may have been but I didn't stay long enough to find out. Obviously the food is good. However I feel bad for the owner. He has the worst service staff I've ever seen. The restaurant wasn't busy at all yet our server took more than 10 minutes to greet us. She seemed really busy but as I was watching her, she wasn't really doing anything and she was being rude about it toward other guests. I saw when we walked in that she was sat 2-2 person tables and 1-3 person table. 7 people total. She continued to help 1 of the 2 person tables and told us and the other table that she would be with us shortly. It took too long so we left. We went and spent $85 at another restaurant. I'm sure this happens all the time here. The bartender saw us but didn't really help. YOU NEED A HOST!!! I cannot stress that enough. The 10 minutes I was there I didn't feel welcomed at all. I feel like its worse than just retraining your staff. You need to teach them how human beings should be treated. Personally I live to far away to ever want to come back but I'm telling you this because you're service staff is losing you money. You can tell they just don't care. When people don't care about their job they do shady things. Wouldn't be shocked if they were stealing from you honestly. Please address the situation or you will not have a business in the near future.

Naked City pizza on Arville was very good, we ordered a slice of pizza and garlic parmesan fries. We have ate here before and at the other location. However this time the fries were a bit overcooked. The slice of pizza is a good size and if you are really hungry try their "freaking huge" pizza. It is enough for a family of 5.

This place is definitely located in a dive bar.  Ordered a round of wings and Guiena pizza.  The wings were good, good amount of sauce and they were large in shape.  The pizza on the other hand was crap.  Pizza had no flavor or taste.  The Crust is very thick.  I would skip this place.  Guy Fieri got this place wrong!

Second time here. First experience with staff was, well below expectations. Was with a friend and let that go because overall the atmosphere was a good one. The food was great. We even had a family eating. Now, we came back because we were in the neighborhood. We sat down and no more than 15 mins, a family with two teens walked in and sat down at a booth. No more than a minute passes when a staff member informs that only people at least 21 or above can be in the facility. Shortly thereafter the family leaves the establishment. Now I would not write this review if at the exact same time a group of males, all males, with two teens walked in and were not asked to leave. This experience is not what I was expecting.

Since we're relatively new to living in LV we've been looking for a great pizza place.  We finally heard about Naked City Pizza Shop from Diners, Drive-ins and Dives web site.  This place was a great experience - from the Buffalo memorabilia to the over the top wonderful pizza.  Pizza had the BEST flavor!  We wished we had room to eat more of it. Only complaint would be the servers - very, very slow and unfriendly.  Wish management would improve on this.

Maybe it's the well poured rum and cokes, but I am always on cloud nine when eating Naked City Pizza, I've had two different pies now and they were both excellent. The suicide fries are killer my mouth is on fire but I can't stop. This has become a regular spot for me.

This is hands down the best pizza I've ever had in Vegas, NY, Chi or anywhere else. It is so delicious in every way and even smells AMAZING. The dough is made from scratch and you can't go wrong with any of the ingredients they offer. Most recently we enjoyed a pepperoni, mushroom and sausage pizza. There's nothing else like it. I'm usually not a huge sausage fan, but I couldn't get enough. I could have literally eaten the entire pizza myself!!!  The incredible menu doesn't stop at the pizza. I've also had the stuffed mushrooms and wings, which were fantastic. I don't know how anyone could have anything negative to say about the mushrooms as they were SO delicious!!! I've never had better! I'm dying to try the pasta on my next trip!!! The menu offers far more options than your typical pizza joint and you can't go wrong with ANY of them.   You must try Naked City Pizza!!!

When they were first there it was a Buffalo go to! Clearly a little success takes your eye off the ball. This is the second time in a less than 3 months I have had sub par food from a place that I normally recommend to anyone! Char-in cup slice was half baked zero char!...wings were undercooked and hot when I order medium.  Complained and received the oh well face. Naked  City is turning a blind eye...no response from my initial complaint because the "brother" runs the blue diamond saloon location. Moondoggies could have cared less. I'm not giving a 3rd time to disappoint. Spent my last $ of support.

This place was GROSS. I thought being a Guy Fieri restaurant it may be good. HAHA, NO.  I wished I had taken pictures to show you how unpleasant this experience was. 1) 0% cleanliness. The tables had crumbs on them, the floors were really dirty and the restrooms just indescribable. I almost lost my appetite. Worse than a gas station. 2) The pizza dripped fat like I've never experienced in my life. Specially the pepperoni one. Fat dripping like the freaking Niagara Falls. 3) The door seemed broken, being slightly open letting cold air and street noise in. The counter lady was gentle enough to close it, after struggling to do so. 4) Fries were brown and gummy, old. YUK!  If you like fatty grease dripping pizza then you may like it. There are way better places to eat pizza in Las Vegas and actually enjoy it.
The suicide fries are so good, they made me want to live a little longer. love the ambiance of the place. if you are brave enough to adventure out to a little dive bar you will not be disappointed.
Super Divey but GREAT PIZZA!  Cheap prices. Definitely recommend for a casual, quick bite and a beer!

BEST PIZZA in Las Vegas!   That's it.  But read on, if you must....  The square little pieces are great; my favorite piece is the center square!  I think it's the dough. It's so good! I heard a rumor the pizza maker gets water for the pizza shipped in from somewhere.  I don't care what his secret is, this is hands down, the best pizza!  Oh yea, the pizza shop is inside Moon Doggie's Bar.

My favorite pizza place in town!  The Pizza tastes just like it does in buffalo - fluffy crust, plenty of cheese, and with any topping you wish. Their wings taste just as good.  Hands down, the best pizza in town. I'm not a fan of thin crust pizza as many pizza businesses in town offer, so naked city pizza really hits the spot. Don't judge a book by its cover (dive bar)... the food is really something else. And they have labatt blue on draft. sold!!

I've loved in Vegas for over 8 years. I finally just heard about this "dive" and decided to give it a try. Naked City Pizza didn't fail to deliver.   4 of us shared a pizza "home style pie" I think was the name? It was awesome. This is square cut pizza that has a great sauce and a thicker than average crust. SUPER tasty.   The real gem here are the home made fried. We ordered the garlic and the divide fries. I got the sauce in the side after yelp warnings. Which was perfect advice. These are in fire! But sooooooo good. I kept some sauce for my crust too. But I dip one too many times because my mouth got so hot I had to make an emergency bathroom trip because I thought my mouth was going to burn me to death. With that being said, this place rocks. And contrary to some reviews, our service rocked. VERY nice and efficient wait staff. Ill be back many times to come in the future.
went to this place today and the service sucked very bad experience and left them a message and they deleted my post ...did not serve us because color of our skin very racist treatment today
Had a small issue with the ordering process...they were VERY QUICK to make it right. The pizza is still AMAZING!

We were on another road trip, so that means! Looking up and see what food joint has been on TV? Naked City was on DDD, never seen the episode and was very skeptic about eating here? With my wife, daughter and her boyfriend with me. It was around 11:00 pm, after our Les Miserables show at The Smith Center. Wasn't sure if I wanted to bring my wife and daughter here? Place is not in the best area, and it's inside of a bar!! Moondoggies! But after we sat down and trying to talk with each other with the screaming, yelling, rock music on! We started to eat our food! Now with the shift change at the bar, the music changed! All of sudden we started to hear Journey, Boston, and Chicago! Music we can just lay back and listen to! Got myself my first Red Apple Ale, which I sucked down in 1 min! Now back to the food, we order three large ground beef tacos! Order the small! Large is like a burrito, just to large and ask for cheese, doesn't come with? There taco sauce is more of a buffalo wing sauce? I had no problem with it, it was different. But the girls did not like it! We also ordered a large pepperoni pizza, daughter ordered a side of large fries! Fries were very good, daughter loved it, can't really explain it? But there fries are different, and very good. Now their pizza! We all loved it, I can seriously say this was probably my favorite pizza of all time! Dough was thick but very crispy! I love the thin and crispy, when I seen the thickness of this I wasn't sure about it at first! Very cheesy, perfect amount of sauce and pepperoni were very good. Think I found my pizza place in Vegas! Glad we stopped by, had a great time to end our evening.

Yes - I'm giving this sandwich shop five stars.  The sandwiches are tasty, the sides are amazing, and the pickles (garlic or habanero) are out of this world.   The location is not what you would expect, but a trek into the Naked City to get a meal here is well worth the trip.

Delicious choices, although you'll probably need a nap afterward. We got the philly cheesesteak rolls, garlic buns and margarita pizza. Our food was delivered from the connected bar which was a little strange. The server brought it in the front door and flatware wasn't readily available, we had to request it. Other than that the service was alright. The food is definitely what makes a trip here worth it.
If you want atmosphere, furget bout it.  If you want "DELICIOUS PIZZA" gotta try it.  Some of the Best pizza in Vegas.
Saw on triple DDD. Pizza is best in town. Suicide fries were good but not as hot as I had hoped. Will be back again.

I went back to Naked City Pizza Shop inside of Moondoggies again to eat more of their menu, and as before I was not disappointed.  This time I had the Pizza, it was a big square slice of pepperoni pizza, the crust not too thick and not too thin, kind of like handtossed at most major pizza places, but it's actually good, not processed frozen dough that the big guys have. I am a pretty big eater and I have to say that it was a bit of work to get through the slice, let's just say that it's not a small slice!!!  I also gave the Pizza Logs another chance, last time they were a little chilly in the middle, this time they came out piping hot, after a little cooling, they were amazing...could be one of my favorite apps in town...imagine if a totino's pizza roll and an egg roll had a delicious baby.  I also tried one of their chicken fingers, it was crispy and delicious, They have added chicken finger tacos to the menu, one member of my group had one, and let's just say it's on my list to try next time.  This place is really starting to grow on me, the staff is nice, the bar is a great little dive bar, and the food is AMAZING. I only wish it was closer to my house

We went to NCP on a Monday around lunch time and they weren't too busy which we were happy about. We ordered the Garlic rolls for the appetizer. They were so delicious and different from any other knots or rolls that I had had before. They have cheese in the middle and plenty of garlic taste. I will definitely have those again. there were 5 of us in my party, so we decided to order 2 pies. We got the Guinea's pie and the Back Home pie. They were both really good! I'm not a big an of spinach on my pizza, but I even liked it on the Guinea's pie. I'd try it again. I really want to try the Margarita pizza next time. We will be back soon!
Excellent pizza.  Stuffed mushrooms were divine.  We loved it.  Service was marginal.

I took a chance and went down on a Friday night to pick up a sandwich and a pie to go...the chance I took was in taking my wife.  This place is the sweet spot that dive bars aspire to, and that is something that the two of us love, but I have a healthy respect for... I was worried we might walk into a smoky, crowded, death-metal mosh pit that I would have to bull through to get our food.  To our happy surprise the bar was pleasantly populated by the eclectic crowd you expect at a dive.  The bartender was quick to deliver our beers (22oz. PBR) and the food was prepared in a bit slower time frame than we might have preferred...we really didn't mind because the atmosphere was just that good.  Oh...and the 80's hit parade coming from the sound system was pretty sweet too.  The food was great...A guinea pie that really hit the spot and a Stinger that was a bit hotter than anticipated, but too tasty for me to complain.  I have yet to get a bad pie or sandwich here...dive in!.

Fabulous food. Great dive bar. You gotta try the suicide fries!   They are rock star.  Pizza was fabulous. The beer is ICE cold. Really you gotta try the suicide fries.  I'm writing this with beads if sweat on my bald head.  Great stuff!

So tried this out for the 1st time tonight ... Quite a distance from our house but nevertheless.  The place is definitely a "dive" so it does fit into the DDD well.  I had to let my eyes adjust for a few seconds when I walked in because it's dark :)  Once I could see - we walked over to the takeout window and were greeted by a really nice waiter. He asked if it was first time and if we wanted some suggestions but I had my mind made up before we walked in lol.    We opted for the "not so wee" (about the size of 2 of their menus) size of the "Fat Boy" which consisted of Mozzerella cheese, fresh tomatoes, fresh sausage with delicious fennel seeds, pepperoni, ham and fresh basil. I also ordered a small poutine (for those not familiar it's fries served traditionally with brown gravy and cheese curds). Since I have an aversion to curds - I asked them to make it with just Mozzerella and they were happy to do it. Though I've had poutine in Montreal on several occasions - I grew up with cheese fries and gravy in Philly and for the life of me - it's a struggle to cheese fries in this town unless they have nasty nacho cheese on them.  The poutine was great. The fries were freshly cut, not very greasy and had just the right amount of cheese. They put the gravy on the side which was a brilliant idea as it was a 20+ min ride home - this way they weren't too soggy.  I'm not sure what else they put on the fries but I could have made a meal of just these fries. They were great!  As for the pizza - it was also great. I loveeeee that they make their own fresh sausage and that they use fresh ingredients on the pizza. Though it wasn't your typical "dive" pizza that I'm used to getting in a pizza shop back east - this was some damn good stuff. The only thing keeping me from 5 stars is that I would prefer if the pizza toppings were spread out more to hit the 4 corner pieces. Since the pizza is rectangular most of the ingredients are focused towards the middle of the pizza do when you grab for a piece along the edge you don't get to taste all of the flavors.  The entire staff was friendly and kept us up to date on our order.  We'll definitely be going back soon!
Pizza is da bomb!! I go here every time I visit Vegas. I can't wait to go again this weekend!!
Place is horrible. It used to be good. Food quality and accuracy are a 1 star at best. And don't go there to pick up your food either...place is a dump
The pizza tasted really good but the crust was to thick in my opinion. I'm used to NY pizza which is thin. If they can't make it thinner I won't be back.
I was there yesterday (first time) Pizza pretty good! And the chicken wings  no complains! Planing my second visit pretty soon

Naked City has the best pizza in town.  The steak and cheese, add peppers is to die for!  The fries Mama mia!  Beef sandwiches....like french dip.  we went after saw on Triple d, been back 5 times in 6 weeks!
Best pizza in Vegas hands down they know how too make great pizza closes thing too have pizza if yr from  Buffalo NY and try there fries they r the great & very hot

Great pizza for 2:30am   Def ask for extra toppings though.  Great atmosphere and if you don't like sucks for you.   I did call ahead but apparently no one put my order in so that sucks, especially if you call ahead to avoid waiting!!!

Wow! Ordered the Guinea Pie from Bite Squad this afternoon. What a pizza! As a NYer, I was hesitant as it doesn't look like a NY pie, but the taste... incredible! Perfect balance of cheeses and crust and garlic and meatballs and fresh basil. Such a wonderful pizza. I will definitely be ordering again. Also ordered a small zeppoles. Enough to feed an army! I'm going to have to visit the location one day. This is too good!

Food was great very yummy dough and the cheese was great but our server was slow, rude, and snotty.   Our server gave us attitude when we asked for boxes to take our leftovers in and she charged us for an appetizer we never got,.

I go here at least once a week. Sure it's a dive, so what's your point? It is what it is.  I have ALWAYS got great service and to food is the bomb!  James the bartender is a great guy and is smart as a whip!  Drop your inhibitions, go there and have fun!

I can honestly say that the Guinea pie is the best damn pizza I've ever had in my whole 29 years of living! Seriously it's amazing I will definitely be going back again and I will definitely be bringing family and friends to try some of that Guinea pie!

It's been a couple weeks since I was in Vegas, but I am still dreaming about a couple places, this is one of them! Found this place randomly, as we were driving around and just searching pizza on my maps. So happy we were closest to this joint, we took a gamble and won! When we walked in all we saw was a dive bar, not knowing if we were in the right spot, but we  walked in a little further and saw a small window in the wall, low and behold, this is where you order! There was only one girl working, it was almost 2am and she was pregnant! Not knowing what to expect, we were taken back by the awesomeness of this place!  We got a veggie and cheese pizza and a side of french fries. HUGE servings for a ridiculously low price.  We got everything to go and it held up perfectly until we got to our hotel. Thick crust pizza with tasty toppings, and deliciously seasoned fries (no sauce needed, and I usually always need ranch for dipping).  She did a fantastic job, we were so appreciative. Such a great end to our night:)

Incredible pizza in a very unassuming strip mall. Don't be afraid to make the trip it is totally worth it. Dive bar seating or they have another section away from the bar. We had the guinea pie and and a veggie something. Really doughy crust and delicious. If you are a Bills fan it should be a definite Vegas stop.

Quite a few months ago I made a forum post on Yelp seeking my perfect pizza. Something with crust that's quite chewy, not undercooked, wet, floppy, or any of a dozen different complaints I can have with pizza in Las Vegas. Naked City was one of the suggestions in that thread as a place which might satisfy my pizza specifications.  You see, I'm one of those people who, every time they read a review for a pizza place that starts with "As everyone knows, Las Vegas is a mecca for great pizza....." sighs in bogglement that my tastes are, apparently, so different from the LV mainstream with regard to pizza. I've searched high and low and nothing has perfectly fit the bill.  That was until I braved Moodoggie's Bar to pick up a "Stinger" pizza with red sauce and entered pizza heaven. Let's not split hairs - the place looks scary, the bar is right out of the early 80s, complete with sit down Galaga coin-op. The "pizza shop" is a window looking into a tiny, slightly grimy-looking (though I'm sure that's just age and it's perfectly clean) kitchen. And yet somehow it all works to create my idea of perfect pizza. A thickish crust with not too much sauce of the kind that isn't overly sweet or overly gloopy. Delicious toppings, correct cooking time and wonderful taste. It all came together to produce a huge "not so wee" pizza that I inhaled in an evening.  I can see why the place gets mixed reviews. Its appearance combined with the massive deviation from what most people seem to regard as "good pizza" is sure to throw a few cats among the rating pigeons, but if you're like me, and the thought of another sloppy, undercooked pizza that people tell you you're supposed to "fold up to eat", give Naked City a try. You might not regret it.

Amazing food. You can't go wrong with any of the fries, but might I suggest the poutine fries? So good! And the pizza...my gosh the pizza. Guinea pie is the obvious choice as it was featured on the food network. It did not disappoint. Any of the pizzas are rock solid though. It's self serve and really dark so if you are in sweatpants and your hair is kinda messy, don't even worry about it. This is that rainy day, lazy outfit type of place. I love it.

I was in Vegas with my Fiance for the first weekend of March Madness! Found this place on Yelp and it was sooo good! I signed up for Yelp just to write this review!   We had the loaded baked potato fries and the chicken finger and steak pizza (the name escapes me at the moment). Both were delicious! Add cheap beers into the mix and a bunch of TVs to watch the game and it was the perfect afternoon!   The bar is a total dive but not dirty or anything. If you are looking for good-cheap food off the strip, this is your place! The service was great! Nicole was our waitress and she was fantastic!!!!

I went to Buffalo late last year and had a sandwich, which is a Buffalo specialty called "Beef on Weck", which is Rare Roast Beef on a Kummelweck Roll (A Salted Bun, with Caraway Seeds in the shape of a hamburger roll).  I was thrilled to see that this place had one.  So I decided to go there for lunch.  The place is inside a bar called Moon Doggies.  I was disappointed, because of the cigarette smoke.  The bartender was really nice.  However, the girl at the window was very business and not friendly at all.  I ordered half a Beef on Weck and a slice of pepperoni.  And then I ordered a beer from the bar.  The pizza came out first.  I could not taste any sauce on it.  It was in a square and I got a corner piece.  The best thing I can say about it is that the pepperoni is PERFECT!  It was in small circles and spicy, the way I like it.  I just wish it was more conventional NY style pizza.  The sandwich was the big disappointment.  If these people are from Buffalo, then they have never eaten at Schwabl's or Charlie The Butcher there, because this is NOT Beef on Weck.  It was more like Philly Cheesesteak style beef, not rare, sliced roast beef.  And it was not rare, it was completely cooked.  The Kummelweck roll looked like a hot dog bun with caraway seeds and salt on it.  I'm giving it three stars, because the bartender was super sweet and it seems like a good place to have some beers or drinks, but I definitely would not order food there again.

Was in Las Vegas for the B2V weekend and after the race had a craving for pizza and fries. Elisa and I found this place on Yelp and when we got there, it was closed. 9pm on Friday night. Yelp stated they closed at 3am. A big pile of BS, if you ask me. Don't come here. They might be closed.
Went here once and had the ginny pizza, wow just mind-blowing. Would go back again and again. Service was great, and they have some nice wines.

The pizza was "okay" I ordered a veggie pizza because I'm vegetarian and my friends are not. My pizza was fine no issues. But my friends ordered a couple of minutes after me and they waited almost an hour and still no pizza. For some reason the pizza is cooked next door at the bar and the pizza place is just a young girl with a cash register and some tables. After asking multiple times they came to bring the pizza of people that had ordered AFTER us. The woman who brought it said "the ticket never printed on the other side." Not a hint of apology that you might expect for a mistake obviously on their end. All she said as she was standing with her body halfway out the front door was "I can give you your money back or the pizza I can't give you both." The nerve to treat us like we wanted something for nothing, all of us in our group are professional people and no one asked them for a handout maybe just some courtesy and respect for our time. We opted for the money back. Horrible service.

One of the best pizza places we've ordered from!  We've probably ordered from Naked Pizza now 8 or 9 times. Always the same great quality!  We usually order via Postmates or Uber Eats. If you're looking for great pizza delivery you should try this place out!!

Don't let the outside appearance shy you away. My husband and I always make this part of our "to-do" list anytime going to or passing through Vegas. BEST pizza and wings around. We usually order the Guinea Pie Pizza and "hot" wings (no fries)   Our recent trip the pizza was in its own area (not sharing with the bar) which was nice since we didn't have to eat while breathing in all the smoke. This place is two   thumbs up!
Place went downhill. We literally waited an hour for a burnt pizza with no apology whatsoever. They are losing care and obviously quality.

Had the Back Home and added some red peppers. Delicious. Would definitely do it again. Toppings and sauce were great but the kicker for me was the garlic crust. Great taste to finish a slice. Loved the meaty, saucy thicker style for a change of pace.  Had already eaten but stopped in because it was close to our hotel and a chance to hit another DDD place. Besides, who doesn't have room for a little pizza?   Fun and funky little place. Retail pizza place (kid friendly) is next to the dive bar. Definitely glad we stopped and will definitely go back and try other pies. Service was very good and so were the prices.  Overall it was a 5 for the combination of great pizza, good service and fun/adventure. Do it.

I was excited to try them after seeing them on diners, drive-ins and dives. Called several times and there was no answer. Finally someone picked up and put me on hold. I waited in hold for 7 minutes and could hear them talking to other customers about Dallas and the football game Thursday. I just waited and waited. Finally hung up to call back but it was still busy cause "I" was on hold on the other line and no one hung up. Wish I would've gotten a chance to try them.

I wanted to try Poutine for my first time and this place is the only place I found that serves Poutine. Las Vegas magazine also mentioned this place as the best place for Poutine. The pictures looked amazing too  I ordered the stuffed mushrooms and of course Poutine. The stuffed mushrooms were tiny and it had way too much seasoning. As for my Poutine, it didn't look at all like the pictures people posted. I don't know if it was because the chef was having a bad day... but it was not smothered in gravy and there were barely any cheese curds! I tasted it and it also had too much seasoning. Pretty disappointed.  Btw, this place is inside Moon Doggies. I was lost trying to find this location.

This place rocks! Best Sicilian style pizza in Las Vegas by far. Get the naked city and add meatballs. Meatballs and sausage are made in house and you will be able to tell immediately. Hardcore!!! Slayer on juke box while writing this!!

I was on a groupon mission this weekend! I came here with a friend to try out a new pizza spot. After reading the previous reviews I was a lil worried about the pizza being undercooked. Sadly my pizza was a little burnt on the bottom...if it wasn't this would have easily been a 4 star review!   We got the pizza to go, as we were feeling lazy! The bar was a dive bar and not as sketchy as I thought it was going to be. The guys that worked the pizza spot were super nice. The pizza was good...we got a caesar salad and the dressing was AMAZING!!! I'd go back if was near by...it's worth a try...

Average at best. I was shocked that Triple D paid this place a visit. We came here on our last meal in Vegas after eating at incredible places-so maybe that's why we weren't impressed. We ordered a fourth of the square pizza with garlic and sesame seed crust, mushrooms and tomatoes. The pizza was okay but nothing that would entice me to return. The place was a  divey bar--that's fine. But ordering drinks was time consuming. I would suggest stream-lining the process.

Came hear after driving past it on a regular basis. Was unable to go in previously as usually had my kid w me and it's in a dive bar. Went on a whim after working out. What else does one do after they've hit the gym? Go to Naked City of course!  Ordered and was hungry so got a bit too much food. I'm not a pizza person but did get a sheet in the event I became a fan. ordered the buffy wings which were wicked and the stinger taco which was also goooood.   From what I was told the pizza was good but a wee bit too doughy. Have had wings again and were just as good.  It took about 1.5 hours for my order so sat @ the bar. Was supposed to take 45 min. Luckily the beer was cold and the bar dimly lit.

Just picked up this pizza and eating for the first time, totally my style with lots of crunchy crust and great tasting sauce. Best part is I live down the street so will be ordering this all the time now !!
Amazing Pizza just like on DDD! Our server was very sweet and helpful. The pizza was cooked perfectly and the white sauce was delicious! We will be back the next time we are in Vegas!!!

Yes this is in a bar you are not mistaken! Pros-Pizza was great, and the heavy male server was super nice. However the suicide fries that are highly recommended may have been good if I could feel my face again after the first bite! Soooo hot!! The waitress (prior to mr. nice server guy) didn't warn us. They did take it off the bill since we couldn't eat them. Good deal.  Cons- The place is a total dive bar and is smoky on the inside. It was early and I didn't feel nervous but I bet the night crowd could be a little...um...less than nice. I admit I'm a non-smoker, so waaahhh, but if you don't want smoke in your pizza taste - get it to go.

Note to self: next time I go to a place called a "sandwich shop," maybe I should order a sandwich?!  Actually, my "Naked Chop" aka a chopped salad with turkey, greens, carrot, tomato, onion, and avocado wan't bad... it didn't blow me away either.  And it took awhile to make!    I was with Misti Y and we came here straight from the airport.  I must've worked up quite an appetite flying in from LA, because I was pretty hungry when we arrived... but I felt like a salad, so that's what I ordered.  It just wasn't the most filling salad around.  Hence, my "note to self" above...  I'd give this place another shot and I suggest you do if you're in the hood, but take my advice - order a sandwich, not a salad!

This place is located on Arville and Desert Inn.  The pizza here is made from scratch down to the sausages and meatballs, and the quality is great.  We stopped by yesterday. The music was loud for me but it is a dive bar-like and mostly college crowd. There is a window next to the bar where you make your order and they bring it to your table. It was quite a wait but worth it as it was freshly prepared.  We built our own medium pizza with our choice of toppings: mozarella, pepperoni, mushroom, and bacon. It's not only crunchy, light and airy but hearty. There was so much leftover. I didn't have room for Suicide fries or Wings. Prices aren't bad.  There are numerous topping choices to choose from as well as some specialty pizzas. Don't be misled by the location or the interior or exterior decor.

Not gonna lie, I was hesitant to check this place out, but I sure am glad I did!  When I arrived, there were about three cop cars parked outside ...at noon.  It just made this dive bar look really sketch.  But maybe all that reluctance built up my appetite, because we ordered everything: wings, a pie that's served on a tray the size of a cookie sheet, fries, and a beer tower.  Needless to say, all that good stuff has left us coming back for more.    The pizza is full of flavor and craft, and is cooked to perfection.  While the pizza is large, it doesn't fold over bc of heavy toppings, and you don't lose toppings dripping off your slice as well.  Such things matter; try and taste for yourself!

So I was extremely excited to try this place but was so very disappointed. The sign and curb appeal was weak and I could barely find the place.  When I went in the actual restaurant, there was no one in the store(customers and staff) for over 10 mins. I had to call the location phone number on the menu for someone to tell me that the staff and food was next door in a bar with a different name other than a Naked City Pizza. When I walked in the waitress only acknowledged that I was the person that just called. I sat at a table for 20 minutes or more without a single hello. But the table of 5 next to us got a check and to go boxes all while I was sitting there. At one point the waitress made eye contact with me but didn't speak or even smile. I didn't get a goodbye when I got up and left either. Too bad I didn't get to try the food I was so excited to try. Maybe I'll just try the other location next time. Service at this location was terrible!

After once again searching Yelp for some of the higher reviewed places near where I live I found the Naked City Pizza Shop.    The pizza shop is located inside of the Moon Doggies bar.  It's not even sectioned off like a Subway inside of a convenience store, it's really just a window in the wall.  It can be quite difficult to find if you've never been there before -- it's on the northeast corner of Arville and Desert Inn.  The bar itself seems to have bar seats for 15 people and small tables & high chairs for another 15.  It's the epitome of a dive bar but it seems to be clean enough.  Aside from the video poker at the bar, there's a golf arcade game, a hunting arcade game, an electronic dartboard, and one of those punching bag games.  Smoking is allowed everywhere, if that's make-or-break for you.  I came with a friend around 1:30 PM on a Tuesday and obviously there was little traffic.  The guy running the shop was really nice and attentive.  Huge bonus points for that, although some of the other reviews talk about bad or slow service so your mileage may vary.  We decided to try a little bit of everything and planned on taking quite a bit home with us.  Like other reviewers note, whether or not you eat there, everything is served in the styrofoam takeout containers.  If you eat there you do get some plates and plastic cutlery though.  We got some single slices of pepperoni pizza, a ham sub, seasoned fries, garlic buns, suicide wings, and fried dough.  Even a single slice of the pizza is huge and tastes great with a good sauce, great cheese, and superb dough.  I believe they call it Brooklyn style but all I know is it was great.  The pizza reminded me of Pizza Hut when I was a kid.  I don't mean in terms of taste or quality, but for me it was always a treat to get to go to Pizza Hut as a kid.  Nowadays I find their pizza quite bland, perhaps because my taste buds have changed, perhaps because their ingredients have changed.   Anyway Naked City's pizza gives me that same feeling as when I was a kid.  The ham sub has a lot of ham and a lot of cheese in it, and the bun of the sub is toasted, but it's just like something you would make from stuff you got in the store.   I would imagine some of the heated subs using their pizza ingredients are better.  The fries were great.  Done perfectly, and even the small for $2 filled up an entire styrofoam container.  The garlic buns are like garlic bread with cheese, served with marinara (which Naked City calls 'red sauce' on their menu).  Absolutely delicious with the bubbly browned cheese.  The wings themselves are large but nothing special.  The suicide hot sauce is quite messy but very hot.  The fried dough was quite good and covered in chocolate sauce.  It, like pretty much everything else, filled up a single styrofoam container but it wasn't "heavy" as far as desserts go.    The chef/server was really nice and as I mentioned above service was fairly fast.  Even though we ordered the dessert along with everything else he said he would bring it out a while after we had gotten the rest of our food and he even brought over a pitcher of soda for us so we wouldn't have to ask for a bunch of refills.  I'll be honest, I think the quality of service at most places in Vegas ranges from average to terrible, but this was top notch.  Overall, I'm a bit torn.  The food is great quality, huge portions, and very cheap.  The location leaves a lot to be desired though. I get the feeling that such good pizza and sides are almost wasted on the patrons of a bar when it deserves to be in a restaurant on its own.  This is definitely a diamond in the rough.   I'll probably go on my own again, get takeout, or order delivery, but it's pretty unlikely I'd take a group of friends or my family there.

I went to this location because it was recommended to me by a bunch of people and I have to say they were right, it's really good. I'm from NY and miss the pizza and this fulfilled my craving. It's more upstate NY style not thin city style. It has great flavor lots of toppings when ordered and the cheese is stretching off each slice they are not cheap with their toppings at all. And I have to say the girl Nicole that works there was extremely friendly and makes an awesome pizza, great customer service.

Hands down the best pizza in Las Vegas. This place is a classic dive bar and pizza joint. Food is fantastic, the pizza is off the charts. You can eat on site or take out. And you can smoke at the bar while you eat which is a rarity these days.  As far as the pizza goes...try the Guinea, it's phenomenal!

Super sad they don't make sausage sandwiches anymore.  They got awards for them for goodness sake!!!!! They still have sausages,  and they still make sandwiches.... what's up,  Naked City????
