You got rid of lobster pasta at the tavern,  then closed the tavern,  and now I can't even get a sausage sandwich??????
Saw this place on TV and decided to try it out. If you like the dive bar atmosphere then this is thr place for you. Great food, cheap drinks, and great service.

This place is mediocre at best.   I realize when talking pizza, not everyone has the same likes and preferences. The crust wasn't my favorite, very thick, but not awful. The sauce gave me heartburn so that wasn't fun, but my least favorite part of the pizza was the oh so important cheese. I really wasn't expecting such low quality cheese, I mean for the price I was under the impression the pizza here was a step above "pizza hut" but really I'd rather just buy $5 pizza at Little Caesars. The wings were good, nice flavor and cooked just right. Customer service was decent.  I like the location of this pizza joint, definitely very hole in the wall and loud but not too loud.  I doubt I'll buy pizza here again, but maybe wings.
peppers were blastingly hot and made me want to kill myself

Great food!  Tried the mild wings and the Frickin huge margarita pizza - flavor was great, portions matched the name. Teresa made us feel welcome and guided us well. Diners drive ins and dives served us well.
Took 1 star away for dinning area. Could be kept cleaner. Now for that PIZZA! IT WAS GREAT! Crisp crust, plenty of toppings sauce is PERFECT!

Purchase to-go pizza for my crew at lunch last week.  There was a power outage, but they still managed to get the pizzas ready and on time with their gas ovens and cell phones for lights!  Great pizza !   All the boys loved it.  We will be back.

I ordered food from here while visiting Vegas through Uber eats. The food came quickly, it was hot, and the order had what I needed. The pizza slice was the right size for the price and cheeezzzzzyyyyyyy :) the wings were great and the extra blue cheese dressings was all there as requested. Not one complaint from me! I'll have it next time I visit too
Pizza is to die for....nothing better than a run down smokey bar full of hooked and booze.lol jk..  but Seriossly it's amazing pizza

After driving for hours to Vegas, pizza sounded pretty good. A friend really wanted to come here, so we decided to try this place out. Located inside of Moondoggie's Bar, this dimly-lit dive bar/restaurant was a little intimidating to walk in to. After being seated, service was definitely slow. Our orders weren't taken for quite some time. Also, food took a long time to be made, even though it wasn't very crowded. Only one other couple was eating in the dining area, and there were only a handful of people sitting at the bar. Our server spent the majority of her time helping the customers at the bar.  Food: - Chicken, Mushroom, and Spinach Pie - This rectangular-shaped pizza had plenty of chicken, though there could have been more mushrooms and spinach. Ingredients weren't very well distributed on the corner pieces. The dough is pretty heavy, so it's quite filling. - Garlic Fries - Fresh garlic, parmesan cheese, and parsley. Pretty good and a decent size.

Very disappointed in the $41 Pizza I just got they should have put a sign reading this $41 Pizza may be hazardous to your eyesight you will hurt your eyes looking for the meat on the pizza the last pizza I ordered like this had a tremendous amount of meat and pepperoni and sausage this one was very disappointing so I won't be coming back the owner of McDonald's once said if you're going to make a bad hamburger make it bad all the time that way at least your customer knows what they're getting too inconsistent with the pizzas very sad Guy Fieri would be very disappointed I hope everyone that orders their guess what they pay for I sure didn't

This place presents me with way too many moral dilemmas than I'm prepared to face over the course of one meal. It's every bit as wonderful and decadent as you might have heard, and you're probably going to obliterate any notion of health consciousness you may have once had just to get through.  For one, I can't come here without ordering the suicide fries. I love spicy food, and these fries speak to me in ways that most places that boast spicy dishes could ever begin to understand. The fries are crisp and awesome, drenched in a truly hot sauce. The problem here is that I can't hardly justify eating a mound of fries when I know I'm gonna have pizza. They just give you so many fries, even with the small order. It's a dilemma because I don't let myself come here very often because I don't want to gain a hundred pounds, so when I do visit, I've got to have pizza , and I've absolutely got to have fries. Also, I don't like to waste food, so you see the beginning of my problems.  Then the pizza is massive, covered in cheese... I'm full after just a few slices, and my wife is never any help. Dough is light and tastes surprisingly fresh. It's so good I usually push myself to eat more when I know I shouldn't.  I just can't hang with this place.  Atmosphere can be relaxed sometimes when there isn't a crowd, but being that it's located in a dive bar, you just never know what kind of crowd you're going to get. Definitely not a place for a quiet dinner... Or a dieter.

EPIC pizza hidden inside Moon Doggies off Arville And Desert Inn. Pizza Aficionados welcome, and bring an appetite. I nominate the Guinea Pie for best white pizza of the year. ''Please cast your vote by clicking the cool icon''.   The Pizza here is made from scratch down to the meatballs, and the quality is noticeable. Due to this added quality assurance protocol and time honored method of ''Freshly prepared,'' you may have to wait for your food. Be prepared for a lengthy wait, though it is well worth it. Prices also reflect quality, but again the increase is worth it, and I will say a mediocre increase considering the taste and quality are exceptional.  Here you order your pizza by the sheet. 1/4 of a sheet was more then enough to feed 2 friends and myself, and half a sheet should keep your fridge well stocked with delicious cold pizza leftovers. A whole sheet? I dare not order it. That's cold pizza for a week! Think of it as the birthday party pizza.   Suicide Fries = HOT FRIES. I like hot, and the sauce on these should not disappoint unless you inhale Ghost peppers by the handful, then you sir are the exception.   The added plus of being located in a bar is the drinking options. You have plenty of beer and hard liquor choices to cover all bases. Enjoy your epic pizza!

Ordered to go and had a delivery service bring it to me, ordered hot Sicilian wings, margarita pizza and the cheese stuffed peppers. The pizza was super thick soft doughy with hardly any cheese and sauce, the wings were not what I had ordered they were the normal Sicilian wings not hot and they were bland and flavorless. The pepper was just ok. But to top it all off they gave us no napkins no forks. It was just a terrible experience I will never order from this place again.

For all you Triple D Fan's don't bring your kids. I went here to try another spot on the Triple D list and I'm starting to doubt Guy's taste bud's, he is 50/50 so far in my book. Drove into town looking to try a good eating spot. Went here with family and got a big surprise once we got there. It's a bar/lounge nothing for the Fam. Being from the Windy City I know good pizza. I felt like we ordered a hot n ready from Little Caesar's. It wasn't nasty but it will not get any recommendations from me.  When I got there it was a guy out front drinking a beer, he said he owned two tattoo shops, and he was pumping the place up saying, everything was good. Hahaha it amazes me how different people taste's are telling them something is good versus what is really good. I'm totally convinced that if there were a taste test to prove that some foods are not as good as others, I think a lot of people would like the crap food over the good flavorful foods.   I also ordered the wings with all the sauces I like my sauce on the side so I can actually taste the wings and my wings were dry and brittle. The sauces were typical. I get better wings at Buffalo Wild Wings and sauces to.   The fries were rubbery and soft nothing to brag about, I was really disappointed with my order, but I'm sure it's hit or miss when you do take out, but nothing can save that pizza flavor, it doesn't matter if the pizza is cold or hot when it's good it's good, and this pizza needs some more flavor added to it.   Other posts on here mentioned the staff and I had a little blond help me with my order and she was making me feel like I was asking for to much when I asked for more Ketchup. She wasn't pleasant at all. Oh and speaking of the ketchup. I heard they make their own, they should stick to buying it from the market. Not at all impressed with the watered down taste.   I may try this place some other time to see if it will be better dinning in. But for now based on the amateur Pizza, dry ass wings and lack luster fries this place is getting Two Stars.

How does this place only have 3 stars? Yes the place is a little divey actually a lot and the service is sub-par and they give you warm water. But how doesn't the back home or guniea pizza pie make up for it...some of the best pizza in Vegas! Cheap brews large domestic around 3 bucks, nice laid back atmosphere. Great place to get a couple drinks before you hit the strip or head downtown. I set the record on the boxing machine 967 so umm good luck to everyone on that.

I've come full circle.  This was actually the very first review I gave on Yelp, warranted by a terrible experience I had here.  I was very reluctant and stubborn to try this place again, but my husband finally convinced me to.  Naked City has been redeemed by its food.  The food is really great here.  The poutine fries were something I had never tried/heard of before, but were super tasty.  I have tried two of their pasta specials, which have very interesting and surprising ingredients like crab and butternut squash pieces.  And the pizza is doughy and flavorful.  I like the food a lot, I'll give them that.  BBBBUUUUTTTT.  I still absolutely hate the fact that this place is inside Moondoggies Bar.  That bar is a disgusting, dark, cigarette-smoke filled, urine-reeking bathroom, dingy place.  I do not like trying to eat my yummy food in that place.  How do they get away with having the restaurant in a smoky bar anyway?  Didn't they pass a law that says you can't smoke where there's food?  Naked City needs to get its own building to make it more welcoming and enjoyable.
Dive bar. A lot of bikers. But pizza is very good and good poutine. Service is very good as well.   Everybody is very friendly.  Kim is the best bartender. So awesome and  customer oriented.

This place is amazing! We found out about it by watching the Food Network, and of course we had to go! This is our 3rd time going! They have a family side if you don't want to sit on the bar side! (which tends to be loud and smokey) We are OBSESSED with the Atomic Fries! We are making this our regular pizza joint!  The pizza is amazing and is square cut so lots of crust!! We also ordered the meatball skillet which was super yummy! Cant go wrong with anything you choose!!

pizza was good, but there was a giant bubble on the corner that should have popped during the baking process. cheap beers and the pizza isn't expensive either. separate bills is a little annoying,  I'm sure it is forthe server as well. not too smoky, but we still smelled like smoke when we left. will go again. oh, yeah, pepperoni bowls of grease.

This little gem is located inside MoonDoggie's Bar on the left toward the back of the bar. For a pizza joint to be open until 3am, this is just what I need in the middle of the night when I can't head over to Amore's Taste of Chicago.  I ordered a pepperoni pizza, just a half sheet, for two of us. This was PLENTY of food, and we ended up bringing half of it home. The pizza was only like $15 and was ready quickly. The bartender at MoonDoggie's was also really friendly, though his personal selection of music from his iPod varied from heavy metal to R&B music lol.  I would have rated the pizza a 7 out of 10 (with 5 being an average pizza). The dough was great, the pepperoni was great, but the cheese was where they missed. The cheese was tasteless and I had to add a little bit of salt and peppers to give the pizza that zing that I was looking for.  I'll definitely be back to Naked City Pizza for a pie.
Ordered a large pizza and nuclear fries. Fries are really REALLY hot. Pizza was dry. Needed more sauce. We ordered carry out so I can't say anything about the restaurant itself.
Just went back this weekend, better than I remembered..Grimaldi's who??? All about the guinea pie, my favorite with some serious meat balls on it....Love this place!

I live close to this place so i drive by all the time, looked interesting. As far as being the best pizza in Las Vegas is not true by any means. Thick crust plenty of cheese but ultimately  BLAND, also the toppings few and far between.  I dont know.

I saw this place advertised in our weekly Mail newspaper thingie and always kept it in the back of my mind to try.  It's Buffalo style pizza (thick slightly sweet, yeasty crust) a buttload metric ton of cheese and little spicy pepperoni that curls up and holds the grease for ya. Being from near Buffalo this is a taste of near home.  If you are from Upstate or Western NY get your butt here!!  Even if you are not from NY, you'll live this pizza. We have been a couple times and brought friends. It's our go to pizza place. Yes, the puzza take awhile but they are done right!! We recently ventured into the appetizer portion of the menu...  Seasoned fries. Delicious!!  Do you know what a pizza log is? Usually it's this totally crappy yet weirdly addictive frozen egg roll looking thing filled with cheese and pepperoni and deep fried and the grease squirts out the end and gets your date in the eye and leaves a big grease stain on your shirt. I haven't had one in a long time so I decided to get pizza logs. Well...um...these are legit homemade and now we will ALWAYS order those and a pizza.  Hint: the best left over pizza I ever had was their white pizza. Mmmmm  Go here.  Do it now.  Why are you still reading this? Get in your hooptie and go!!!  P.S. It's a buffalo bills bar!  Don't wear a dolphin jersey here!

Ok first off, this place is KNOWN for being in a dive bar so get over that right off the bat. (You'll be glad you did!) Featured on Triple D with Guy Fieri we just had to stop in and we were SO glad we did!  The Guinea - 5 stars. My husband is somewhat of a pizza connoisseur and let me tell you, he was speechless; fist pumping with every bite. Needless to say, we'll be back.

So my experience with the menu is somewhat limited - I've had the poutine twice and I had their sub of the month about a week ago.   The sub was pretty bland which is hard to do with a hot wing themed sub.  As for the poutine, I struggle to review it. I'd actually classify it closer to a cheese fries and gravy than a poutine. If you've eaten at a diner in NY or NJ, you've had this dish... fries with some sliced cheese melted over the top and brown gravy. While the flavor was decent (good gravy which is important) the fries definitely needed to be more well done - a good poutine needs crispy fries in my opinion. That said, this also isn't what I would consider to be poutine. A true poutine has nice cheesy curds located throughout like nuggets of gold that you discover and cherish like pirate's booty....  Good, not great, but when I'm lookin' for a fix, I'll definitely go back.

I was very excited to hear that one of my favorite sandwich shops was opening a Pizza joint.  So there was no way I was going to miss out on the first day they open.  I worked out for 2 hrs in the morning in anticipation of the calories I planned to consume...ha!  The restaurant is located inside Moondoggies video poker bar.  I was pleased to see that the menu was much larger than their sandwich shop....so I went big and ordered a Slice of Cheese, Slice of Pepperoni, Slice of the Pie of the Day (Royal, see menu pics for details), and an order of 3 Chicken Fingers.  The Pizza came out first.  I tried the Cheese Slice first.  It is a thick crust.  The menu calls it Buffalo, NY Style Pizza....I've  never had this style before.  The pizza is loaded with Cheese....the crust is soft and doughy, not how I usually prefer my Pizza but it was good.  There is a good proportion of sauce.  The second slice I had was the Pepperoni.  It has the small slices of Pepperoni and the best part is that the Pepperoni is slightly burnt...+1 in my book.  Again, good proportion of sauce and cheese.  Nice zing to the Pepperoni too.  The third slice was the Royal, which was the best of the 3....no wonder it was the Pie of the Day!  Cappicola Ham, Italian Sausage, Mozzarella, and Ricotta goodness all in one Pizza Pie!!!!  The meats are very tasty and fresh....this combo went well together.  I am glad I splurged and went for it.  The last thing to come out was the Chicken Fingers....they were good, not great. The sauce was Mild and the appropriate spice level.  The fingers were not the crispy style, but the soaked chewy style.  It was ok.  Moondoggies is an older bar, so don't expect a great atmosphere....it's a video poker bar and it is not in the suburbs....and hasn't been Gentrified....yet. ;-)  Will I return?  You bet your Naked Heiney I will!!! I want to try some of the other Pies and definitely the other Subs that they don't have at their Sandwich Shop.

Not living in the Buffalo area anymore there are certain thing you miss. CHICKEN FINGER SUBS!!!! My wife and I both order one, because neither one of us wanted to share. It was awesome. Bartenders are awesome and great music on the box. Felt like we were back at the Pink on Allen St. Worth the 4 hour flight!!

Really good pizza and wings.  I don't typically like wings but someone else had ordered them so I tried them and they are very good.  This is my favorite pizza spot in Vegas so far.  I went to the one on Paradise as well, but the service wasn't as good.
This is based on take out only. Place looks like a dump but the pizzas are really good. Not the greatest part of town but the pizza are really good....lol

I have to remind myself that this is bar and I am rating bar food. So I kinda feel silly because it is bar food, so maybe I shouldn't be so harsh? I came primarily to try the poutine fries, but of course also ordered a pizza. We placed our poutine fry order, and it took 30 minutes for them to come out, it was a small order and we were the only people in the dining area. Our server was always coming around checking on us, so I know it wasn't her fault for the delay, so we couldn't really figure it out. Was a little strange to get your app at the same time as the meal. As for the pizza, it is Sicilian style (rectangular) which I'm not a huge fan of because I like crust, so you have an entire mid section of pizza that is all alone because I eat around it. We ordered half margherita and half back home. When the pizza came out it looked good, but as I got a couple bites in, it started to taste gross. They bake the pizza with the basil on it instead of putting it on after, so the basil is wilted and burnt, the tomatoes tasted canned and the cheese was gross to look at after 15 minutes, it became hard and formed, and the crust had an overwhelming taste of yeast, clearly not quality ingredients. Again, I realize I'm at a bar. My stomach has been a little upset since I ate. The two things this place has going for them is the Pandora station they play and the poutine fries, but I'd never come back and wait 30 minutes for them.

I would never even have given this place a second look had I not seen it on Triple D. I decided to try it because I figured it would not be on the show if it wasn't any good. It was only alright. First of all, it is definitely a bar. It looks like a strip club on the outside and when you walk in, its dark and smokey. I'm not really a bar guy so I kinda felt out of my element. I will say however, the staff was really polite and helped me get what I needed. I ordered the Naked City Pizza and an order of Suicide Fries.  The pizza was only okay, but the fries were delicious!. I loved the creaminess of the buttermilk sauce and the spice of the suicide sauce!   In the end, it was okay but there are better places with a more comfortable atmosphere. Not for people like me but not bad.

Good people. Good food.  However: I once ordered pizza, and requested that the crust be made "thinner than usual".  The response was "grunt...ok...i'll try...grunt". Well it was still way too thick...and bready. It must be a Buffalo thing.  They're not good at posting their specials online, either on facebook or their website, so you have to call or visit to figure out what the daily special is. I've been wanting to try one of their "Turducken  Burgers", but I can never figure out when they're available. It must be a Buffalo thing.  After this review, the next time i go in, they'll probably kick my ass. That's definitely a Buffalo thing.  (I'll wear a disguise.)

Everytime I come to vegas which is very often Naked City is or shall I say was a must! I literally would buy some while staying and then buy more to take home. I rant and rave about Naked City. This last visit I took  6 people with me we ordered 1/2 sheet sausage and mushroom, anothet pizza, Italian doughnuts, and wings. Not only was the pizza maker/cashier soo rude, but my pizza was horrible. Hardly any toppings, pizza looked dry, the nastiest part is the doughnuts smelt so bad. Like if the oil they were cooked in hadn't been cleaned and was old. My whole car filled with the smell. Came back to the hotel and looked them over. Gross. Threw them away. I had never ordered the doughnuts and when I asked the cashier pizza guy if he's had them he said no with no smile no expression, as if I was irritating him. Then he said they are  doughnuts with powdered sugar and rolled his eyes and his attitude and tone were extremely rude. Fast forward when we get back to the hotel , open the boxes, and realize the food looked disappointing. I was so embarrassed. Everyone I was with started talking about the horrible quality and taste. I called the next day and asked for the manager, no manager was available and the person in charge didn't give a  darn about the awful experience...total disappointment.

the first part of the review is for their ordering system(s) or lack thereof.  about a month ago i tried to order takeout  by calling to place an order.  the phone rang and rang and rang with no answer.  next try i used their "on-line" ordering system.  i ordered and showed up a half hour later only to be told that the cook never got the order because whoever received the order didn't relay it to him. maybe instead of spending time on NPR critiquing other pizza places in town, the owner of naked city pizza should take care of his own house. 0 stars  alas, i finally tried the pizza.  it wasn't terrible but i had big expectations based on numerous reviews and a fair amount of self promotion.  i'll start with the good.  they certainly use a decent quality cheese that melts nicely and has good flavor.  the pizza was also cooked properly.  now for the not so good sarting with the crust.  i'm sure there are many people that like this type of crust.  i'm not one of them.  it's really just a white bread dough recipe.  too much of a "gut-bomb".  i also prefer a sauce that is a little spicier and has a richer tomato flavor.  i also prefer one that is sans bay leaves.  finally, the toppings are too skimmpy for this thicker, heartier style of pizza.  2 stars.

This place is delicious. It's a total dive... located inside a little bar on Arville near Chinatown. Don't expect your dining experience to be glamorous. Also, we were very confused as to how it worked- we didn't know we could get a waitress, so we stood at the window waiting for someone to help us. They were short staffed, but the waitress was very good to us- she even took time out of her busy day to take a picture of my friend and I by wall of shame they have.  Now, about the food.... It's really out of this world. We tried to the buffalo chicken dip- superb. I really loved it. It comes with hunks of fried chicken fingers in it, with plenty of pieces of their yummy flatbread for dipping. And the pizza... oh my gosh, really really good. We got the Back HOme pie, topped with their housemade sausage and yummy pepperoni. It was mind blowingly amazing.  I washed it down with a 2.25 bud light- can't beat that deal. you can't beat these prices. I suggest everyone tries this place- maybe when the DDD hype is over : )

We have lived right across the street from here for years and have never tried it. We heard they were on food network and they had done renovations so we finally decided to try it. It was better than we expected. It is a full bar with tables and it's 21+ only. We sat down on the tables and was greeted by the server and she right away got us water as it was 100+ degrees out. They bring a big glass bottle of filtered water to pour yourself which I thought was good so u don't have to wait for refills. We ordered the poutine fries the wee size was perfect size to share, meathead sub full size, and wee size guinea pie. All of the food was delicious! The fries were cut thick and fried perfectly, covered in brown gravy and cheese and fries weren't even soggy. The meathead sub was awesome! It's brisket with pickles, mustard and melted cheddar cheese. All the flavors melted together perfectly, they put a good amount of meat and the brisket was super moist and juicy, even the sub bead they used was crisp on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. The pizza was rectangle and cut into 6 pieces we could only eat 2 bcuz we were so full. The pizza had spinach, ricotta, mozzarella, slices of sausage meatball, and garlic cream sauce. The crust on it's own was great, it was like having a soft chewy breadstick at the end, perfect for dipping. Food came out pretty fast but there werent too many ppl ordering food at the time. The waitress was attentive and helpful with the menu. I'm pretty sure we'll become regulars lol

After hearing about this place on DD&D, I was really looking forward to trying a new pizza place. Unfortunately, my experience was less than stellar. We came in on a Thursday night to a bar that was, at best, 40% filled. It took 15 minutes for the waitress to even come over and take our drink order (not for lack of trying to get her attention) and another 20 just to get our drinks. Considering we ordered a water and a soda, I was a little disappointed. When the pizza finally arrived, it was a little greasey. My friend got a standard pizza (pepperoni), and I got one of their specialty pies. He was disappointed but I thought the pizza was pretty decent. I just would have liked a refill on my water without having to ask the waitress three times. I worked in food service for many years, so I understand that things can happen. But if that's the wait time on a slow Thursday night, I would hate to be there on a weekend.  Overall -- respectable pizza, service that left something to be desired. Probably worth giving a second chance, though.
Some damm great pizza here. Ive been a few times and always found the atmosphere very inviting and positive energy

Decent pizza, but nothing more. It is definitely a dive. I think the Food Network should take this place off their site, since the food is not really special. The cheese is good, but the sauce is average, and so is the case for the crust. Wouldn't come back when I visit Vegas, considering the location is out of the way.

A great pizza, unfortunately it's located in a really, really divey bar (Moon Doggies) with music so loud it makes it hard to think. Everytime the music paused for whatever reason it was such a relief!   Loud music aside, the pizza was pretty good. The lots of cheese and a slightly tangy, tasty sauce. The crust was not thin and crispy, which is ok by me. It was yeasty and chewy. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to sample any of the sandwiches or fries, not sure if I will be able anytime soon, need to let my hearing return.  The one saving grace of the atmosphere were the bathrooms, sometimes 2 people would go in and one lady would come out or vice versa. The permutations were mind boggling!

LOVE THIS PIZZA!!!! We NEVER leave Vegas without stopping here for pizza, wings, and fries! Located inside Moon Doggie's Bar ( Bills fans) means you can get some of the best drinks in town as well. We've told several family and friends about this "hidden treasure" and it has also become their tradition to visit before leaving Vegas. Our eldest child, our Son now makes this a tradition as well when he visits Vegas with friends.  You should definitely stop in, order your pizza, fries, and wings. While you wait for your food to be prepared hot and fresh, order a couple shots, a drink, and enjoy your visit! You'll definitely make it a tradition too!

I will start by saying if you don't want to eat at a bar, try another location. That being said, I'm from Buffalo and this place does it right! We went today for lunch because I needed to try the Beef on Weck, a Buffalo favorite that's right up there with wings and it was great! The kimmelweck rolls were perfect and they served it with horseradish, it took me back home. The wings were spot on and the only negative for me was they were served with fries instead of carrots and celery and I prefer a different kind of blue cheese, just my preference. Unfortunately I cannot comment on the pizza because I was too full to even take a bite but it did look good! One more thing, the people who took care of us, I'm sorry I didn't get their names, were so nice and got us all the extras we asked for with a smile. I'll definitely be back for the pizza next time, hopefully for a Bills game!

The Pizza was delicious.  It came delivered in an extra large mutant rectangular box.  We ate the pizza over at the Double Down Saloon.  So we had the guy from diners dives and drive ins' pizza at Anthony Bourdain's Dive Bar.  It was a fun afternoon.  Incidentally, if you go to the Double Down, have the Bacon Martini and an Ebola shot.  The pizza was so big we shared it with the bartender and our cab driver.

Met up with some friends for beers and grub pre-movie premeire.  We were not dissapointed.  This is some good freaking pizza! Obscenities flew out of our mouths, uncontrollably, as we feasted.  So delicious! I am sure it depends what kind of pizza you like;  I like a fluffy doughy marvelous pizza.  Some people prefer that crappy crispy cardboardy stuff.    We had the guinea pie - Chris proclaimed it was his favorite.  My favorite now too! AMAZEing.  Meatballs, ricotta, garlic, fresh mozzarella. YUM.  We also had poutine, and the pork ragu fettucini from the specials board which came with chewy, delicious garlic buns, and a zesty sald with vinaigrette.  Just to finish of our carb fest, we ordered the fried. dough.  This does not such.  Warm chocolately powdered sugary goodness.  So $32 for four people - is this a joke? Salad, pizza, buns, pasta with a pound of flavorful shredded pork, and fried dough?!?! What a deal!  I'll be back asap!

IF your a pizza lover this is the only place to go. Pizza here is sooooo freaking good im not sure how they do it. Pizza, Wings, Suicide fries and pizza egg rolls are just out of control. Cheap beer as well. If u make one stop in vegas make this one it.

OK I tried them again.  Pizza was eh.  Nothing special and kind of expensive.  What make me angry was that they hassled me about my coupon.  If you are going to use coupons in your business you need to allow employees to enter them without needing to call a manager.  Sorry, but customer service failure.

The hoagies were HUGE! Fries tasted fresh ur and amazing, and the pizza is the best square pizza I've had since living in Scranton, PA. You really get what you pay for here - top notch quality.  Also, the woman behind the counter with multicolored hair was very helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this place!

Weird little hole in the wall.  A small plus in my book.  Despite having only one employee there our two pizzas still came out pretty quickly.  They were a bit bread-heavy but overall the flavor was pretty good.  I'd come back again, but might walk back out if there were a lot of people in there waiting on pizzas.

This is a great place to order one for delivery.   I am staying at the Wyndham and the pizza arrived hot and within 20 min of the order.  (Faster than I get at home)   Good quality pizza with lots of cheese and sauce.   Great Job!!

Sweet jesus, I'm in love with Naked City. The pizza is thick, bubbly, and just the right amount of browned. The cannelloni was fantastical. Everything I have tried is absolutely delish! The suicide fries are not to be underestimated, bring Tums and order them! Also, they offer pizza by the slice, I got pizza and a drink for less than $5.00!  Digging this place, big time!  Note, you must be 21 to enter restaurant due to it being in a bar.
Great Pizza and Fingers! Ready in 20 minutes rather than 45 like most places. Easy parking to get in and out pretty quickly.

Must have gone on an off night. Have heard good things about the pizza here, and really wanted to like it, but the pizza dough, sauce and (veggie) toppings were all completely bland and tasteless :( YMMV...

After reading some amazing reviews about this place I had to try it out.   I order a pizza and some suicide fries.   I will say I loved the fries. Just hot enough that most will want to steer clear if you don't like spicy yet hot enough that those who love heat will enjoy. I will be back here for these alone.   I will say I wasn't that impressed with the pizza. I have had better and worse in this town. I think this place might get some benefit to being a dive. It's what I call the food truck effect. Any food served from a food truck is automatically 3 to 4 times better than it actually is. Just because people like dives and loves food trucks. The pizza here is good but nothing amazing. I can see ordering pizza hear in the future but wont go out of my way for it.   Last but not least on my second visit in under a week I had the suicide wings. They were just okay as well. Where did the heat go. Would have liked these much hotter.   I say give this place a try if you like dive bars, but be warned if you take your rose colored glasses off it might just be a slightly above average place to eat.

We ended up not eating here being 8 months pregnant I didn't want to wait in a bar with smoke everywhere.  A family came in behind us and they left as well.  You order in a small window inside this spot.  Even though the pizza looked amazing and reviews seemed great I am disappointed we couldn't enjoy this.  This place is very dark and had loud music as well.   Not family friendly.

Me and my sister went there yesterday for lunch.  Both of us had the tr-tip sandwich and it was excellent.  I'm thinking of going back right now!  I'll probably change to 5 stars after a few more visits.
absolutely amazing food great fast service I love this place. huge pizzas for reasonable price.

Came here because of DDD also, but found it disappointing. The suicide fries had nothing unique on them. It could have been a jarred suicide sauce for all I knew and was not that hot. Ordered the Stinger pizza and couldn't find/taste a couple of the ingredients (blue cheese, chicken finger hot sauce). Drinks were fine. Service was slow even though they weren't that busy on a Monday night.
Great food best wings and pizza. Service and phone contact needs some work but all and all   because food is consistant you can tolerate the lack of personable attitudes.

Been here a few times now. Nothing too fancy,  but it's a fun hang out when you're with friends. Located in Moon Doggies, a little dive bar, this place is super laid back. Walk in all the way to the back and order from a tiny window.  After you order, you can hang out at the bar, knock a few back and play some Deuces Wild, or take a seat at one of the tables or booths. When your order is ready, they'll bring it out to you. Paper plates, napkins,  plastic utensils, and water are all self serve near the entrance. The music is blaring, so you kinda have to be a loud conversationist. They were playing punk rock and ska when I've been.   As for the food,  the pizza isn't the greatest, but good enough for the price. The crust is thin and a little hard. They used these tiny little pepperonis that reminds me of frozen pizza.  The portions are generous, though,  and you can order their special of the day by the slice. My favorite special so far was the chicken fried steak, with chicken finger pieces (I think) and country gravy. So good! I regret not ordering a full pie...   I usually get the poutine, too, the frickin huge size (good to share with 3-4 people. I don't have anything to compare it to, but I think it's tasty. The gravy is runny, but flavorful (the cheese curds not so much).   Another item I always order is the zeppoles. Deep fried pizza dough, covered in powdered sugar :D They come stuffed in a brown paper bag (how charming) served with chocolate syrup.  I like to take them home and doctor em up. Sprinkled with cinnamon, or dipped in caramel, with a nice cuppa coffee, they're addictive. You get a lot of em, but they're best fresh,  so if you have a lot left over, just nuke em for a few seconds prior to enjoying.

Food was good. We had the Stinger with mild wing sauce, a touch of spice but good flavor. We also had a another pizza with meats and tomato, that was good too. The pizza is thicker then hand toss and large. Our two quarter sheets easily would feed four.  The atmosphere is unusual but clean. I recommend this with an open mind or just take it Togo.

Chef Chris knows what he is doing when it comes to food. Yes the pizza is great but all the food we've tried is almost too good for the concept! Not much for the area of town, however, when you walk in, the atmosphere is awesome. Not intimidating to guests and very friendly. We have eaten here many times, and it usually is a twice a month venture (which is a lot for the wife and I). Great pizza place- HIGHLY recommended!

This place located in a dive bar was amazing! The pizza can take a while to come out but it's worth the wait. Since I found it, I've gone there maybe 5 tines in a month. Bartenders are sociable and friendly. The slice of the day is the best BC its random and well you don't get the sane thing every time. Suicide fries are yunny although extra hot. I recommend you get the sauce on the side BC damn. Will be going back frequently lol.

I love this place. Every time I come up to Vegas I have to stop here and have a Native and some suicide fries. It never gets old. The last time I was here I had their poutine for the first time. I will make sure I always order it again. I love that this place is in a locals bar. The food is amazing. You won't order a bad a thing on the menu I promise.

Nailed it.  We started with the wings - let me just say they nailed it.  Great wing sauce (we had the hot) and the homemade blue cheese was delicious.  Went with the Naked City Pie - very good.  The dough had a nice chew and the over-all flavor - very very good. I was traveling with a colleague from upstate NY and he signed off on everything also being quite good.  He was dumbfounded as to how good the wings were...and is argue he's an expert...lol. I'm so sorry I neglected to take a few photos - I'd highly recommend!!  I'll be back for sure on my next trip to Vegas.

I love the dive bar that it is in. The bartenders were nice and the guy working the pizza shop was nice also.   We started out with the stuffed mushrooms and the pepperoni egg rolls.  The mushrooms were stuffed with delicious house made sausage and served with bell pepper ranch dipping sauce, very good.  The egg rolls were stuffed with pepperoni and mozzarella cheese in an egg roll wrapper and then deep fried.  They were good, but nothing special.   We got two types of pizza. The first was the guineas pie.  Meatballs, spinach, white garlic sauce, and ricotta.  The second was the bacon and egg pizza with arugula, pancetta, white sauce, and brown eggs.  Both pizzas were good, at least the toppings were.  The thing I don't like about the pizzas was the crust.  It just didn't have enough flavor.  Very bland and chewy, needed salt. The meatballs had a lot of flavor and so did the white sauce. The bacon and egg pizza was the best with the salty pancetta and the arugula.   Overall very good meal, I will go back.

My husband and I love to try new pizza places. We went a few days ago to Naked City Pizza Shop and paid $45 for a salad, appetizer, and two 12" pizzas. We were hesitant, but we decided to give it a try... The crust was horrible!... I don't know what they're doing, but it tastes like frozen pizza. The pepperoni is so small and looks odd. We won't go there again. The food is bad and overpriced.

The pizza is great the poutine French fries are to die for, but be prepared the service is the worst i have ever have in my life take thw pizza home u dont wanna be there waiting for service that u might never have
Pizza is terrific!! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Service is just OK as it is a busy bar

Located inside a little dive bar, this place is a hidden gem. Who doesn't enjoy yummy food and cheap drinks?   Favorites: Guinea's pie, back home pie, loaded potato fries and suicide fries  Warning: the suicide sauce is spicy,but AMAZING. When I order the suicide fries, I ask for the sauce on the side so you can decide how much sauce to use and the sauce is good with the pizza!  Every person visiting Vegas That i have brought  here always wants to go back! Just writing about this place is making me hungry...

Now from the outside, this place might scare people off. Equal parts biker bar and tattoo parlor with metal music in the background, don't be afraid to explore because the pies were excellent.   We tried the Guinea's Pie and the Fatboy. The Guinea's pie came as a gooey, thick crust pizza. The crust itself on both pies were not doughy, but fluffy with just the right amount of crispness for that real oven baked taste and texture. Loaded with gooey mozzarella goodness and a white garlic sauce that isn't so strong that it overpowers the cheese, spinach and meatballs.   The Fatboy was flavorful with its meaty toppings of salami, pepperoni, ham, italian sausage. Closer to what a traditional meatlovers pizza would be without overloading it so as not to overpower the taste of the tomatoes or the crust. Another very good pie.   The wee sized portions are enough for two people share (6 slices in a rectangular shape).
Pizza here was amazing... I forget the name of the one I chose but it was artichoke, tomato, onion, peppers, garlic, some other stuff... wow
Food is always awesome and good service. Almost always get a full sheet with half Rebel and half Naked city. Garlic knots are legit and very good wings. Go here often as my waist line will allow it.

THE BEST PIZZA IN THE WORLD. I've never had better pizza than this. The Guinea Pie is incredible. White garlic sauce, mozzarella, ricotta cheese, meatballs and.. spinach I think? Such an amazing combination, and what you pay for it is beyond fair, cheap when you've been eating nothing but stuff on the strip for the last few days. We also ordered the loaded fries on the side of an order of chicken wings. Everything was perfect. The portions are huge, and the prices are unbeatable. Service was great too. We went next door to Moon Doggies while we waited and had a few drinks. Best time I had in Vegas probably. That pizza really just made my trip. I wonder if they can freeze it and ship it to California.. please???

I was on the road looking for Lola's and I had the wrong address.  Luckily I had my laptop with me and I had to go to a McDonalds to use their "free" WiFi.  Well.... I felt compelled to buy something so I got a quarter pounder meal deal for about $7 just to use their WiFi.  I found I was closer to Naked City Pizza, so I decdied to try this place.  I walk into this dive bar where it so dark, it took time for the eyes to adjust.  I asked where the restaurant is and they said I'm standing in it.  I sat at one of about 6 tables and proceeded to be shocked by what was being served in that environment.  We're talking white china style plates with silverware.  No paper plates and plastic forks.  I had the caeser salad which was very good.  The dressing tasted homemade, but can't be sure.  I had the garlic cheese buns and the small Royal sandwhich.  The buns are incredible. They are just pizza dough rolled with garlic and cheese.  Baked and served with a marinara dipping sauce.  They serve 5 per order.  This was great becasue they are fresh out of the oven. I only ate one and took the rest to my hotel.  My Royal sandwich was on a nice toasted Italian roll with their homemade sausage.  The fennel flavor of the sausage was WOW.  All that food for about $20.  Don't be afraid to walk in this dive looking bar. The food is well worth it.

I thought the pizza was really good however my husband thought it was bland. We also got an order of the suicide fries, the pepper sauce was very tasty. And the wings where just wings, the same as everyones. So the food was ok. But it is literally in the back of an all out dive bar. But if you are in the market for a used car there are plenty in the parking lot. .... yes they sell used cars out front. Well we went because it was on triple D.... and we found out after going just which "D" it was.

Everything is great about this place.. the pizza and the drinks that Arty (bartender at moon doggies) makes for you as you wait for your pizza.. This place is open late too.. great pizza great drinks..
Love this place great pizza and piping hot! Employees were very friendly and helpful. Great bar great music ! My go to place for pizza.

This update is long overdue as now this pizza place is my favorite in the whole city. When I first ate here i wasn't impressed....I liked that it was so close to my house and the bar is pretty cool. But after coming back again and ordering a classic sausage and mushroom pizza.....this is the best sausage pizza I've ever had in las vegas.....that's all I order and that's all I'm ever going to order. I've brought friends here and now they're hooked....my friends are chefs.

Excellent pizza. We had the bacon and egg one. So rich. So good. The buffalo chicken dip is delicious too. This place is a dive but good atmosphere. Robert was a great server. I'd definitely come back.

Searched for gravy fries or "poutin" in Las Vegas and came up with this place. French fries, gravy and cheese...simple enough yet not offered in most places on the west coast. I walked into this place and wanted to walk back out. Moon Doggies is a smoked filled local dive bar that houses a pizza shop inside. I was determined to get my poutine fries and ventured inside. Finally put my order in after standing at window for only 15 minutes, I figured how bad could it be? Fries were greasy, gravy was something I could have heated up from a jar, cheese curds looked like tapioca balls that I thought were supposed to melt into a gooey cheese blanket but alas no. Overall, a disappointing but should have known better from the looks inside experience. Will not be returning to this dirty dive. If you do go, get a HEP shot beforehand.

Very good pizza; and probably in my top 5 of best pizzas I've ever had around the world! The crust is amassing and the unique sauce with the meatball is something you can only find at Naked City Pizza! I highly suggest stopping in and getting a Guinea Pie Pizza!

Hmm, not bad. I decided to get some take out pizza, based on the DDD review.   I got 1 of each pizza - all cheese and Naked City. Also go the stuffed mushrooms and zeppoli.  For the pizza, the crust got a little soggy but the flavor, toppings, and cheese were great overall. The stuffing for the mushrooms was mostly sausage, I think. It was unpleasantly firm and lacked some flavor, though the sauce made up for that. The zeppoli also lacked some flavor - just tough dough with powdered sugar. Thankfully, there was some chocolate sauce for taste.  The pizza shop is in a dive bar. I suspect the pizza is great fresh and would go awesome with a beer in this place.
The pizza was amazing!    Took a star off because it's in a bar, so limits it to a babysitter night.  If it were closer I would do take out.  So sad because it was seriously yummy pizza.

Oh yes, when you gotta have a slice or two, and you just want it to be ready fast and taste good, get yer butt over here. This is great 'za, and he'll make you what ever you want, by the slice. At $3/ea, I was full after 1, two slices and I wished I hadn't but it was just so goooood. I got 2 Royales. Next time going for the Guinea and the White. Get some fresh basil on top and you'll be smiling.
I la-la-love their suicide fries!!! I just found out you can get suicide wings too so I am definitely going back to get those. definitely try the Guinea Pie too. Best pizza I've had in Vegas so far.

We tried the Poutine fries and the Naked City Pizza, and hubby had a Brown Ale, all very good. We ordered the small fries and pizza, more than enough for 2 and had some.to take home. Dinner for $22 in Las Vegas, great food. Nothing fancy, just great.food. Limited parking.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. (from "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives" to "Restaurant Impossible!") I understand slow/busy bar service - but this was straight up rudeness and we were ignored for over 20 minutes. we walked in (just two of us) in front of a group of four or so people. The group that came in behind us sat behind us as well, and they had their food before we even were acknowledged and got a glass of water. We tried asking the male waiter for water and he continued past us (ignored us!) and helped the table behind us, taking their order, bringing them several plates of food. The waitress then told us that the other waiter would help us. we were continued to be ignored. i felt bad that it was the waitress' first day, but the other waiter was of no assistance to her (or us), which made the entire establishment look bad. He kept walking past our table to serve and check on the group that came behind us. it took 20 minutes for a glass of water and an additional 5 to get my coke. we waited over a half hour for the garlic rolls (an appetizer) and about 50 minutes for a "wee" sized pizza.  Meanwhile the group that came in behind us has had a "not so wee" sized pizza (medium), a couple orders or wings, etc. and the waiter kept bringing out plates for them while we sat with one glass of water. The group of people behind us finished and paid for their meal as our fricking appetizer was coming out. the ONLY reason we didn't just walk away is human courtesy to the poor waitress on her first day. Looks like this place needs to be on food network again for the show "Restaurant Impossible!" because the male waiter was a complete ass - either that or he was racist and ignored my boyfriend. I literally saw him make eye contact as we asked for help and he kept it moving to the group just past us...that came in after us!  I will never come back, and i will never tell my out of town guests to come here.

Maybe Naked City Pizza is having a bad night in both locations. Drove from Paradise location to here (see other review) on the promise that the order would be placed for us while we drove. How could they have, phone here has been off the hook for hours. We were ignored when we came in, and when we asked about ordering, a woman wearing a Naked City shirt pointed to the window in the back. Asked about the advance order, and literally got a look like I had asked for pizza on a golden platter. Mentioned the phone being off the hook. Again must actually have two heads, the look again while she held up the cordless phone and showed us it was fine. (Called back while we were eating at home, and the line was still busy.) So unbelievably rude...worst I have experienced in a long time. Don't care if the pizza is good. Won't be returning.

One of my best friends raved about this place. Called it the best pizza in Vegas. I will admit I was judging it against this expectation he presented to me.   1am came across and we were all intoxicated. As the shouts that pizza arrived approximately 35 zombies dressed in various Halloween costumes. I cannot lie. It looked and tasted like a square papa johns cheese pizza. Nothing special. I am open to trying it again and will update this review if I do.

Can only rate the pizza which I have gotten to go twice. First time I picked it up and it was very good. The guinea's pie has meatballs, ricotta, spinach, mozzarella and a white sauce but I subbed in a red sauce. Had a unique, almost lemony, taste that my husband and I enjoyed. A half sheet was enough for two meals. The next time we ordered the same thing delivered but it was not as good. My main issue was that there was little to no cheese on the outer slices and none on one of the corner pieces. Cheese is important on my pizza, next time I'll order extra. Still a decent dinner for not too much $ and I will be back.

Can somebody please tell me what all the hype going around this place is about? This tiny sandwich shop on Las Vegas Blvd. was recently opened by two chefs, one of whom is the chef at Diego restaurant in the MGM. My husband and I read a very positive review in the Weekly awhile back and decided to try it out. They were applauded for their house-cured and smoked meats, and the fact that everything ranging from pasta salad to pickles is made in house, except the bread. My husband is a big sandwich lover so was excited that there might be a unique new sandwich shop in town, and close to our house at that. The first time we ordered the Naked Chopped salad ($7.99) and the Naked Veggie sandwich ($8.99), which were both disappointing. The salad wasn't chopped at all but came with massive slices of so-so meat and a few boring vegetables. The Naked Veggie was served on semi-fresh pumpernickle bread that was so thick you hardly tasted anything but. The filling wasn't good either, with unseasoned veggies and a terrible eggplant "stuffing" (as if the sandwich needed more bread). We were disheartened to say the least but today decided to give it another try. They were still new when we first tried it so perhaps they needed some time to adjust. This time my husband got the Royal sandwich on a kaiser roll, that was still way too thick. The hot cappicola inside was good but basically it was an average sandwich that was too heavy on the bread. It came with a side of pasta salad that could have been great if it wasn't under-done and under-seasoned, a side of homemade giardinera (not bad), and a habanero pickle (spicy and tasty). I was  feeling under the weather so I ordered the tortilla soup ($3.99) which was hands down the worst tortilla soup I've ever had. It was completely one dimensional and tasted like tomato paste mixed with hot water. It is prepared with tons of avocado chunks (who likes that much hot avocado?) and the toppings consisted of cheddar cheese cubes, sour cream with chilies, and stale tortilla chips. You would think that a chef of a Mexican restaurant could make a decent tortilla soup but this was inedible. I had two bites and threw the rest away. I called to let the girl at the counter know how disappointed I was but all she could say was, "Did you add all the toppings?" "Yes, but it probably would have been better if I hadn't" I thought. Nothing could make that soup better. What we don't understand is why this sandwich place that is mediocre at best is getting all these rave reviews on Yelp! and other sites. If anyone has had a good experience there I'd love to hear it, along with a detailed explanation as to why. It seems to me that they need to stop spending so much time curing all their meats and start spending time making the food taste good.

This place is awesome. My daughter had a desination wedding in Las Vegas this weekend and we wanted to be able to find a relaxing, fun,inexpensive place where everyone can be together, eat and drink. Naked City Pizza accommodated us (@30 people)on a short notice and we had an awesome experience. Pizza and chicken wings were delicious and pizza's are huge! We didnt expect it to be fancy or anything but it was perfect for us. We moved tables around, made a little dance floor, everyone in our party was pleased and enjoyed the setting. Very nice people! Definitely will be back!
Food was awesome. Get a lot for the price with all the expensive food in Las Vegas it's worth it.

PROS:  - Good pizza - Relaxed atmosphere - Off the busy strip  CONS: - slow service when more than 3 tables are filled - it's SO dark inside - miscalculated check DOUBLE CHECK YOUR CHARGES!!  Pizza was yummy. I tired a Build Your Own, and the Guinea's. The Guinea's lacked the garlic flavor I was expecting, but the Build Your Own pizza we ordered was delicious thanks to the sauce and dough. The dough is crisp, yet doughy inside. Here are my ratings (1 - 10, 10 being highest) for items i tried:  Build Your Own: 8 Guinea's Pizza: 5 Suicide Fries: 7 Garlic Fires: 3 (needs garlic!) Chicken Wing Dip: 7  I was very UNIMPRESSED about the check. Our group ordered a number of items from the menu and many of them were charged incorrectly on the bill. There were items that were $0.25 - $7.50 overchared.  Also, tax was incorrectly calculated as well. The waitress told me that each item price on the check included tax, but this was obviously incorrect since some items on the checked actually matched the menu price, while others were higher than the menu price.   I hope the manager(s) decides to convert to a computerized system.

We ordered dinner from here via Uber eats the food was fantastic! We run a doggy daycare so it's not always easy to get out for dinner! We had wings which were super yummy and saucey! But the fries were completely out of this world, I love spicy food and so I ordered the suicide fries they had heat but they also had awesome flavor and the portions are very generous!Cant wait to actually go here to eat because the Uber menu is limited! I highly recommend trying this place if you want simple food with a bang! Thanks so much Rhonda McCullough (North Paws Ranch)

We decided to give this place a try after seeing them on DDD. We went in on a Monday night so the place was pretty quiet and were greeted right away. My wife and I are big fans of spicy food so we had to try the suicide fries. On a scale of 1 to 10, I would rate the fries a solid 8. They are killer... we couldn't stop eating them! (the next morning was a different story, however :) We also tried their Naked City Pizza which was done right. The crust was perfect along with the cheese and toppings. We ordered the "not so wee" which is a medium and it was more than plenty for two people. Finally, the price was more than reasonable for the quality of the food. Give them a try next time you're in Vegas, I assure you their food beats any of the expensive junk they serve at casino buffets.

I am giving 3 stars because the pizza was delicious but the atmosphere here was terrible and uncomfortable! Moment we walked in no one greeted us and it was just dark and dreary! This place needs to be in its own separate building out of the bar!   The pizza we ordered was the guine pie and a pepperoni and we loved the pies!

The pizza was as advertised.   We had a "not so wee" Fat Boy pizza and a Royal hoagie.  We could've lived without the sandwich. It was some grilled italian sausage and cheese thrown on the bun.   The pizza had a perfect combo of crust to cheese to sauce ratio. The garlic flavored crust was done expertly as well.  It wasn't so overpowering that it ruined the taste of the pie.   It complimented and enhanced the flavor nicely.   The joint is small, a lil' smoky, and dimly lit.  People that cry about how smoky it is must have lived a pampered life.  Either that, or they are from California and don't remember what bars were like before the anti-smoking campaigns.  In other words it was a bar, not a smoky bar.

Pizza was amazing but the kitchen looks a little grungy. I also saw a lady carrying ice from the restaurant to the other side. Leaving one entry way to go into a separate side of the building. Seemed unsanitary.

I've read great reviews on this place& friend said pizza was very good, so away we go. Im up for new places & hole in the wall joints as well, as long as food is worthy of the go.. Was warned, it is a dive/biker bar feel...no big deal, im not a snob, as long as I feel safe. Its late lunch hour when we walk in. Music was so IncrediblY loud we couldn't hear eachother sitting at the table..I mean it was SupeR Loud,hit you in the face loud.. 3 people sitting randomly at bar, tvs strewn about. Very lo energy,out of order pinball game, vending machine with miscellaneous odd items..cigarettes & other things that didn't look like they belonged there.. seats were old & dingy..the booths seats were torn up, ripped to .... ,to be exact. Remarkable it did not smell of cigarettes though it looked like it would... We looked at menu , sat for over 5 minutes& No one even acknowledged our existence , not even a wave, nada. Between that & the obnoxiously loud music (maybe ok for nighttime , but off putting during the day) we got up & left. Maybe I'll order delivery at some point, but probably won't be rushing back to this place, like ever.

On a recent trip to Vegas for a conference a co-worker mentioned leaving the strip and heading out to a pizza place he saw on DD&D.  I have only gone to one recommendation from DD&D because it was local to me and was several disappointed that nothing I wanted was on the menu.  The co-worker did not remember what Guy had ordered so we had to ask the embarrassing question to our server just to ensure the super fan with us got the full DD&D experience.  We ordered medium wings, suicide fries, and a pizza.  The suicide fries were hot, I mean sweating profusely hot but not too hot to eat.  What do you expect from a dish named suicide?  We ate every single fry and after our mouths had cooled we craved that spice again.  The pizza was doughy for my taste but still enjoyable as a great followup to our spicy fries.  The wings were good as well but I not a big buffalo sauce fan so the rest of the group ate those while I scooped up any last remnants of those fries... The only wish I have for the place was more options for beer.  I asked the server if there was any special beers and she named Shock Top as an option.... I ended up ordering a forgettable local brown ale.  I do know that not ever bar/restaurant is going to cater to my beer needs so I can't fault them entirely but... I can hope that maybe the next time I am there something better will sneak onto the menu.   Overall I was very happy we stopped here and if I find myself in Vegas again anytime soon I will head over to enjoy those fantastic fries.
I had the white pizza, it had tons of cheese plus ricotta,  the crust was delicious! !  My new favorite pizza joint.

Boyfriend and I ordered buffalo wings (hot) and the naked city pizza.  Buffalo wings were great. Boyfriend gave them an 8 out of 10.  When our pizza arrived we had a slice each and halfway through eating our first slice we realized the toppings on the pizza weren't what we ordered. I went up to the counter and asked if we had received the wrong pizza or ordered something different. The cashier apologized for the mistake and offered to make us a new pizza with the right toppings. She also didn't want to take back the incorrect pizza. The wrong pizza was the fat boy pizza. It was okay but we're not big fans of ham on pizza.  When our naked city pizza came, the cashier also refunded us for our buffalo wings! Totally unnecessary but she insisted. The naked city pizza was delicious.  This place is great and the staff is super nice. They definitely went above and beyond to make our experience a good one.

I take no joy in giving a bad review. But, since I depend on good AND bad reviews when researching a new place, I think it's important.  That said...whoooo boy, was this place bad!  Really, really bad.  We planned a family trip to Vegas.  Knowing we'd come into town hungry, we decided to eat a quick meal away from the casinos.  We found a great deal on Restaurants.com and after reading the reviews, we thought this would fit the bill perfectly.  Some of the best places are found in dives or 'hole in the wall' spots, but our first impression was dismal. It was 3pm on a Saturday, there should have been some form of life. Instead, the room was dark and empty with a TV blaring Family Feud. The lone employee stood behind a small counter that didn't even have a hint that food might be found there.  Just a small, empty counter with a loney bathroom-type sink.  Most disconcerting was a total lack of scent!  Even if the kitchen was in back, we should smell that wonderful fragrance of pizza.  Nope. None.  Not even the merest suggestion that anyone had ate in that room that day.  We decided to press on, encouraged by all the signs saying how they had been featured on The Food Network  We ordered the Guinea Pie in the full sheet (knowing the teen boys and leftover pizza go together like teen boys and leftover pizza!)  At nearly $40, it was pricey, but FOOD NETWORK approved.  To take the edge off the long drive, we ordered the poutine fries as well.  Thirst, was another matter. A small retail-type cooler offering a modest selection of small individual sodas and water was the only option.  We ordered and began to wait. And wait....  And wait.  After 25 minutes, we began to realize that we had made a huge mistake.  The lady behind the counter would leave for stretches to get supplies from the bar, but never interacted with us.   After 30 minutes, we wondered why we had not at least received the poutine.  I mean, unless you are growing potatoes, it should not take that long to make fries.  After nearly 40 minutes, a couple of boxes were handing to us, and she again disappeared.  The poutine was cold. Dead cold. No gravy, some sad-looking white clods and limp fries that were as frigid as Melania Trump. We immediately sent them back to the kitchen to be reheated.  The pizza was even more disappointing. The thin, uneven edges looked like a too-small amount of dough had been stretched to make it fit a large pan.  They were over-cooked and saturated in a deep coating of oil.  The toppings were not even remotely to the edges; actually starting at the 2nd piece in.  The sliced meaballs were overcooked to the consistency of dog chew treats.  Then I lifted up the oily mass to expose an actual undercooked crust. Seriously, how much skill is needed to both undercook AND overcook a single pizza? After a single bite, my sons and I threw down the pizza in disgust. My husband, however, doesn't like the make rush judgements and braved a second bite.  The vote was unanimous: this was hands-down the worst pizza we had even eaten.  How bad does things have to be to request a refund from a Restaurants.com coupon?  We hated to do this, but we were about to leave a restaurant after a single bite (or two!)  The lady apologized, refunded our money and then gave us the nearly reheated box of poutine for the road.  In the car, we each braved a bite to see if our decision had been too rash.  Uh...no.  We pulled over and threw it in the nearest trash.  We have found some amazing gems in different cities using Restaurants.com and Yelp.  It's a great set of tools to use when you want to avoid chains and discover something new. In this instance, we took a gamble and lost.  I'd have to advise you to pass this one up.

I was lost, there were 2 different signs on the door. One stating they were closed for a private party another saying visit the Paradise location. So I called the number, the nice man stated go inside the bar next door Moon-doggies to order. Walked in to a total local dive bar full of smoke with my kids, to only discover you order at a little window and eat there. Guess this is the "Dive" part of the feature show Diners, Drive-ins & Dives. Headed over to the Paradise location.

I ordered the naked city pizza and wasn't disappointed. We got the wee size which is the smallest size they have but it is not small at all. The pizza is very flavorful and I loved the crust. Loaded with toppings. Business was kind of hard to find because it's inside a bar. It's dark inside. They didn't have drinks. You have to order from bar. Chicken wings were delicious and have a good spice. Fries had the perfect seasoning. Prices are reasonable for the amount of food you get.

Groupons FTW! I'll make this clear right now. I have not tried their pizza. I was there specifically for the Poutine.  After zip lining down Fremont Street, we decided to hit up Naked City to use up my $20 Groupon. That got us a large Poutine ($5), 20 Hot Chicken Wings ($13), and a slice of cheese pizza ($2). The pizza slice was for my friend. I had no interest in trying it.  So how was the Poutine? I can't compare to the Poutine I've had in Toronto because it's been a couple of years. For sure, it was Freakin' Huge. That's actually the size designation - Freakin' Huge (not "large" as I stated earlier). I'm not really sure if they use cheese curds, but it was yummy and gooey, albeit slightly salty after a while. It's definitely something you could share with a few people.  The Chicken Wings were also good. It's not hard to make good wings, but I suppose it's not hard to mess them up either. My cousin said she really enjoyed them, but she admitted that she's been craving wings recently. I give them the thumbs up. They were pretty large too.  Moon Doggies is not really a place I'm in a hurry to revisit, but if I'm ever craving Poutine again, I know where to go.
I ordered the rebel pie and the guinea pie both were delicious! But the guinea was better than I expected and I wish I had gotten a the full sheet! Definitely worth the price

I have been meaning to check this place out for awhile.  Last night a few of us from work stopped in after a long work week.  The place is in a bar which is pretty cool.  As for the bar I really liked it. Has a kinda divey feeling to it, but probably cuz its an older building.  Not like your run of the mill P.T.s or Timbers, definatley not snooty.  I got the suicide fries and split a pie.  Fries were great and so was the pie.  The prices are also really good, 3 bucks for the fries and 13 for the pie.  Small draft beer selection but I will over look that.  The waitress was cool too she comped both of us a beer and I wasn't even gambling.  I wish this place was closer otherwise I would go more often.  Naked City Pizza.......keep doing what ya doing!

obsessed with the Poutine Fries here! Best ones I've had in Vegas! Their other item that I fully enjoy is the chicken dip you'll definitely feel like going to the gym the next day, but it'll be worth it! Great food despite it being in a small neighborhood bar

We had it delivered via Postmates and it was awesome! We ordered the Back Home pizza and a chicken finger salad.  The only thing I can complain about is how there wasn't hardly enough pepperoni to cover each slice AND the sausage (that we paid an extra $4.00 for) Also; the salad said it was supposed to be buffalo tenders (tenders dipped in buffalo sauce) and that didn't happen, nor was there a side of the sauce. Although, delivery never gives anything justice so we are going back and eat it there on our next visit. It was good enough for another shot

Oh man.  No words.   This place is a complete dive from the outside, but don't pass it by!!!    Have a beer with the friendly locals (who might eyeball you a bit upon arrival, but don't worry and ORDER THE FREAKIN' PIZZA!!!  I'm not a pizza eater, by choice, just not enough nutrition vs calories for my fitness.  But I love food, all food.   This was the greatest pizza I've ever had, hands down (I was a pizza eater for 45years, so it's not like I never...)  super tasty, cheesy, great ingredients, loaded up and awesome crust.  Just do it.

I LOVE the Guinea pizza!! For me pizza is a treat; so I need it to be really good and satisfying and this covers both! This place is definitely not fancy but the food is great so it is worth a try. The stuffed peppers are also very good..

I'd have to say the pizza was average for bar pizza. I did like the homemade dough, but the pizza seemed to be missing something to make it stand out. I'd get it again if I ever end up in the Moon Doggies bar, but I would not make a special trip there for it.

My husband and I were visiting for the weekend and we have a friend who is a local so we decided to give NCP a try. It is hard not to be skeptical when you walk in because it is very much a dive bar. But wait, did I just eat one of the best salads of my life here? A regular side salad? Why yes I did. Shocking? Why yes it was. We also ordered the garlic fries (thick-cut, had good garlic flavor and parm cheese on top), as well as the the Guinea Pie and Naked Pizza.  I shockingly wasn't a big fan of the homemade meatballs on the Guinea Pie, they were a bit greasy and fatty tasting for me. But the Naked pie was incredible. Our server was a riot, too. Overall I was pleasantly surprised.

Love this hidden gem! Every time I order at work...everyone asks where did I order the pizza from...looks and tastes great. Very partial to the guinea!  I don't like the margherita...was horrible.   The Paesa is very good for the vegetarians too!!

Great pizza! Been hearing about this place for a while so happy I finally tried it out. Started off with the pizza egg rolls BOMB! And delicious. We had the rebel pizza and a cheese/pineapple and both were so perfect! The pizza is not as greasy and oily as most places and it's cut in square pieces like I like with that mice oven brick taste and crispy crust I will definitely be back for more! Great service too.

It's really closer to 4 stars  but not quite, the food is great, haven't had anything I didn't like but the service really brings the rating down.  It's not the the staff isn't friendly or helpful it's just that every time I've been here there is only one waitress so you are constantly waiting for service.    Enough about the service, let's talk about the food...the suicide fries are incredible.  I love spicy and consider that I can handle the heat but these are HOT, I think my lips were a bit swollen even. Needless to say though these are pretty much the sole reason I come to Naked City Pizza.  The pies are great too, I've tried about 5 different ones, the chicken finger and fatboy are my faves. The portions are huge, the wee is 6 huge slices.    All in all a great place to try.  Just don't forget it's in a bar so no kids.
Very friendly both at the window and the bar. Best pizza in Vegas, best white pizza I've ever had. One slice will fill you up, and it is just as good warmed up the next day. :)

I saw this place on The Food Networks Diners Drive Ins & Dives. So I said I have to try it. The suicide fries are awesome. Hot & flavorful.Just right. The pizza was some of the best I ever had. I had the Guinea Pie. Our waitress was Teresa. She was very friendly & helpful. We enjoyed this place so much we even bought their T-shirts. I will definitely return for a great meal at good price & friendly service.

Best slice of pie I've had in vegas, wife had the meatball sub ,homemade meatballs, we had the suicide & loaded baked potato fries everything was very good including service portions are big, prices are fair - it is a definite must do again for us
One of the Las Vegas treasures. Best Pizza in town. Great and helpful staff. I try to order different pizza on every trip, and now I have 9 favorites !!!

06/12/11 DINNER.  Having never been here before, last night I attended their PIG OUT, a 5-course presentation of food, buffet-style, created by the owner/chef and 3 fellow chefs from the LV area. The food was FANTASTIC, not even factoring in the VALUE the event turned out to be. I must come back just to try more pizza, but they should put that pappardelle and porchetta on the menu!

I used to love this place, I would frequently order from here weekly!!!!! On Friday evening I ordered a sheet pizza and sub which was delivered and not right.  I called to complain and they said there was nothing they could do since bitesquad delivered it. My mom then called again complaining they said they would remake. So we went to pick up pizza and an employee of naked city pizza gave us an attitude and then gave us the finger!!!! This attitude and behavior is completely unacceptable for the customer service industry! I don't think I could ever return even tho I was born and raised in buffalo and this is my only little piece of home I have out here. Completely unacceptable.
Typical bar location. Pizza was awesome. Crust was just the way I like.  Choose the naked city 1/4 sheet good for two. Beer from the bar and you are set.

If you're looking for giant, greasy pizzas, Naked City Pizza Shop is the place for you.   Located inside a run down bar, this place looks a little sketchy. The parking lot is not very well maintained, and the bar itself is dimly-lit and old. But don't let that deter you from the fact that the pizzas here are amazing.   Our table got the Frickin' Huge Naked City Pizza, and the pizza definitely lives up to the name. The pizza came in a 13" x 9" sheet pan. This pizza definitely feeds about 7-8 people and costs only $30, so that's a deal right there! The toppings on this pizza are pretty standard: pepperoni, sausage, sweet peppers, onions, olives, mozzarella cheese, and red sauce. Both the pepperoni and sausage add a spiciness and saltiness to the pie. The olives and cheese also added to the saltiness and greasiness, while both the sweet peppers and onions were overshadowed by the other ingredients. I think the best part of the pie was the crust. The crust was thin, crispy, and flaky. It balanced out the fat from the toppings.   The service was definitely way below average. Since it's a bar, you have to order the pizza from the back / from the bartender. There is no table service at this place. After you order, you're pretty much left on your own. Wait time for the pizza was actually pretty reasonable for the size of the pie. But other than that, you'd have to get our own water, plates, utensils, and napkins. All are located in one area, so that's convenient. But the tap water tasted a little weird, so I'd steer away from that and just bring your own.   Overall, the pizzas here are really good. When it comes to craving super greasy foods, this is the place you should go. Even though the location is a little sketchy and the service is below par, I would still recommend this place.
AMAZING!!!! Nothing but good things to say. Only complaint is that it isn't closer to my house.

After trying the pizza wings and Cesar salad 3 stars is all we can do..... The salad was basic nothing special about it,the the dressing tasted weird....
