The wings were good but nothing to brag about.... The pizza lacked flavor the crust was tasteless and soggy. I've had better pizza! Besides the food the customer service was poor. No interaction with cashier didn't even get a hello on the way in she sat behind her register we had to get our own utensils plates and drinks. The restaurant needs major unleashes or at least some cleaning the floors were very dirty. At the end the food was ok nothing special could have had better pizza somewhere else.

Been here a few times and it's the perfect place if you like dive bars! Great food and great atmosphere. Definitely order the suicide fries if you're a fan of lip burning, panting for air spicy food. There are loaded fries with minimum spice and big flavor, if preferred. Football season specials available as well. Possibly for other sports.   BUT did wait 45 mins for my order the last time I was there and when I asked about it turned out our ticket was lost. It's such a busy place so grab one of the staff if you need to, after all it is a NY spot. Great pies though!

Talk about great food!!!! I moved to Vegas about a month ago and this place is still my favorite eatery thus far! The pizza was phenomenal! We got the fat boy and the guinea pie, both of which were stellar! Also, tasty sandwiches!!! I'm so glad this place is walking distance of my house! Definitely my top pick!!!!! Get naked city pizza!!!!!!!!

Came here on a Friday afternoon. Business was fairly light.  Like most people that travel to Vegas, I heard about NCPS via DDD on the Food Network. This might be silly to say, but the thing that drew me in was the sound of a pizza cutter slicing through the sound enhanced crispy crust of one of their pies on TV.  The atmosphere is obviously a dive bar. Since we came while the sun was up, it wasn't noisy and not crowded in any respect. I'm sure if we came a little later in the day, it would have been standing room only, as there really isn't a LOT of room to sit.  We ordered a wee guinea pie and a wee loaded fries. The fries were a bit on the salty/over-seasoned side, but the sour cream, bacon and cheese helped cut through the saltiness. The pizza... oh the pizza...  The pizza was FANTASTIC. I'm usually not one for "white" pizzas, but this was really well done. The sauce wasn't overpowering but still had a great flavor that complimented the meatballs and spinach. The crust tasted just as good as it looked, it was thick without being too heavy or greasy. Overall, it was a very well made pie.  In a nutshell: The atmosphere isn't for everyone, but the food and service were top notch, enough for me to make another trip here next time I'm in Vegas.

Definitely my favorite pizza in Las Vegas. Located inside Moon Doggies, which has Labatt Blue on tap. If you are from Buffalo, NY, this is a great taste of home. They sell full rectangular sheet pizzas with square slices like back home. The wings are pretty good too. Saw a sign last time I was there for wings with Chiavetta's sauce. Can't wait to try them next time.

I'm from Buffalo so I was soooo excited to see this pizza establishment! Whenever I am homesick for Buffalo I come here to dine and feel at home. I love it because they have loganberry which is a drink you can usually only find in Buffalo. Even if you're not from Buffalo you have to try it! I have yet to come here for a sports game but I really want to go soon to watch a Sabres game and again in the fall to watch a Buffalo Bills game. My uncle and I ordered out from their last night and got Guniea's Pie. This pie was featured on diners, drive in and dives so I really wanted to try it. I'm not usually a huge fan of white sauce but this pizza was AWESOME. This pie has meatballs, spinach, ricotta, sausage and white garlic sauce. The flavor was incredible. Another good pie is Back-Home pie which features thick tomato sauce, mixed with mozzarella, oregano and Parmesan, pepperoni, sausage with a garlic crust. If you are more a red sauce fan this pie is for you! This place is very casual and a great place to go if you are looking for something low key. The only downside is that it is in a bar so if you have a family you will have to order this pizza to go because you must be 21 or older to eat here.

I saw this on TV and went to visit my boyfriend inn Vegas. Hands down by far the best pizza I have ever had...and I've had a LOT of pizza. He moved home to Cleveland shortly after I went to visit and we have been taking about seeing if they will overnight us a pie...addiction!   The crust is perfect and the toppings are amazing.very food combos and creativity. I hasn't been back to Vegas twice since then and cannot miss this gem!   You guys are doing amazing! Keep up the good work!!

Seen this place on the food network, so we were finally excited to go try it! We ordered the Naked City pizza, Suicide Fries, and A Bag of Zeppolis. We waited about 30 mins and they brought out the dessert first? Which we thought was odd.. then about 5 mins later the fries.. waited about 25 minutes longer and went up to the window to ask for the pizza to go cause it was taking to long.. another 5 mins goes by I ask for a box for the fries and she FINALLY hands me the pizza. It was not cooked and super doughy.. my husband went to speak to them and the guy asks so you want another pizza?? Umm no we waited an hour for this one and was uncooked?!?! They gave us the money back for the pizza after another 5 mins. We are super disappointed  and won't be returning! Maybe we will try the other location.

Man...   Love my dive bars. Always my go-to hang out spots. So for a late night beer and carby greasy food, come here!  Here, you go to the bar grab your drinks, and at the opposite of the end of the bar is a small window where you order your "I will regret this later" food.   I went with a friend here since I hear a lot of rave about the place. I noticed by the entrance door they have plates, napkins, and utensils. You sit yourself, you grab whatever you need and enjoy. They do bring out your food to your table though.   I tried the poutine. Not too bad. Not sure if Canadians will like it, but yanno. Might have to come back and try other special fries they had in the menu.   Zeppoles in a greasy brown paper bag. Eat them fresh! These sugary, thick bread dumped in chocolate is really tasty! Generous amount in the bag!   The pizza, I wasn't a fan of. I had to rip it up to eat it. It was way hard and I couldn't finish it. Noticed the roof of my mouth torn and cut up too after eating the pizza. Cut to where I tasted my own blood....and the pizza was the last thing I ate.    Anyway, this is a divey bar. Don't expect clean elegance. Expect a rough looking bar with fattening huge portioned (sharing is optional) bar food and good beer. Give it a shot.

After a couple nights of eating on the strip... and being overcharged and disappointed (staying at the Aria) I wanted some plain good ole fashioned pizza. I recalled an episode of Triple D mentioning Naked City Pizza. So I googled the Arville location.  Drove from the hotel to the place. I saw the sign which said Moondoogies bar with Naked City Pizza underneath, a lil confusing because the entrance is just a divey bar, luckily I got a whiff of some nice pizza pie.   The place itself had a dark ambiance of a real dive bar, I did feel like I was an intruder from the looks I got from the indigenous bar flies. I made beeline past the bar towards one of the waitresses who quickly glanced me up and down, to size me up "Tourist".  She had a nice ink sleeve going on but had a rather nice sunny disposition.   So I ordered a couple of pies. A wee plain cheese for the kids and a not so wee Naked City Pizza Pie for us. It took awhile like almost a half hour, so it would be helpful to order ahead of time, which I did not do.  The pizzas were spot on. Glad I braved the iffy location, Better then the crap from CPK (which I know isn't saying much)  I'll try the new location closer to the strip, they opened a location near the Hard Rock. Definitely making it a point to get one of their pies next time down!

People seem to love dive bars and I'm not really a big fan.  Maybe it's because I'm getting old and crotchety.  I did like this place though and not everyone in the bar seemed like they wanted to punch me in the face when I walked in, so that was nice.  I knew what to expect before walking into Moon Doggies and had been looking forward to trying this pizza for a long time.  It was my heavyset brothers that finally got me to go and I'm very glad I did.  I expected the service to be downright garbage and was very suprised to have an attentive and polite waiter.  We order two Not So Wee pizzas along with some Pizza Logs and Poutine.  The pizza logs were incredible but the poutine was a little cold in the middle.  It still tasted good but cold cheese is not something on my 'favorites' list.  The pizza were great as well and this has to be one of my favorite types of crust ever.  Fairly thick but also pretty light tasting.  We were all big fans of this place and were very glad we came.  I think Naked City Pizza has a good thing going but it would be nice if they could get their own stand-alone place.  That's just me.  I would love to stop in here for a pizza again in the near future.  We brought a pieces home to my wife and she loved it as well.  Very good stuff!

finally made it here.......... DDD watcher. Beer on tap was good, Chicken wings "hot" were really good. just about perfect! Great taste, good heat and 10 of them to a small order. I'm kinda a " NY THIN CRUST" guy but I tried their kinda deep dish square-cut pepperoni pizza and after it cooled down a little, I found it to be VERY TASTY, nice burnt edges on pepperoni, nice cheese, nice crust. I will be back when I'm around there. Loud music dive bar but food is good and prices are fair......... I'm Jonesing for their pizza and wings now!!!!

"It hurts so good!" I cry to myself as I take another bite of the suicide fries!  Wow, what a roller coaster ride that was!  The hot sauce was just a teaser of what was to come.  Then came the habanero peppers... And then the tears.  Before I knew it , I had run out of water and had to get more from the self serve water jug by the entrance.  Thank goodness it was self serve because I don't think I would have made it if I had to wait for a waiter to grab me more!  Protip: There is no waiter!    Yes, this restaurant is located in a dive bar.  Yes, you have to be 21 to eat here. YES, you have to drag your ass to the window to order or else you will wait for service only to have the bartender ask what the hell you're doing.  And yes, you will have to grab your plates, silverware, and waters right by the entrance.  Don't let these things deter you from trying some of the best pizza you will ever have in Las Vegas.  Although, of course the pizza is famous, you have to get some fries or wings to start!  Did I mention how great the fries were???

Me and my husband tried the pizza here last Saturday and it's the bomb!! This place is inside Moondoggies Bar which were at to watch a football game. They not only have pizza but also salads, sandwiches, appetizers and so on.. Enjoy!!!
Brought my grandma to Vegas and swung by here to have her try the pie and fries. She not a fan of pizza at all bit had 4 slices of the guineas pies and loved it. She also enjoyed the suicide fries!

Ha!  We almost missed this place because it's literally a  dive bar where no one under 21 is allowed inside, no windows, etc.  We ordered inside at a little window, then went over to the bar and had a Tenaya Creek Las Vegas beer on tap and a Tokyo Tea.  The bartender Jennifer was a hoot!  The Cesar salad was my favorite dish.  We had a small order of the suicide fries (thank gawd we got the small size, because it burned my mouth and we were all crying, so a small dose is much better)......we all liked them.  Then we had the chicken wings, hot, and they were great.  We got a slice of pizza, which had mushrooms and steak on top, but the crust is like bread, thick dough.   We came for the pizza and liked that least of all.  We are glad we came, it's a fun bar, super friendly, but I wouldn't go back, once was enough.  Everyone should try the suicide fries once in their life!

This might be my new little lunch spot. It's right around he corner from work and it has more options than just pizza . My naked salad was so good , roasted peppers and marinated tomatoes not your average boring salad , have to come back and try the fries and the pizza ! I love all the cool artwork , it's a casual little chill spot.
Horrible horrible service where's the old school workers at ....This girl with colored hair dye was just rude ridiculous and zero patriot customers I miss the old workers

Struggle is real. I ordered the smallest pizza they had -- the 1/4 sheet. It's really just for me and LOOK HOW MUCH THERE IS.  I went ahead and ordered the Guinea Pie; they are famous for it so you kind of have to pull that trigger. This place is awesome. You kind of don't see it at first because it is inside this dive bar. You gotta be 21+ to walk in but just go for it and order at the small window on the left as you walk along the bar. I ordered an IPA during the wait and the pizza came sooner than I expected. I meant to take it to-go but I'm finishing this beer, eating a couple squares and finishing this review. It's a perfect solo spot or low key place to hang out.

One of my favorite pizza spots in town.  I normally sit in Moondoggies for the beer and atmosphere.  You do have to go to the small window to order your food and they will bring it out to you.     I'm a big fan of the traditional pizzas with red sauce and my favorite here is the Back Home Pizza which has crisp cup pepperoni, Italian sausage, a garlic crust, parmesan and mozzerella mixed with red sauce.  It is very flavorful and the wee size is more than enough for 2 people.    One evening I was feeling very confident and attempted the suicide wings.  They were super hot I felt like Ben Stiller in Along Came Polly I just wanted to power thru the heat and couldn't believe they felt hotter and hotter as I went on and on and on to the next one.  So if you ever want to go out like a blister in the sun give them a try your tongue and lips may never forgive you thou... hahaha   Enjoy!!

Came back today and I love this place again. Found out the reason we never had a waitress last time is because they don't have them anymore. You order at the window  towards the back of the bar. The friendly bartender explained it to us.

I can't express the joy by taste buds feel when I come to Naked city pizza. I've been coming here for YEARS and I've never found any other pizza as good as Naked city. The Poutine Fries are to Die for (my mouth is watering) the gravy it come in is made there, they add chunks of Mozzarella and they season the fries to perfection. I'm old school when it comes to pizza so I typically have Pepperoni and cheese but I have also had a few others. One of my favorite is the Back Home Pizza it has Mozzarella, Pepperoni and Italian Sausage, the pepperoni has a perfect crunch around the edges, the Italian sausage is has the perfect amount of seasoning and the Mozzarella is stringy how a cheese should be. I don't know how they do it but the food in all the years I've been here is consistent and never disappoints. P.S. they have cheap drinks and who doesn't love cheap drinks??? If you haven't given this place a shot you are missing out on some great pizza.

"I didn't know it was a take and bake pizza."   I took a bite of the crust as I love a good crust and that bite was really yeasty/doughy. I looked at the dough where I bit and was still translucent so therefore still raw. I grabbed from the other side of the pizza my 2nd slice, without crust. That was cooked, but still needed to be baked for a better consistency. I looked carefully at the pizza and the dough was rolled unevenly so the sloppy base made for the uneven cook. Like Angela stated about the sauce- she had a slice with no sauce and I had a slice that I could see the sauce present without digging for it.   Shouldn't have to re-bake or watch each bite for raw spots when Angela H and I were plenty happy to wait 20 minutes to get a 'za but could wait longer if it meant not rushing to get it done. I looked at the crust on peoples pictures and can see those are brown and toppings like pepperoni are crisping at the edges. Just so people don't think I'm just looking for something to hate (though my review pattern is rarely negative) please look at the pictures. I posted a piece of pizza with all the toppings off so you can see the crust thickness change and the pale pizza crust and bottom. I'm sure some people will say "it's just a bad day" but uneven pizza dough and sauce is careless and seeing the crust isn't even brown but choosing to box it up anyways isn't the pride and quality control I'd expect from a raved about place. Yes, I cook some shit wrong, made a new recipe and it sucked- not for lack of care but inexperience. I've cooked certain things over and over (like you do at a restaurant) and can keep a decent standard on such items because I baby it and won't serve what isn't at least cooked well.    It LOOKED good, SMELLED good on the drive back home, the toppings were quality, but if you don't have the dough down right, cooked right then it isn't a fucking pizza. Might as well put those toppings on some sandwich rolls so I can enjoy the nicely spice-y sausage bits, red pepper, olives and pepperoni. Grease doesn't bother me too much, but just a note there was a good amount of it to dab off. $17 for a large and the only consolation I suppose is the groupon. Also we got cheese bread which gives me visions of dough bits with cheese. We got a sandwich roll stuffed with some cheese, mostly spinach and chopped garlic. I'd be cool with a spinach sandwich but it needed more seasonings other than the garlic so it was just A-OK.   The settings really don't help. Neither of us was aware of what Moondoggies was about and partly wasn't sure if we have the right place without any pizza indicators on the outside. Odd that there isn't even a little sign... Alright, odd that it's in a bar, but I can dig it like how some  PTs have Robertos tacos attached. It's not quite separate but connected to the bar situation, but just a window on the wall of the bar where you can order.  It was just an odd vibe for two ladies to walk into a bar full of men with a few stopping to look at what we were doing. Odd vibes and no real seating aside from the bar or pool table, we hightailed our plans of staying in and took it to-go. Takes a lot to make two loud, social with all kinds of people kind of bitches want to just go home instead of stay in a environment. It wouldn't have been a place we could have comfortable conversation.   I don't get the hype. I don't know about second chances with this one.
Bomb wings and pizza so delicious best of all great customer service seats were very confortable great place for the family or for hangout .

I ordered as a first timer here thinking it was gonna be mind-blowing!!! I mean, chicken fingers on pizza?! You can't mess that up! Welllllllll I guess you can. The pizza was bland, not enough marinara. The dough was undercooked (even though it took 50 minutes to prepare) and the chicken fingers...they were more like chicken pieces half cooked on the pizza. It was just missing something! I also ordered suicide fries! I love spicy food. I order a 10 in Indian and Thai food and eat grilled peppers as a snack. But these fries were tasteless. They were JUST spicy. They taste as if someone just poured hot sauce and threw on some jalapeños. Nothing special. Overall I gave them two stars because they are creative with their menu and all these things can definitely be improved. One day I will try this place out again, but not anytime soon if they continue like this!

Dark, loud and smoky, but that didn't bother me, so much as the fact that our server (who was very sweet) put in our drink order and it took upwards of 30 minutes to get 3 diet cokes, a sprite, 3 waters and 2 beers. That was the first sign that we were in trouble. We ordered 2 wee pizzas and then one of the really big ones split between two flavors (the Naked City and the Guinea). The kitchen reportedly messed up and made those as two separate medium sized pizzas (not a big deal at all) except that they forgot about the Guinea all together, so they made one for us about an hour and a half into the experience. Then another server took our fresh pizza and took it to another table, so then that had to make another. We actually never got the original order until after we had paid and were walking out the door three hours into the journey. We brought home the Guinea and reheated it for dinner and it was awesome. Fries are solid and would definitely recommend the Guinea pizza. Not so much for the overall experience.

My son recommended this place.  I think I had it bookmarked though.  So as I was getting my hustle on, I was in the area, and I had time to swing by and get a slice of pizza.  So I got there right on time, there pizza for single serve just came out.  So I paid for my slice of pizza, and told the girl, I was going to wash my hands.  So they have this little bitty window inside the bar for the food.  When I came back someone was at the window ordering there complicated pizza.  I'm waiting, and waiting.  I think she could have just told them, hey, let me hand her, her pizza.   Buttttt Nooooooo, I had to wait for this complicated order to be completed before I got my 1 slice of pizza that I already paid for.   Then she didn't hand me any napkins!  I was already pressed for time, and I told her that when I saw that the pizza came out.   Thank goodness it was still hot!  The cheese was cheesy, and the pizza was really good.  This place is quite far from my home, so I don't see me ordering a large.  I will just pop in when I'm in the area, and get a slice.

I guess if I was drinking... scratch that... if I was drunk the pizza would be AMAZING! But so would del taco. I had been to Moon Doggies years ago and thought it was a cool little dive bar and the food at Naked City Pizza fits right into that category. Dive bar food. Ordered the "Back Home Pizza" online (bonus points for easy online ordering!) and got the half sheet for $18. Pictures online and on Yelp looked pretty good. Was ready when I arrived (on time) and my small interaction with the person at the window was not enough to judge service. Soon as we walked out I opened box and knew I had probably made a mistake. This did not look as good as it did in the pics and it looked like cheap ingredients. I was right. I regretfully devoured 4 slices as I was pretty hungry. But that doesn't change the fact that I was wishing I had a better pizza to eat. I can't speak for the rest of the food there as this was all I got. They get 3 stars only because its fair (I guess) for the price and its in a dive bar so I shouldn't have expected as much as I did. Drunk food is all I can say it is at this point.

Home of the guinea pie, which was featured on triple D!  So this place is kind of uninviting. It is inside Moondoggies bar, which is dark and musty. Adults only kind of place, so leave the kids at home (or go to the other location...).  For drinks, I ordered the loganberry because I have never had anyting loganberry. Server said it was pretty popular in New York.  It was hard to describe the taste, but most like a watered down berry juice. Next time I'll just have some "pop."  I shared the small size Guinea pie with Ramil B. and it was the perfect size for us.  It was cut in 6 pretty good size pieces and I was still able to take 2 pieces home to the husband who loved it.  The pizza here is definitely a winner and I would come back to order it again!  Some great things about it are the homemade meatballs and the ricotta cheese!  Kind of on the greasy side, but crust was on point.   We were curious about dessert and ordered the fried dough, which was a humongous portion that I just took it home.  This was OK, not worth ordering. It simply was fried, drizzled with chocolate syrup and sprinkled with powdered sugar. Nothing exciting here.  Pizza deserves 4 stars, but everything else was just OK.
AMAZING! This place is a hidden secret in Las Vegas. Amazing pizza and drinks! One of the top pizza spots, highly recommended!

I've never been to Buffalo, never ridden a buffalo, never had a Buffalo style pizza, but I can sure say I can make this place my home on the range. Located inside the dive bar that is Moon Doggies. So, right off the bat, if you are looking for a cute frou frou type place, it ain't happening here. This is about the pizza. So, "The Fatboy" was ordered--half sheet. Thanks to Pete's speedy review and pics, I was able to call in the order, giddy up. As is the protocol, if you want to eat inside Moon Doggies, you pick up your "to go" order, and pull up a table to enjoy your pie, that skirts the smoking law, yes smoking takes place here. You have 2 options, deal with it, or really take it to go. As soon as we cracked open the square box, the aroma of tomatoes and fresh basil completely infiltrated our mind, body and soul. OMFG, the pizza was astonishing. It seems to me NY pizza is kind of favored here in Vegas. This is not the same thing at all. The crust is thicker, a little soft with slightly crispy edges. It is all loaded with plenty of groceries, and I mean quality items too. WOW! Perfect ratio of crust, to sauce, to toppings. Check this out, we did not ask for, nor did we need any extra parmesan or red pepper flakes. The sauce is zesty, with a welcome kick. Daily doses of "The Fatboy" could keep me from being slim. The pizza itself is 5 star!

I don't usually hang with squares, but when I do they come from this place...  A full sheet is 24 slices and the generous amount of toppings on a pie of that size easily wiped out a garden and slaughtered a couple hogs. Unless I'm up against a bet you can take my yelp tagline and toss it. The in-house meatballs and pepperoni they use are top notch, the dough is a perfect texture and taste, the quality cheese is plentiful (see pics of my guinea pie) and it eats well the next day...(5 minutes at 350 followed by 2 minutes at 400 to get it nice and crispy with a perfect melt). If you want a tasty pie, you can't go wrong with the Rebel (used to be called the Fat Boy) or the Guinea pie which was featured on Diners, Drive ins and Dives.  Other unique items I've tried were the poutine fries, which were excellent, as were the pizza logs. Got to love the creative menu of delicious bar food made using quality ingredients.  They also stay open til 3am which is conveniently dangerous for the waistline.   A strong four stars...be sure to check them out.
Pizza is delicious and their chicken fingers are more chicken than bread; that's always a huge plus. Good prices and huge portions

Pie is pretty good. Nothing much to say about the place, it's a dive bar, and a dive restaurant. If you're into that, you'll love it here. But this review is for the food! So far I've only had the chicken finger pie, the Back Home(get this one!), and the guinea pie. Definitely get the back home pie, you won't be disappointed

Omg this has to be the best pizza ever!!! You have to get the Guinea pizza and for sure the wings. I have traveled all over the U.S. and I continue to do so. But my husband and I agree that this is seriously the best pizza we have ever had. The wings are a must and you have to get them HOT flavored. So good and so yumny. Also, their beer is on tap freezing ice cold. It will be the best beer you had because of how cold they keep their

amazing, amazing, amazing!  The food here is sooooo good.  If you like wings, pizza and garlic knots then this is your spot.   I like spicy so I came to get everything with suicide.  The wings, fries and pizza were amazing.
I saw this place on triple D, and it lived up to the hype! We had the "Back Home Pie" in the "Frickin' Huge size, it fed 8 hungry guys.

It is easy to drive by this place,as the main sign is for the bar,as the pizza joint is inside the bar.. Which was very smoky,dark and a few locals hanging out. The cook was actually doing his paperwork at the bar,so he looked like one of the patrons? Anyway the food is ok, just too smoky to wit for your pizza and wings to go,as I would not sit and eat there,unless you like hanging out in a smoky,smoky,stinky bar,it just doesn't make the food taste good.. Staff was friendly, but I don't think I will go bk.. More on their food- i did not get a pizza,but opt for wings, it was ok,nothing to write home about it. The portion are average, about the same for all places that serve wings and pizza.. It was hard to find the place because the sign for naked city pizza was very small and un -noticeable.As you see the reviews they are mixed and I cannot say it would be 4 or 5 stars either.. I got wings,because I was in a hurry to get in and out of there,,maybe if I ever go back I would try the pizza?

Not good..first time and I got almost burnt fries with my over toasted Italian 3 meat sub, cause I requested it be toasted? Hope their Pizzas are better? Sorry guys..get it together! I really couldn't eat the fries. If they weren't so burnt to a crisp, the seasoning I could tell was good tho..

I ordered The Rachael. A few highlights: spicy pickle, giardiniera, big roll, tasty turkey, nice name. The shop is teeny with a bit of outdoor seating. In fact, the pinnacle of Las Vegas-style patio dining just might be at Naked City. If you know Las Vegas patio dining, you know it means overlooking a parking lot. Well, here you not only overlook the parking lot, you pretty much sit in it and also overlook OG. Sandwich, Strippers, Custard (at Luv- It's)--I have a feeling that is a common Friday trio, but not for Gabi and me. We stuck to the Naked City that was serving lunch.  I was a bit sad that the Naked Greens weren't baby greens and sadder that it took what I consider a long time to get our order. The turkey was definitely good and real. Overall, a solid sandwich, but I don't know if the thought of it lingers with me. I think that is the mark of an outta this world sandwich--a lingering thought. I find myself thinking mostly about the giardiniera. I love that stuff.   A solid three with promise of a return to try another sandwich.
Good size pizza for the price...dough is made in house, the sauce needed something. Overall good pizza watering hole!!

This place is tough to find!  It's inside another bar.  When we finally got the nerve to go inside, we knew we were in the right spot.  No windows, just some funky mix and match tables and chairs.  The place was pretty crowded since apparently DDD was just on the night before.   The poor waitress was SWAMPED!  She was super nice but could have used some serious help.  We ordered the suicide fries.  It was a pretty large order.  There were just two of us and we struggled to finish them, mainly because of the heat.  We needed more ranch and water, but the poor waitress never came by.  We didn't even eat the peppers on top!  The sauce was spicy enough.  Don't get me wrong, they were really tasty.  We each got a slice of pizza.  I got the Specialty of the day, chicken parm and my friend got cheese.  Love the crust.  My one complaint would be that it is too much cheese.  I just pulled a little bit off.  I couldn't finish my one slice, it was plenty.  My friend raved that this was some of the best pizza she has had, and that's saying a lot coming from her.  We were glad we went!  Oh, and FYI, No kids allowed here.

We had seen this place on the food network and wanted to try it. Found the one closest to where we were staying, the Arville Rd location. It took us a while to figure out that it was inside of this bar, very hard to find. The bar was dark, dingy and smoky. We went in and left in a hurry. Bad location, would never go back.

Highly recommended by a friend who has  never been to Buffalo. Think Hertel Ave.   Waited forty minutes for our order which came on two trips 15 minutes  apart. Our order was wrong, the service was frustrating.  The pizza is tough and dry on the edges, kind of greasy in the middle and the dough is just ok. The toppings seem to be mediocre quality.   Ordered wings with medium sauce, received them drenched. Although I must say,  the wing sauce was authentic.  For $40.00 plus tip, I don't think NCP rates the attention it's receiving. It is a bar after all. For the money you spend here you will get a better quality meal and a more satisfying experience at the many high end pizzerias in the Vegas valley.  I would rather have a little "Vanilla Thrilla" ;)

All I have to say is that this place is friggin awesome!  This place was on Diners, drive-ins, and dives.  So, I had to check it out!  Good service,  I got full AND took food home.  Nice portion sizes,  that's hard to find in Vegas.  Love it and coming back for more!!!!!! The wings were greattttt!!!

More a rant than a review, the outlandish amounts of cash that Pharmaceutical Companies spend to bend Physicians' ears a sore subject for someone who has intentionally lived above the influence for nearly fifteen years, it was after implementing a whole new set of rules to restrict access that lunch was delivered by Christopher Palmeri on Friday, this one hour per week begrudgingly given at least filled with good Food.  Open since 1999 and the focus of over a dozen visits, everything from the original on Arville to Naked City Tavern and even Chef Palmeri's menu for Bacon Bar the subject of discussion at some point in the last four years, it was finally in late April that Naked City Pizza Delivery was experienced in the form of catering for twenty, the results expectedly not *quite* as good as fresh from the oven, though not far off either.   No doubt a fan of the Restaurant with four current locations, Michael and Chris' newest spot inside The El Cortez recently visited and soon to be enjoyed again for "Paula's Supper Club" on May 1st, it was to a smorgasbord of favorites that staff was treated, Caesar Salad with Housemade Dressing proving a popular choice for those looking for something light while Wings tossed to Medium spiciness were called "the best I've ever tasted by one" and "not spicy enough" by others.  Wowing skeptics next with Pizza Logs, the listed Pepperoni replaced with housemade Fennel Sausage to great effect  beneath  a crisp and golden Shell, it was from four 'half-sheets' of Pizza that attendees were allowed to pick, the two orders of Cheese selected by the Rep to 'be safe' largely leftover as staff found Naked City's DDD-famous Guinea Pie and Chicken Finger slices most enjoyable though the eponymous Pie with Onions and Roasted Peppers also proved popular for those who didn't worry about their breath for the second half of the day.  Rounding out the afternoon with Palmeri's best-in-Sin-City Cannolis, the normally filled-to-order shells holding up even better than Pizza Crust which has suffered just a touch of sog in transit, suffice it to say that all were more than satisfied by a lunch of good ingredients cooked by people who are putting their time, money and hard work on the line to do something they love...and if you happen to see a Social Media post suggesting Monkey Logs are available do not hesitate to place an order for them.  N/A:  In a city of two million with over forty million visitors annually it is probably no surprise that independently owned businesses often take a backseat in terms of advertising, but when considering options for catering nothing is more disappointing than the number of dollars being funneled into spots like BJ's, PF Chang's or Café Rio - money that would much better support Las Vegas' small businesses if people would just wake up and stop being so lazy.

My friend and I had to build up the courage to enter this seedy looking bar, and it was still daylight. This dive has some of the most innovative pizzas in Las Vegas. I love the Snake in the Grass Pizza and the loaded baked potato fries. It's no wonder Triple D did an episode at Naked City Pizza. My suggestion is place a to go order if you're not into the smokey bar scene.

Hmm suicide fries!! everyone around me knows am in for anything that is super spicy and hot! So when i seen suicide fries on DDD i said  "that's the place i am gonna try" believe me its all that and a bag of suicide  fries!!!!!!! So let me stop talking about the best spicy fries i have ever had and talk about the rest of  my visit!   My hunny and i were excited to visit this place so we did not let the negative yelps stop us from doing so, and boy were we happy!! The service was great the waitress gal who helped us was a pleasure and very informative, the beer was cheap and cold and my salad was super yummy with ingredients you don't find at your nearest dennys!  Now lets talk pizza when i heard ny buffalo u imagined ny pie, but nope the pizza is a thick crust with fresh ingredient and probably super yummy for the thick crust lovers, i don't care for thick crust so i don't want to judge the pizza based  upon my bias!  all together we loved this place and will be returning during our next  Vegas stop!!   wait i forgot to mention all ingredients are super fresh and your dish made to order!! and wait i forgot one more thing SUICIDE FRIES ROCK!!! hehe

Bianco Pizza- mozzarella, fontina, and parmesan cheese due business with some rich and creamy ricotta cheese and a housemade garlic sauce that will blow you away.  Better yet, its a classic brick oven style rectangular pie.  Pizza is a must here.  If you are really up to the challenge, bring along a few buddies that don't mind a little spice in their life, take down an order of fries or Buffalo wings made by a chef from Buffalo, New York covered in their super spicy 'SUICIDE' sauce.  This stuff is addictive, you will not want to stop eating them but once you do, the after burn is worse than the initial heat.  May need a beer or two to cool this inferno inside your body.    Great place to stop in if in the area or if you would just like to step away from the craziness of the Vegas strip.

Place is a true dive. Dark and a little dingy and had the feel of a place that attracts locals and regulars. The bartender was very friendly and overall I felt comfortable,  I had 2 pieces of pizza by the slice:  Pepperoni slice: Wasn't very good at all. You don't expect pizza by the slice to be fresh so I was willing to overlook the fact that it tasted old, but I don't think that it was originally a pepperoni pizza. It looked and tasted like it was a slice of cheese pizza that they just threw some pepperoni on top of and heated up because the pepperoni wasn't heated through like it should've been had it spent as much time in the oven as the rest of the pizza.  Chicken Parm (slice of the day): This was actually pretty good besides the fact that it too, tasted like it had been out a long time. The crust that they use is a little thicker than I prefer but the breaded chicken on it was tasty.   Philly cheesesteak rolls: First off they give you 4 big rolls for 7 bucks which is an awesome value. The first bite wasn't overly impressive but these things are addicting and get better with every bite. Crispy egg roll shell, steak, onions and peppers, and cheddar some how come together into this crunchy, savory, and cheesy bite of goodness.  Chicken Fingers: Looking at them I thought they may be frozen but they tasted fresh and very good. Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside covered in a tasty buffalo sauce.  Overall, I liked my meal. I'm not going to be extra critical on the pizza that I knew wouldn't be fresh. The prices are very reasonable, food was tasty, people were friendly. I'd go back but would try fresh pizza ;).

Food still solid after all these years. Gunea Pie is excellent! Beef on Weck is an excellent sandwich as long as they are not skimpy with the juice (buy some bigger to go containers).... which is my only complaint.  Bit pricey but excellent.

Naked City Pizza serves up tasty pies, fries, wings, and specialities.  NPC is located inside Moondoggies, a smoke-filled dive bar. you order at the little window, which you can't miss since it's lined with all their prestigious awards.  That's just it, this place is all about the hype. Yes, it's a decent pie, but the toppings were sparse. The pizza also isn't anything that you can't find elsewhere and it just doesn't stand out. It's good, but not great and definitely not remember-able.   Where NCP excels is in the sammie & fry departments. There are unique offerings and tasty combos. Suicide fries offer a mighty kick and are best served with milk to kill the fire. Not for the faint of heart. My go to sub is The Guinea which as a pizza is meh; when translated to sandwich is crave-able. (I'm salivating as I write this!) With it's combination of house-made Italian sausage, sweet and hot peppers, onion and ooey-gooey mozzarella cheese! This is a sandwich worth driving across town for.   I also had one of the best Osso Buco of my life here. It was a weekly special and it was tender and juicy.   Although they claim pizza in their title, their best items can be found elsewhere on the menu.

So far I've turned my son, my mother, and other close friends and family onto Naked City Pizza. Best dive bar in town. We all cannot come to Vegas without stopping in for Fat Boy and wings. This place is a must try, I promise you won't be disappointed.

Naked City Pizza is a smoky dive bar that happens to serve up some pretty tasty pizzas! We enjoyed a very good pizza with pepperoni, sausage, roasted pepper, onion, olives, mozzarella and red sauce. The pizza was fired in a brick oven and the crust was great. The pizza logs were also very good. Service was excellent. Prompt and friendly. Naked City seems like a good place to get some eats, have a drink, and hang-out.

Tried to order online for delivery but the site was down. Ok, no problem, I called instead to place the order. They said delivery can only be arranged if you ordered online. I explained that the site wasn't working, which is why I called in the first place, and asked if they could arrange the delivery anyway. The woman on the phone was exceptionally rude, saying "Lady, I just told you it wasn't possible". Annoyed, I said fine. By this point though she said she didn't have time for this and hung up on me! Wow - I'm so disappointed and will avoid this place going forward. Too bad.

Great pizza, plain and simple. High quality ingredients with a lot of flavor. We got the Guinnea's Pie. Pizza with Meatballs, and spinach. It was phenomenal. We also got the stuffed peppers. Way too much food but with keeping the leftovers.   I have to admit, the fact that it is located in a bar was a plus. I love dive bars so I enjoyed the vibe. It was also a nice change of pace to be in a kid free environment for a little bit.

I have friends that seem to frequent this place rather often.  I often see posts about them going there, without me, and I will be honest I get a little agitated. I have to tell myself that them getting it at 10pm or later is a good reason for me not to feel too bad about being excluded, but it stings.   Maybe I have low standards for atmosphere, but I just do not care how a place looks as long as they produce good quality food and I am not in immediate danger of getting shanked. It is true that this establishment is located in a poorly light bar, but the drinks are cheap and the food more than makes up for it.  I have only been there once, and I can only think about how delicious the Guinea's pie was. For me, the true test of a pizza is whether I am willing to eat it's crust. I am not a huge fan of crust because it can be too doughy or dry. With Naked City Pizza, I found that I was not a particular fan of the middle slices of the rectangular pizza because there was no contrast to the gooey toppings. This would be one of the first times that I did not force myself to eat the crust and just enjoyed it.   The wings, I love wings and seem to always be in the mood for them. Ordering with friends that do not handle spicy food too well, we decided to go with hot instead of suicide. I found them to be delicious, although not as fiery as I would like. They still proved too hot for the sensitive individuals in our party, so watch out. When I get the chance I would hope to try the suicide and confirm if they are something to write about.   We also had the cobb salad in a vain attempt to justify everything else we ordered. The crispy cuts of bacon, chunks of blue cheese and dressing was just a reminder of how delusional we were.   The meal might not have been the healthiest thing for us, but it was delicious nonetheless.

Don't know of anything else here but their pizza is damn good. It's not the traditional round pie, it's square but it doesn't have super thick crust like Sicilian pizza.  We get the medium size which is called "Not So Wee", good size for dinner plus left overs. We've tried the "Fat Boy"  with Salami, pepperoni, ham, Italian sausage, roma tomato, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil and red sauce.   If you like a meaty pie, this is for you! Our latest order was for "The Stinger" with Chicken fingers, sirloin steak, mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese, bleu cheese, sweet and hot peppers and onions. I could actually do without the steak, it was more like the meat you get on a cheesesteak, it didn't do much for the taste. We got the fingers on the pie with medium hot sauce, it was yummy. I dipped mine in some ranch dressing. I dig this pie.  We order by phone for pick up, it takes a bit of time to make these massive pies so don't expect it to be done in 15 minutes. Staff is friendly and helpful. Seems like a popular place to hang out on the weekends, parking lot is packed when we've gone.

Saw the promo on Dinners Drive ins and Dives.  Don't know what the fuzz was!  Was just OK!  BTW, GPS indicated there were two pizzerias.   One we went to was a bar/pizzeria.  I don't like the bar scene so this was a let down for me.

I'm from buffalo ny, and this is a buffalo themed bar. They have a menu dedicated to the bar foods and amazing foods of buffalo. I tried the chicken wings which were spot on and reminded me more of duffs wings than anything and I loved them. The pizza was just OK, they had the grease cups which are the norm on buffalo branded pizza shops.. however if I was in Buffalo I would rank it low on the pizza scale. We tried the poutine which is fries with gravy and cheese curds and that was delicious. Also the stinger sub which was also delicious and reminded me of the big sloppy subs of the wny areas. The also had local drink favorites such as loganberry drink and of course Labatt blue beer. I still gotta go back and try the tacos as they have a dedicated taco shop next door. Give this place a try soon.

Naked City Pizza Shop, hidden inside Moon Doggies Bar.    I've been to Moon Doggies a few times over the years.  It's a nice dive bar with real character.  It's a good change in a town where it's hard to find such places.  Going here is a little intimidating the first time around, but definitely a fixture to this city.  Naked City is a welcomed addition to Moon Doggies; the previous pizza place that leased the kitchen was not that great and left the watering hole void of food offerings for a few years.    This was my 2nd visit to Naked City, and we just can't seem to get away from the daily specials that the chef has to offer.  (The chef is also the owner, waiter, delivery driver, and busser)    The special on our first visit was a hot roast beef dip.  The thing that set this apart from your average French Dip was the addition of horse radish sauce and a roll seasoned and toasted like garlic bread.  This was excellent.  The beef was also unique; it was roasted in house and cut thick, but still remained tender.  I hope this special becomes a regular item.  The second visit we tried the pulled pork Bolognese.  Extremely flavorful, but may be too bold for some.  This was a deliciously refined dish, much too soigne to be served in a dive bar.  However, this fancy plate of pasta fit perfectly with the approach of Naked City, offering unexpectedly great food in a blue collar setting.    We also tried a few of the regular menu items between the past two visits:  The medium wings were very flavorful, but had a sweet note to them.  I'm a simple guy when it comes to me, so it wasn't my cup of tea.  The garlic knots were excellent, I really recommend.  The "Naked City" Pizza is very well executed.  We also tried the Poutine.  The Poutine is a must have and needs to go on everyone's bucket list as a must try before they die.  Naked City is losing a star for the location.  Food is amazing, but the neighborhood is a little scary, and the bar is extremely smoky.  I must also warn everyone, do NOT order soda from the bar, I don't think they have every changed or cleaned their soda lines in 20 years.  Stick with the hard liquor or beer.

We had the 1/4 sheet Guinea pie and the suicide fries that were featured on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. I don't usually (let's just say can't handle spicy food) eat super spicy food, but I just wanted to give the fries a try. $5.00 for a small fries which is like a super large at most or almost all fast food fries. It was spicy but I was able to handle it. I can't say much about the Guinea Pie because my taste buds were over powered by the hotness of the fries. However, I do have left overs.   I was disappointed that they don't have fountain drinks, had to get a can of coke. Nothing wrong with it, but by the time my food came out my coke was warm and there's no ice. I like my drinks ice cold. Also, expect to wait, I ate at the family side not at the bar. As we wait for our food, our server goes in and out of the restaurant and to the bar to drop off orders and pick up food.

Great pizza.  Lousy business. They just decided to stop serving at 11pm.  Major fail.  This town is a 24 hr town. I've made a ritual of getting naked city pizza at least 2 times a month after work. I work second shift. Off at 1130 pm.  Wtf!  This will hurt MoonDoggie's bar business too.  It's just bad business.  Basically a F U to anyone on second shift!! I've seen this literally kill other badly managed business here in Vegas. At l say stay open till 1am or 2!!   Who is this lazy and stupid?
Love their pizza best in Vegas, I snap chatted pics, we live in North Las Vegas but will come way over here to order and drive back home

Update review. Haven't been here in a year or so so we decided to have some late night pizza over at Naked City. We ordered Back Home Pie, chicken wings and Paper Bag Zeppoles. The Back Home Pie was greasy as hell, omg I broke out looking at it, the crust was good but the sauce just soaked up all of the center pieces. I had one piece and that's all I could swallow. The chicken wings were average. The Paper Bag Zeppoles were gross and we threw it out. The costumer service was great, but probably won't be ordering the Back Home Pie or Paper Bag Zeppoles again. Now I have heart burn along with a broken heart.   Update #3: Maybe... third times the charm? Um... nope from 2 to 1 star. And it really sucks because I really wanted to love this place.  I wanted to tell my friends this was an awesome spot to go to. We ordered a pizza to bring to a friend's house warming party but it was mistakenly made at the wrong location. One thing which would have solved this problem was when they answered the phone they followed their greeting with the location. Once we went to pick up our pizza they explained to us that they didn't have it and they wanted us to drive to the other location to get it. We weren't going to drive 30 minutes out of our way to get the pizza so we wanted to reorder the pizza. The guy refused to make us the pizza... told us he was wasting product. I want to point out that his reaction was of a man who had this kind of thing happen to him all of the time. They also had a slice of the day deal and they could have easily sold the other pizza. We ended up going to metro pizza.   I don't know why we keep on trying to go here. The place is filled with smoke because they are located in a bar. I think they are separate because I always get good service from the bartender. I'm an ex-smoker so I am extra sensitive to the smoke.

Well I specifically picked this place because it was featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.  The show featured the Suicide Fries and the Guinea's Pie (Pizza Pie that is).  My husband had the Chicken Finger Pie and I tried the Guinea's Pie b/c I love sausage, spinach and cheese.  This pie is on a delicious chewy crust with a little bit more than a hint of garlic but not too much.  The in-house sausage was good but the combination was just OK.  I think the sauce is creamy enough but no real taste.  Needed a little something.  My husbands Chicken Finger pie was also tasty but not spectacular.  My enjoyment of the pizza was ruined by the smokey smell.  The place is inside a bar,which is dark and kinda icky.  You can't bring your family here b/c children are not allowed in a bar.  I wouldn't go back.  I have followed a lot of DDD featured restaurants and this one did not live up to the hype.  Nice wait staff....not too slow.
The pizza was delicious.  I normally do not like hot wings.  But they were really good. Nice,  and crispy! My kids loved it so much. They want to go back before we head back to Cali!

Don't judge a place by it's cover, once we got past the outside and our eyes adjusted inside it was a fun little dive to eat at.  The food is delicious.  My husband and I decided to visit NCP after it was featured on TV and it was worth it.  The servings are huge, believe me you want as small as you can get.  We weren't going to get an appetizer, but our waitress suggested the fries and they were delicious.  The pizza was great too, especially the garlic crust, we would definitely go back again. We had great service and enjoyed this place.

I just love this place so much. It never gets old. My absolute favorite Pizza joint in all of Las Vegas. Not cheap but everything is cooked from scratch with quality natural fresh ingredients that you can really taste. It is in this funky dive bar place called Moon Doggies but dont let that put you off. The staff is super polite, efficient and the service is always excellent as is the food here.  :)

Great pizza ; had the Guinea pie which was a nice mix of ingredients. The 1/2 sheet is big enough for 2-3 people.  Don't be scared by the location of this place , nice atmosphere with friendly staff.  (Inside a dive bar).   Will have to visit again to try another pie.

Note: There is more than one location.  I *believe* this is the one that was on DDD.  The other reviews are accurate.  The place is a dive bar, and the bar and pizza bills are separate.  There is a seating area with some video games and a vending machine that sells candy and cigarettes (yes there is a sign on the front door saying nobody under 21 allowed).    The pizza is really great, I got the Guinea (the 'wee' size and it was more than enough for me).  Service is very slow and harried, even in the middle of the day in the middle of the week.  Come here if you are not in a rush.  As I said, the pizza is really great.   I hit this as part of a DDD's tour of the area and I am glad I did.  I would come back with friends if I had a lot of time.  I ate at Naked City around 1PM for lunch and it was still pretty slow,

This place is horrible and the service is bad well let me rephrase that , not! no service, we sat there for about 15 mins and no one even acknowledge that we were there, no water was offer and the employees didn't even speak to us, so we walked out and never coming back to this place, I have no idea what all the hype is about coming here, heard it was a good place to try but they were wrong!

The pizza here tasted terrible! Probably a hotpocket or even little caesar's pizza would've tasted better than this. I order the pepperoni pizza and barely finished one sliced because the crust/ bread tasted like nothing. ABSOLUTELY BLAND!

Bookmarked this place for our Vegas visit during Labor Day weekend after seeing in on DDD, and it did not disappoint!  This review is for our  food "to-go" since we had the kids with us and the bar does not allow anyone under 21.  Also, the bar allows smoking, so even if we could, I don't think we would've dined inside.   We ordered the "Fatboy" pizza which is a meat-lovers dream!!!  I highly recommend it.  We also ordered a wee-size "Pizza Bianco" which was a dissapointment - I'd tried better versions.  But the star of all stars is the "Suicide Fries" as it definitely lived up to the DDD hyped!  I will definitely make an effort to order from this place next time we're in Vegas and look forward to trying other selections.

I would rate them lower if Yelp would let me. I had their pizza once and it was great. However their service is the worst ever. I was craving pizza and I don't often get it let along pizza this pricy but tonight I thought why not. I called no less than ten times and got a busy signal. Someone finally answered and the asked if I could hold a moment. That turned into a 20 minute hold. I finally got upset and hung up I guess they don't need business. I called a nearby competitor and they answered right away and took my order gladly by the way they have a higher Yelp rating. I run a large hotel and could refer business to naked city but after the horrible service I will not recommend. Sad their product is great but either the workers don't care or there is not enough help causing the worst ever service.

This menu is a fat kid's dream come true!!!!!!  Just look at some of the combos and toppings they got on these pizzas!!  This comes pretty close to last meal/end of the world type food for me.    If you have a "cheat day" on your schedule, you might want to make it a "cheat week" after ingesting all these glorious calories, saturated fat and cholesterol at one sitting.  We ordered a full Royal sandwich and the wee (smallest) Guinea pie which is really not wee at all could feed 3 Japanese people for lunch alone.    I now know why The Royal was rated one of the best sandwiches in Vegas last year by LV Weekly.  I loved how they just made the Italian sausage into one huge patty layered with all this cappicola and mozzarella.  A total flavor explosion!  The Guinea pie was equally as awesome with meatballs, spinach and cheese, cheese, cheese.  I really liked the thick crust.    We had no shot at finishing everything but they made for some great leftovers the next day.  Tons of other menu items I look forward to having like "The Stinger" which features chicken fingers, steak, three cheeses, hot & sweet peppers, blue cheese and lettuce in one sandwich!!  What??????  That's Man vs Food type shiznit right there!  I also dug all the rock music they played in the bar.  Service was very friendly too.  This is also a Buffalo Bills bar so be warned.

Best Pizza I've had in Vegas!! bar none, hands down. Wings were hot yet eatable, Been living in Vegas about a month and a half now and this place has it all from good music playing, very chill environment to eat some great food. I  would give it a 5 stars only if they added more beer on tap.
Oh my this place is a diamond in the ruff..amazingly deelish food!!

Inconsistent product, $33 bucks for a large pizza and you never know what you're going to get I ordered 3 times now and the pizza has been thick crust the first time, the second time someone must have dropped the container of red pepper flakes in the sauce insanely over the top spicy and the third time I received a thin crust with no sauce. It sounds crazy but true. This place claims it's a Buffalo Pizza shop, I lived in Buffalo for 20 years, this joint would never make it anyplace in WNY
Pizza is delicious. The crust is light and buttery. We also tried the suicide fries. Wow, very hot but so good. Even though your mouth is burning, the flavor is so good.

My husband teases this is the whole reason we drove 6 hours to Las Vegas.  Their meatball pizza is beyond amazing.  Don't let the dive-ey appearance turn you away, this place is a gem.  Pizza is rectangle and hubby and I fight over the corner pieces.  Honestly the best pizza ever.
So good. We eat here every time we are in town. The Bianca is amazing and so are the Suicide Fries

The food was decent but while I waited 20 minutes for the food I ordered 20 minutes in advance before I got here I asked the bartender very nicely if I could have a glass of water (prepared to tip her $5-10 since obviously you're not charging me for water. With a ridiculous attitude, as if I was bothering her, she told me to "just give her a second". Then sat there on her phone, followed by asking every single patron at the bar if they needed anything. I mean, really? It's a desert. It was 117 today, and I'm bothering you asking for a water when I just spent $40 dollars at your resteraunt? Yeah - me and my people will never be spending our money in this dive again.

(If you're at a hotel, use Postmates to have them deliver to you)  + Friendly phone-service + Not bad of a price for what you get!  My group and I were in Vegas for EDC weekend, and were staying at the Vdara. While this establishment doesn't deliver, you can use a 3rd party service called Postmates to have the pizza/food delivered to you.. even if you stay at a hotel! I didn't know any of this until the employee told me about this. The whole system worked really well!  We ordered the super big pizza, I forgot which.. but it came out to around $45? Not bad really if everyone is putting in. The pizza got to us in a timely manner and it tasted REALLY good. Next time we're in town, no doubt I'd be here ordering from them again. Thanks for keeping us full!

Sketchy as can be. This is a place for drunk/high people to come play video games and eat pizza. This isn't a place for tourists who "want to find something local." Avoid this place, especially during lunch when only one employee is here and the service sucks. Also, the pizza is no better than a hot pocket. Save your time and money eat elsewhere.

Delicious food! During my most recent visit, I shared a large order of loaded potato fries and a 1/4 sheet Guinea Pie with a friend. I would recommend both of those dishes to any and everyone. The crust on their pizzas is amazing - like soft garlic bread. The environment is really casual. We had Renee as our waitress and she was funny and attentive. Definitely a place to try.

Not the best pizza in the world, nor the worst. Definitely something that I will not remember unless I come back and read this post and go, oh, I ordered pizza that night.  I really came here because I heard that they served poutine, which I first had eaten whilst in Canada on one of my many Detroit Adventures.  Poutine was good, no complaints, but again, much like the pizza, kind of forgettable. After this week is over, the chances I even remember the name of this place is slim to none. They were not good enough to remember and they were not bad enough to stand out.

Awesome service from the owner.  OPEN MIC COMEDY SHOW on Wednesdays for dinner.  What an awesome idea!!  RadioVegas.Rocks put on a great comedy show.  Was a fantastic evening and a great price for all the food I ate and brought home.   Chopped salad was incredible!!!!  Pizza was kick ass and that buffalo chicken dip was worth fighting for.   SEE YOU NEXT WEDNESDAY!!!!

1 star just because there is no option for zero.  Took forever and only to get the order wrong at the entire table.  No flavor and just not good at all.  I've never disliked a pizza ever and this place shut me down.  Way to expensive for any meal let alone bad food.  Was displeased from the start to the end.  It was so bad I just now decided to sign up for yelp just to make this post.  I'll take a $5 hot and ready before here.  Get Bent
One of the better pizzas in Las Vegas. They have some great specialty pizzas to try. Good for grab-n-go. Having kids, we always have to go pick it up and take it home since it's in a bar.

Yum!!  So, we decided to order pizza at work and really wanted Naked City.  We'd heard so many great things about the pizza and were seriously salivating after looking at the menu online.  The location on Paradise is closest to us, so we tried to place an order online.  The website is horrible and wouldn't allow us to place an order, so I called.  Unfortunately, the person I spoke with was totally clueless. She said she didn't think they had a delivery driver yet and to call back in 15 minutes or to try the other (this) location.  So, I called the Arville location.  The young lady I spoke with was very friendly, but said that we were out of their delivery area.  I explained the situation and how the Paradise location had bascially said they couldn't help us, even though we are less than a mile from them.  The kitchen manager ended up getting on the line and she was awesome.  I explained to her what happened and she said that, although they typically don't deliver to our area, they would take our order and get everything straightened out.  We placed a fairly large order:  Pizza logs - Hand rolled egg roll wrappers stuffed with pepperoni, mozzarella and red sauce. These were good, but VERY greasy. Beware.  Also, the cheese was not evenly distributed and the red sauce was on the side (for some reason I expected it to be inside).  Guinea's Pie - Featured on Diners, Drive Ins & Dives Meatballs, spinach, ricotta, white garlic sauce and mozzarella cheese. VERY good.  Although I had to add red pepper flakes for a little spice.  Steak and Cheese Pizza - Sirloin steak, three cheese mix, sweet and hot peppers, onion and white garlic sauce. My favorite that we ordered! It was really good and super cheesy and the jalapeno added good heat.  Fatboy Pizza - Salami, pepperoni, ham, Italian sausage, roma tomato, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil and red sauce. My least favorite. Not because it was bad, but it was just typical pizza. The other 2 pizzas were somewhat unique, and this wasn't. It was good, but just didn't compare to the others.  Overall, it was expensive (basically $90 for everything, including delivery fee and tip). Not something we would order often, but the 3 "not so wee" sized pizzas were HUGE and we still have leftovers.  I am really happy that Nicole, the kitchen manager agreed to assist us. Unlike the Paradise location, she didn't turn us away and was happy to make things right.  It's things like that that will make me order again.

Saw this on TV, decided to try some off-the-strip eat joints.  Was difficult to find, did not know it was going to be co-located inside of a dive bar.  But the dive bar was pretty cool and laid back.  Got a huge huge pizza for $24 that 3 of us could not finish.  We took the leftovers with us and still munched on them on the strip the next day.  Cheap, good pizza.

This little local secret is hidden inside Moon Doggies. If you are getting pizza from them I recommend the smallest size.. more than enough for one, its great to share. They have a couple off the wall pizzas which are pretty dang tasty. I won't give out any directions to the place... you just have to hope you are lucky enough to stumble upon it!

I'm a fan :) Ordered over the phone and picked up some grub today. I got a wee guinea pig pie, 10 piece mild wings, and a caesar salad($30). You go into Moondoggies and go past the bar and there's a little window to the left where you can pay and they bring out your food. Food was great! There was a ridiculous amount of croutons on the salad...103 to be exact (yea I counted em lol) I dunno if it was an accident or if that's normal here! I kinda wish it wasn't in a bar so I could bring the whole family but I guess take-out will have to do for now!
Naked City is always a stop every time I am in Vegas!! I can't wait till I get to go back in  September.  But please bring back the Philly Cheese steak rolls!!!!

Divey. That's all: divey.  The restaurant was closed when we arrived at 6:30 on a Sunday night but moon doggies next door is open til 3am and has a window to order. We opted to eat in and I have mixed feelings about the experience. For one: the pizza was really yum so credit where credit is due. But two: moon doggies is the epitome of a dive bar and I can't really get on board with a place that allows smoking within the establishment.  For pizza, I'd recommend the Guinea Pie, which was featured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives. I believe we also got the Naked City Pizza, just for classic's sake. The pizzas themselves are okay. Vegas is full of delicious pizza and I can't in good conscience say that this was the best one I've had while in sin city. That being said, the pizza here is pretty solid so if you can handle the secondhand smoke and sticky floors, you're in for a real treat.  Note: also featured on triple D was the suicide fries which--for those that have a propensity for spicy foods--would probably be at the top of the "to-try" list while stopping in.  Parking is available in a small adjacent lot. The area is not the safest so if you're stopping in late late then make sure you bring a buddy! (Or two, or three.. there's a bar here you could actually just hang out for a while).

Best pizza on earth.  I usually hit the one on Paradise on the way to the airport but Arville is inside one of the best dive bars on earth.   See the reviews of Moon doggies for more info.    This pizza is crazy good.  I live in Oakland California and we have good pizza but I always pine for Naked City.  The crust the cheese the farging sauce oh the sauce!   For some reason these cats make it to perfection and I can't get that anywhere else.    Get to naked city pizza and get a sheet of cheese and sit at the bar with a big glass of beer and eat that pizza pie before I do!   Life is short, eat that pizza!  They deliver via postmates which freaking rules, but you should still go there in person and smell it while you wait for it.  Have a beer.  Talk to people.  And when it's ready have a slice or two at the bar and make people jealous!
Left on hold for fifteen minutes and then hung up on only to find out they didn't have a delivery driver available. Do not waste your time with this place

Four stars because the food was fantastic! The service however was absolutely terrible! We were not given plates, napkins, or any utensils. My wife had an empty drink for 25 minutes before the server made it back to the table to check up. We had the suicide fries and she had nothing to wash it down or cool off her palette. Fries were great and the Guinea pie was the best pie I ever had in Vegas but next time we will get it to go!

April 27, 2013 Saturday - dinner 6:30 PM 4 adults   Atmosphere - 4 stars Food - 5 stars Service - 5 stars  Background - We are here because of Food Networks Diners, Drive Up and Dives.  The bonus is that is a Buffalo NY pizza place!  I was born in Buffalo and visit my family out there, I wish I could visit more often.  Atmosphere - A bar with a kitchen.  As we walked up I noticed a sign indicating you must be over 21 to enter.  Very rare in Nevada, I do not think I have seen a sign like this since my last visit to North Dakota.  So a cozy dimly lit place filled with Buffalo Bills and Sabres stuff.  We sat at a curved booth and noticed right away that the table would rock badly if any weight was put on it.  Food   Drink - Normally I do not comment on it but since this all about Buffalo I will.  So I asked if they had Genny, for those who don't know that is Genesse out of Rochester NY.  They did not have it.  So she started listing off so common Canadian beers that you can get in Buffalo.  Then she said Loganberry, my wife said I lit up like a kid on Christmas day.  It is a hybrid berry that they make into a drink, I love it!    Appetizer - Wings of course, 20, two orders, a hot and medium.  I think we got all hot which was fine with me.  Good size, all had a good amount of meat on them.     My Main Course - Duh pizza!  We got a half tray.  Memories of eating pizza in Buffalo in my Aunt and Uncle's house flood me.  The tray reminds of grade school of lunch room pizza, this aint that pizza!  We ordered half pepperoni and half cheese.  The best thing about Buffalo pizza is that the pepperoni's, they are tiny compared to standard pepperoni.  When they cook they curl up to hold the grease.  These little pieces are heaven on a bed of cheese.  The pizza was loaded with cheese and was so gooey.     Dessert - Really I gorged myself on pizza!  Service - 0ne waitress worked about 8 tables, and she worked it!  Bonus is that she is from Buffalo!  Future - I can see future visits to this place on my visits to Vegas!

I love this pizza very juicy and savory taste, doesn't taste like regular pizza huts if you know what I mean. I've been coming here since I moved to Vegas 2 years ago. I gave it a 4 because the last time I was there the food wasn't all that great, I got 2 pizzas, garlic fries, wings, and garlic knots. Which was okay I didn't really enjoy it though.

Drove by this place several times on my way to work, finally decided to check it out for lunch.  Didn't realize before that the restaurant itself was IN the bar, but it really wasn't that bad.  It's a little dark, but the place isn't horrible to be in overall.    Ordered a "Wee" sized pepperoni pizza which was HUGE.  It fed me and my girlfriend and we still had two slices left over.  I caught a glimpse of the famous Suicide fries on the table next to us, so I decided to ask the waitress exactly how hot they were.  She said, on a scale of 1 -10....  she would rate them at a 10 1/2.  She offered me a sample of the suicide sauce that the fries are smothered in and I accepted.   Just a small taste of the sauce warmed my entire mouth and my throat.  The sauce tasted amazing and despite the heat, I still couldn't resist dipping some of my pizza crust in it throughout the meal.   Since my girlfriend doesn't appreciate spicy food like I do, we went with an order of the garlic fries.  You could tell they were homemade and they were AMAZING.  Hot salty fries with fresh garlic and covered in Parmesan Cheese and spices.  Took one star off because of the service.  The waitress was really nice, but she never asked us if we wanted a drink until our food was almost gone, and I couldn't get her attention at all throughout the meal. Seeing that my mouth was still on fire from the suicide sauce, I almost jumped the bar to get my own.  However, when she did come over she was really nice and was quick to help us when she did finally notice.   Also, place was really cheap.  We ordered the Wee sized pizza, two drinks and some garlic fries and the total was $20.  Being that I live so close, I will definitely be coming back here to watch some football games, enjoy a beer and get some amazing food.

My buddy recommended this place so we went down here. First off, I'm not a big pizza guy. Yes I know, that's weird. Everyone loves pizza. Me, not so much. Its crust, its sauce, its meat, its cheese.   Rolled in here Valentine's night at 6pm. There was maybe 6 people there in this dive bar called Moondoggies. Not a bad place. There's a little window toward the back of the bar that houses the pizza kitchen. We sat at the bar, ordered some beers, and the bartender took our pizza order.  I ordered the bacon and egg pizza, my friend the marghertia pizza. The wee one is $13 and contains 6 squares (not slices) but its plenty filling as I could only eat two before being full. I found the flavor delicious, the crust was thick but cooked right. It was a pretty good pizza.  The bartender was excellent, very entertaining, and kept up with the crowd as the place filled up to capacity within a half hour. It took about 40 minutes for our pizza to get done which is a little long, but they were doing lots of take out orders as well as servicing the customers in the bar.   I will definitely come back and eat here again.

I walked inside of naked city pizza and went to the order window.  As I got there, a guy walked past and asked if we had our IDs. He then walked in the back and started preparing food without washing his hands.  I then saw him drop an avacado, pick it up and start cutting it without washing it off first.  I immediately walked out after.  Can't believe the lack of cleanliness I just witnessed.

Great place to go if you want to wait for over an hour for a small pizza. We asked our waitress if they had forgotten about us -- we got no answer -- 25 mins later our pizza comes without any sort of apology. Not even a smile or a thank you. Will not be returning.

Stopped here one night just to try the suicide fries and they definitely live up to their name -- Really, really spicy! The ranch dipping sauce they come with is necessary to cool down the hotness. They were good, but I didn't love them. The pizza looked really good so I'd go back to try that.

We wanted to hear this after seeing it on DDD Foodnetwork. We got a large pizza, stuffed mushrooms and suicide fries. The pizza was ok. Lots of dough and not a ton of flavor, but not bad. Disappointed with the muschrooms. They were very small and not stffed with much and you don't get that many either. I did not try the suicide fries because they're too hot for me, but my boyfriend liked them. I don't think we would come back here again. There are way to many great restaurants in Vegas.

This place has a bar immediately next to the pizza joint. I wasn't able to see the bar so I'm only reviewing my sit down food experience.   Pizza- 3 stars. I had their pizza that was featured on food network. I can't remember what it was called but it was average for me. I wasn't too fond of their crust, and I'm a huge crust person and picky.   Pizza logs-4 stars. The pepperoni and cheese inside the egg roll, combined with their delicious marinara sauce was absolutely amazing.   Loaded potato fries- 5 stars. I got a "small" and this thing was huge. He fires were sooooooo crispy on the outside and perfect in my book on how crunchy yet soft they were. Even with all the toppings, it managed to not get the fries soggy. Yesssssssss, sooooo awesome.    I'll definitely be back for the pizza logs and fries without a question. Dare I say hose fries are one of the best I've had in my life. The service is slow, and the wait was about 15 minutes before we got all our food. It's a good place to just do a takeout, or probably order food from the bar side.

Phenomenal pizza at this off-strip local dive bar. The saus-eeege on our pizza mirrored that of a gyro meatball, and...was...goooooood. LET IT RIDE! at the bar-side video poker machines, drink for free, and be sure to order some 'za before your Uber ride back to the strip. Naked City is a great local tap to wind down, fuel up (or soak up), and enjoy the subtleties of the quiet side opposite the bright lights and arduous Strip plights.

MMMMM YUMMY. This is for sure one of my favorite pizza spots to enjoy a delicious and hearty pizza! I love the Guinea pie which is my favorite and I crave it a lot. They have yummy roasted garlic buns that are stuffed with garlic which are Amazing. The pepperoni and pineapple is really good as well.
