I always enjoy the food and atmosphere and I love tasty pizza and a blue moon with oranges. This is a great place to eat which is always in my dining out rotation!
Tried the wings and was pretty well disappointed. Sauce was forgettable and the homemade blue cheese sucked. Watery and totally lacking in flavor. Salad and celery sticks were dreadful and wilted.

Taste: 3.5 Creativity/Authenticity: 3 Atmosphere: 2.5 Service: 3 Bang for your buck: 2.5  The GF was craving pizza and our buddies who live down the street recommended this place... thank you guys cause this pizza was delicious. Started with the pizza log good but very greasy literally the grease leaked through 2 paper plates onto the table; next we order 2 pizza dunno why got the guinie and pineapple pizza both were great very bold flavors on the guinie i liked the meatball paired with the very flavorful cheese. Best thing about this place probably the cheap drinks IM from LA so 2 beers is about $14, here $5 so im a happy camper. Overall like this place for the food the atmosphere is kinda weird tucked away in dive bar but still worth going Ill be back

I had what I saw on DDD., LOL!!!   The suicide wings and Guinea pie.  Both did not disappoint.   There is also a full bar next door so one can choose the appropriate adult beverage to go with their meal.  The only thing is that it is not in the best neighborhood.  While I was there a "customer" kept trying to sell myself and other customers razors out of a plastic bag.  The nice young lady finally said something to him, but at this point many of us had already felt uncomfortable enough to cut our meals short.

Naked City opened up a few weeks ago and I've wanted to try it when a friend showed me their website.  I'm very glad I did.  First off, the place is tiny.  There are a few stools and a bar to eat at so you should consider take out if you're with a larger group or if it's during the rush.  I tried the Naked Royal which is a warm sandwich with Italian sausage, hot capicola, and fresh mozzarella cheese.  It was fantastic.  Great balance of flavor between the sausage and capicola.  It's served with your choice of homemade pickle, various pasta or potato salads, and homemade pickled vegetables.  These guys make everything fresh on site except the bread.  Sides, pickles, and even freshly roasted deli meats.  As such, the choice of sandwiches is small but that's good because they can focus on quality.  I highly recommend trying this place.  It's the sort of owner operated joint focusing on freshness that Vegas needs.

For delivery I ordered the naked city pizza and philly cheese steak rolls.  Soooooooooo good!!  The dough was fresh and there wasn't an abundance of tomatoe sauce.  The cheese steak rolls were ridiculously delicious.   Can't wait to try their other pizzas and treats!!   This place is a must eat!
Good food. Will definitely eat here again.  My only complaints: Suuuuuuper flimsy paper plates and soda by the can - no refills :(

great food inside moon doggie's sports bar(?) and video poker. yeah not a fancy part of town, yeah not a fancy place (really is a dive), Buffalo Bills and Sabers decor all over (should be a 5 star just for that!) BUT the food is terrific. The guinea pizza is yummy with the fresh, chewy mozarella and the crust to crunch on! When they say hot chicken wings, believe them and order milk! But still tasty while dripping from the heat! Not daring enough to try the suicide fries but the garlic fries had the same texture that made in n out famous. By the way, the portions are outrageously huge!!!! the 'Wee' size (smallest) could easily feed a family of four. Then save room for the canoli for a dessert lovers dream. Not too sweet, just delicious!

It was alright. I just didn't taste the amazingness in the wings. They arrived in a Togo box, more than 25 minutes after they were ordered and they were soggy. I was willing to give these baked/fried wings a chance but they just didn't do it for me, and I tried 3 different types of wings, Sicilian, medium and BBQ. Sicilian was by far the best. I did however order a steak and cheese that was fire! Steak was seasoned perfect and it had the right amount of spice. The pizza was good because the cheese was perfectly cooked on the top but the crust wasn't all that. It was an experience all together but somewhat inconvenient for dine-in and the trip to the bar next door for drinks was just odd. Luckily, they have a friendly service crew to keep the hungry patrons happy while they wait.

Holy pizza! This place really amazed me. Wasnt in the mood to go out and get some mediorce pizza but what the hell, I did it anyways. Showed up around 1 am ordered pizza thru this little  hole in the wall. Literally. Gave it personality.  Got a beer while I was waiting with Aaron I believe. Chill guy.  Got home and had the pizza.  This thing was f@$@$ awesome. Will go back and bring friends to drink and family to eat.

This spot is always first on my list for a delicious pie when I come into Vegas.  Food is fresh and hot and the flavors hit every note.  I've been at least 8 times in the last couple years and it has always been amazing.  I suggest the guinea pie or the 51*.

Best pizza in Vegas. Very cool little dive bar that we would have never known about if it weren't for Triple D!   Service is excellent. Food is excellent and the beers are cold and the Raider game was on every tv. My kinda place!

Great service from Bartender. Had the Royal sandwich, which was delish on first few bites, but then it became kind of one-note. Just taste the salty sausage and not much else. They need to add pickled veggies or something to counterbalance the saltiness of the sausage. Overall, cant complain too much since it was a great value at $10. Don't go here for the Ambiance though.

Let me start by saying that I did see this place on DDD. My girl and I make it a point to try at least one place recommended in a City by Guy. It's killing me that people are slamming this place for being a Dive, when they were warned, told, cautioned or whatever Word you want to use, that its a Dive. Sorry, I hate bad reviews for an Owner trying to make it and somebody slams his dream and future success for nothing. Rant over. That night we had a Wee size Steak and Cheese Pizza, Ceaser salad (small) and Sicilian flavored wings. The Pizza was very good to judge it by Pizza Hut standards is just not fair. This Pizza from dough to oven looks hand made and the taste is the same. The cheese could have more generous but the flavor for what we had was amazing just as it was. The salad was good. Not your typical Ceasar but very good. Now lets talk about the wings, THE SICILIAN WINGS WERE ARGUABLY THE BEST FLAVOR COMBINATION I HAVE EVER TASTED. we had an order of 8 and as stuffed as we were I wish we had ordered more. Do yourself a favor and try them. Ambiance was as a Bar should be. Minus the Bills decor ( Saints fan here) lol. We can't wait to go back and this time we'll skip the salad to make room for more Wings. Or maybe just order more wings. Lol. Great place. Service was just as you would get in a Bar and very knowledgable about the Menu. Try this place. If you have kids order ahead and take it back to your Hotel, you won't be sorry.

Came here for a late lunch on Saturday. Both the Moon Doggies bartender and waitress for the NCP seating area were friendly. The two of us ordered the stuffed mushrooms, he ordered the beef on weck, and I tried a slice of the pepperoni (I like to order a piece of just cheese or pepperoni to test how tasty a place's most basic pizzas are without adding other flavors into the mix yet).  For the stuffed mushrooms, $9 seemed kind of steep for 6 small ones. They were decently tasty, & accompanied by a creamy sauce & strips of mild peppers, but I wouldn't pay $9 for them again.  The beef on weck resembled what it was supposed to be, though the meat was thinner & more overcooked than you'd usually see, it didn't come with any horseradish or a pickle, and the bun didn't seem to have been dipped in au jus (all normal hallmarks of this type of sandwich). Overall, it was a fairly boring version of beef on weck that neither of us would likely get again.  The pepperoni pizza had two kinds of cheeses -- a bottom layer of sliced cheese that tasted like provolone, and shredded mozzarella sprinkled on top, only partially melted. It felt and tasted overall like an undercooked frozen pizza. I wouldn't order it again, either. Though it was a good size (TWSS), and it wasn't the worst $2.50 slice of pizza I've ever had (the dough/crust is pretty nice; soft on the inside, with a crustier outside), it was no higher than a 3-4 out of 10.  For now, I'll award a 3 and hope that when I'm able to return and try a specialty pizza, it'll warrant keeping that score.

This place is small, only a few tables and it's in a dive bar where people are allowed to smoke.  I've only been during the week for work lunches so no beers with my pizza:(the poutine was really rich and filling.  The largest size pizza on the menu is baked in a restaurant baking sheet - if you've worked in a restaurant you understand. It's a HUGE - way more than 4 people could eat. Guineas pie and chicken wing dip were awesome!

My friend ordered two pizzas from here for her party and seriously hands down this was one of the best pizzas I've ever had! My favorite was the Guinea Pig pizza. It was like God created a pizza and gave the recipe to the owner. Too bad I don't have a photo because it looks Tate's as delicious as it looks!!

The pizza here is excellent. Only came here because saw it was on the DDD show on food network, and can say am very happy! While normally would subtract star for the typical bar feel, the pizza more than made up for that.   Had one with sausage, pepperoni, garlic crust, And couple other things. Was really awesome! Even the "small" size could only eat half of it, but took it back and ate rest for dinner.   Will come back again!! Unless find better pizza place in the area, but unlikely

Groupon alert!  As a Groupon addict, I'm always excited when they offer one for a place I've been dying to try.   We decided to order a pizza for takeout, since we were feeling pretty lazy after an exhausting weekend of doing nothing. I decided on a Not so Wee Royal and a Wee garlic fries. I was tempted by the Poutine, but I'm just not a big fan of gravy and cheese. I ordered the pizza on the well-done side based on some previous reviews about the pizza being under or unevenly cooked.   When I got the pizza home, I was excited to take a bite. I didn't find any of the crust or dough issues that previous reviewers had mentioned luckily, so I was happy about that. I adored the texture. It was chewy and I really enjoyed the sauce. The added touch of ricotto was delightful and added a sweet flavor to accompany the savory. I was very happy with this pizza. My fella, on the other hand, wasn't as impressed. He stuck mainly with the garlic fries, which were much more garlicky than I would like. If only they used real garlic instead of garlic salt and I would've been sold!  All in all, I was very happy with my meal here. I have a feeling I won't be eating here too often, unless I go with a friend. Hehe.  I look forward to trying more menu items here sometime soon.

My favorite pizza in Las Vegas. The crust has so much flavor, nice thick cut pepperoni. Wings are fantastic, The fries are great. To me Joes NY is good not great and overpriced about $5 a slice. Metro pizza looks much better then it tastes soggy crust. Tasted better when reheated in toaster oven. Pizza Rock Good but again $5 a slice hit or miss but its good. Naked city not a thin crust ny pie. Go try it its a dive thats part of the appeal of naked city. I grew up in NY but I dont think NY pizza from NY is that good anymore.  Try it you will be hooked and its cheap compared to other pizza in LV

This is hands down the best pizza in Las Vegas! I've never been disappointed here and the bar the pizza kitchen works out of doesn't disappoint either. This is my favorite location since you can enjoy a few drinks with great pizza. I'm a traditionalist so my go to is just a pepperoni pizza, but all of their speciality pizzas are awesome. Their appetizers are incredible, too! I haven't been able to try all of them, but I generally don't leave without the garlic buns. Trust me, they're like nothing you've had before because they're so much better.

This is my absolute favorite place to eat in vegas... Even despite it being in a dive bar.  The poutine fries are so delicious.  And the stinger pizza is my favorite!  Who thought to put boneless wings,  steak, hot and sweet peppers on a pizza with a white sauce?  That white sauce is incredible!!!  Whoever invented this pizza is a genius!  Thank you!

Overall - Highly recommended One of the best pizza places I have had so far and they are open late night apparently and located inside a bar! Definitely a great hangout place.  Parking Pretty spacious could be limited during busy hours but it is inside a bar so might be best to rideshare over.  Service Food is brought out to your table and there is self-service water, utensils and napkins by the door. The bar itself seemed fine people just hanging out and having a good time.  Food Suicide Fries - Not a fan of this. The spicy level is pretty high and I would eat it if it was more flavorful since I enjoy tasty spicy food not spicy just because. The fries themselves were okay. I would definitely pass on this unless you just feel like something spicy. *2 stars*  Guinea Pie - I was pleasantly surprised by the tastiness of the pizza. I was very skeptical when it came out in a square form. The crust reminded me of a thinner version of the now trendy pretzel bun. I think the garlic sauce is what really made this pizza stand out as the best pizza I have eaten thus far. *5 stars*
